missions.localised_description: The Beastmen will only follow a leader who can prove themselves truly capable of shedding the blood of man. Seek out nearby human settlements and lay waste to them, display a fury so great that all Beastmen will yearn to be a part of your warherds!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another herd's Hero has become too much of a hazard. Destroy them - see that they never return.

missions.localised_description: Another herd's Hero has become too much of a hazard. Destroy them - see that they never return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Hero of Chaos has become troublesome. See them dealt with, and remove this threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This Hero of Chaos has become troublesome. See them dealt with, and remove this threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This unfilthy, Uncloven, stunted Dwarf Hero has been allowed to sow trouble for too long. Bury this fool in his caverns - blot out his light.

missions.localised_description: This unfilthy, Uncloven, stunted Dwarf Hero has been allowed to sow trouble for too long. Bury this fool in his caverns - blot out his light.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pompous, self-aggrandising Empire Hero believes himself greater than the herd. Bring him down to size - excise this malignancy for good.

missions.localised_description: This pompous, self-aggrandising Empire Hero believes himself greater than the herd. Bring him down to size - excise this malignancy for good.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This meddlesome Greenskin Hero pesters us, and can no longer be tolerated. Squash this pest underfoot.

missions.localised_description: This meddlesome Greenskin Hero pesters us, and can no longer be tolerated. Squash this pest underfoot.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Beastman Lord is a thorn in our side. See to it that he never again takes arms against us!

missions.localised_description: This Beastman Lord is a thorn in our side. See to it that he never again takes arms against us!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Letting this Lord of Chaos live is no longer an option. Return him to the Ruinous masters - let them decide his final fate!

missions.localised_description: Letting this Lord of Chaos live is no longer an option. Return him to the Ruinous masters - let them decide his final fate!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This tiny Dwarf Lord has caused big problems, but no more. Bring ruin upon him, that he might never make trouble for us again.

missions.localised_description: This tiny Dwarf Lord has caused big problems, but no more. Bring ruin upon him, that he might never make trouble for us again.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A stuffy Empire Lord has become too much of a nuisance to us. Rend his pompous flesh, see him strewn about for feasting!

missions.localised_description: A stuffy Empire Lord has become too much of a nuisance to us. Rend his pompous flesh, see him strewn about for feasting!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Lord has caused too many problems for us - this must stop! Savage him, leave him for dead, and see that he never bothers our herd again!

missions.localised_description: This Lord has caused too many problems for us - this must stop! Savage him, leave him for dead, and see that he never bothers our herd again!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This conniving Greenskin Lord has been too much trouble for too long. Extinguish this pestering ember - leave nought but ashes where once he stood!

missions.localised_description: This conniving Greenskin Lord has been too much trouble for too long. Extinguish this pestering ember - leave nought but ashes where once he stood!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This sallow Lord of the Vampire Counts has been too much trouble for too long. Savage him and see that his Unliving kind never bothers our herd again!

missions.localised_description: This sallow Lord of the Vampire Counts has been too much trouble for too long. Savage him and see that his Unliving kind never bothers our herd again!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is the wise beast who rips apart his foe on the battlefield; other Beastlords will be happy to see him smashed and will respect your strength for doing so.

missions.localised_description: It is the wise beast who rips apart his foe on the battlefield; other Beastlords will be happy to see him smashed and will respect your strength for doing so.

localised_description.last_approved_text: We should fight this enemy on the battlefield. In victory, your power will be undeniable - the other Beastlords will show respect and deference.

missions.localised_description: We should fight this enemy on the battlefield. In victory, your power will be undeniable - the other Beastlords will show respect and deference.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Only the true beast would consider raiding these lands. A swift victory will say much about your worth to the other Beastlords.

missions.localised_description: Only the true beast would consider raiding these lands. A swift victory will say much about your worth to the other Beastlords.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Burning these settlements and destroying the lands around them would show wisdom, lord. Other tribes will revel in the destruction, and like us all the more for it.

missions.localised_description: Burning these settlements and destroying the lands around them would show wisdom, lord. Other tribes will revel in the destruction, and like us all the more for it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another Beastlord is bringing his herd through nearby blood-grounds. If we kill him - and break his horns - his herd will be struck a terrible blow and we will grow stronger.

missions.localised_description: Another Beastlord is bringing his herd through nearby blood-grounds. If we kill him - and break his horns - his herd will be struck a terrible blow and we will grow stronger.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Chaos Lord is driving his armies through our blood-grounds. We will gain great glory and prestige if we smash this army to a bloody pulp!

missions.localised_description: A Chaos Lord is driving his armies through our blood-grounds. We will gain great glory and prestige if we smash this army to a bloody pulp!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A paltry Dwarf Lord is marching his army right into our blood-grounds. They have brought themselves into the hunt - we will gain glory beyond reckoning if we destroy this Dwarfen host.

missions.localised_description: A paltry Dwarf Lord is marching his army right into our blood-grounds. They have brought themselves into the hunt - we will gain glory beyond reckoning if we destroy this Dwarfen host.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A boastful Empire Lord swaggers through our blood-ground. It is an affront! There is man-flesh to rend and rive, and strength to be gained in their devastation!

missions.localised_description: A boastful Empire Lord swaggers through our blood-ground. It is an affront! There is man-flesh to rend and rive, and strength to be gained in their devastation!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Lord dares to march his army through our blood-grounds. Destroy them, break them into pieces, and gain glory and strength through their defeat!

missions.localised_description: A Lord dares to march his army through our blood-grounds. Destroy them, break them into pieces, and gain glory and strength through their defeat!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A mewling Greenskin is leading his pitiful band through nearby lands. Should we smear their pestilence away and squash their march, we will become stronger.

missions.localised_description: A mewling Greenskin is leading his pitiful band through nearby lands. Should we smear their pestilence away and squash their march, we will become stronger.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A corpselike Lord of the Vampire Counts is processes his army of bones through our blood-grounds. Break them apart, send them to a permanent end, gain glory!

missions.localised_description: A corpselike Lord of the Vampire Counts is processes his army of bones through our blood-grounds. Break them apart, send them to a permanent end, gain glory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy Beastlord is a powerful adversary, strong-horned and vicious. Defeating him in a bloody battle, and de-horning him, would be a great achievement, showering us in gore and glory!

missions.localised_description: This enemy Beastlord is a powerful adversary, strong-horned and vicious. Defeating him in a bloody battle, and de-horning him, would be a great achievement, showering us in gore and glory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Chaos Lord has a dark power, giving him skill on the battlefield. If we defeat him, bring true ruin to his force, then the Dark Gods would favour us greatly in return.

missions.localised_description: This Chaos Lord has a dark power, giving him skill on the battlefield. If we defeat him, bring true ruin to his force, then the Dark Gods would favour us greatly in return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Dwarf Lord has great strength for such a small thing and is courageous in combat. Should we best him - and we will - there would be much glory and honour showered upon us.

missions.localised_description: This Dwarf Lord has great strength for such a small thing and is courageous in combat. Should we best him - and we will - there would be much glory and honour showered upon us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This conceited Empire Lord has great strength and is heroic in combat. Stripping him of his vaunted skill, destroying him in battle, will exult us; glory through bloodshed!

missions.localised_description: This conceited Empire Lord has great strength and is heroic in combat. Stripping him of his vaunted skill, destroying him in battle, will exult us; glory through bloodshed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy Lord has great strength and is savage in combat. Killing him in battle -filthy and bloody battle - would be a great achievement, raining glory and strength upon us.

missions.localised_description: This enemy Lord has great strength and is savage in combat. Killing him in battle -filthy and bloody battle - would be a great achievement, raining glory and strength upon us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pernicious Greenskin Lord has surprising strength, racking up many victories. There is great glory in felling such a warrior - we should take it upon ourselves to slay him!

missions.localised_description: This pernicious Greenskin Lord has surprising strength, racking up many victories. There is great glory in felling such a warrior - we should take it upon ourselves to slay him!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This cadaverous Lord of the Vampire Counts has a preternatural power and is towering in combat. Rending his soul from his husk and destroying his ambitions will bring great things to us and the herd.

missions.localised_description: This cadaverous Lord of the Vampire Counts has a preternatural power and is towering in combat. Rending his soul from his husk and destroying his ambitions will bring great things to us and the herd.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy herd shall face the true chosen of Chaos - their Ruinous might shall flow through us as their destruction is wrought upon the battlefield!

missions.localised_description: This enemy herd shall face the true chosen of Chaos - their Ruinous might shall flow through us as their destruction is wrought upon the battlefield!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Chaos force shall experience the power of a fully-armed Beastmen army. Attack at will!

missions.localised_description: This Chaos force shall experience the power of a fully-armed Beastmen army. Attack at will!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This shrunken Dwarf army faces the horrible majesty of the Beastmen! Destroy this force in the name of ruin and madness!

missions.localised_description: This shrunken Dwarf army faces the horrible majesty of the Beastmen! Destroy this force in the name of ruin and madness!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pathetic man-filth Empire army shall be brought to heel; their pomp and pride shall come to naught as they fall before the snarling and smashing of the Beastmen.

missions.localised_description: This pathetic man-filth Empire army shall be brought to heel; their pomp and pride shall come to naught as they fall before the snarling and smashing of the Beastmen.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy army shall face the fury and savagery of a true Beastman army, and they will know our might as they are destroyed!

missions.localised_description: This enemy army shall face the fury and savagery of a true Beastman army, and they will know our might as they are destroyed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This meddlesome Greenskin army shall fall under hoof as we trample this force of pests into nothing more than mud and blood.

missions.localised_description: This meddlesome Greenskin army shall fall under hoof as we trample this force of pests into nothing more than mud and blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Beastmen herd thinks they can encroach on OUR blood-ground. That is not their right. Our land. Our hunt. Our retribution!

missions.localised_description: This Beastmen herd thinks they can encroach on OUR blood-ground. That is not their right. Our land. Our hunt. Our retribution!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Chaos force marches where they are not welcome. The true chosen of the Chaos Gods desire flesh and war, and so we will repulse this invasion!

missions.localised_description: A Chaos force marches where they are not welcome. The true chosen of the Chaos Gods desire flesh and war, and so we will repulse this invasion!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A band of foolish Dwarfs has trudged onto the blood-grounds. They know not what they do, but will feel our wrath all the same!

missions.localised_description: A band of foolish Dwarfs has trudged onto the blood-grounds. They know not what they do, but will feel our wrath all the same!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A presumptuous Empire army marches onto our blood-grounds. In their arrogance, they have invited our terrible fury down upon themselves. Enact that fury. Destroy them!

missions.localised_description: A presumptuous Empire army marches onto our blood-grounds. In their arrogance, they have invited our terrible fury down upon themselves. Enact that fury. Destroy them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: An enemy army has dared to trespass on our blood-grounds. This makes them fair game. To the hunt!

missions.localised_description: An enemy army has dared to trespass on our blood-grounds. This makes them fair game. To the hunt!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A noisome Greenskin force has moronically entered where they are not wanted. Send them back to their huts and hovels and dung. Smash them apart. Destroy them!

missions.localised_description: A noisome Greenskin force has moronically entered where they are not wanted. Send them back to their huts and hovels and dung. Smash them apart. Destroy them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The pallid Vampire Counts have dared to snake their dead, crusty tendrils into our lands. Their graves cannot remain empty for long - see them returned!

missions.localised_description: The pallid Vampire Counts have dared to snake their dead, crusty tendrils into our lands. Their graves cannot remain empty for long - see them returned!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These pallid Vampire Counts shall face true terror beyond their reckoning at our hands; to war, to glory, to feast!

missions.localised_description: These pallid Vampire Counts shall face true terror beyond their reckoning at our hands; to war, to glory, to feast!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another herd has dared challenge us upon the waves. Their fury is no match for ours - send them to the depths!

missions.localised_description: Another herd has dared challenge us upon the waves. Their fury is no match for ours - send them to the depths!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Such small and stunted creatures are not made for the seas. It does not suit their temperament. Show these foolhardy Dwarfs their errors. Flood their senses!

missions.localised_description: Such small and stunted creatures are not made for the seas. It does not suit their temperament. Show these foolhardy Dwarfs their errors. Flood their senses!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The boastful Empire has made a critical mistake in thinking they can best our naval dominance. Show them the true power on the waves. Send them to the deep!

missions.localised_description: The boastful Empire has made a critical mistake in thinking they can best our naval dominance. Show them the true power on the waves. Send them to the deep!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This force has made the error of thinking they can outclass us at sea. Demonstrate their error - smash their ships apart!

missions.localised_description: This force has made the error of thinking they can outclass us at sea. Demonstrate their error - smash their ships apart!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This snivelling Greenskin force has somehow set themselves to sea. They cannot, nor should not, last long. Hasten their departure from our dominion.

missions.localised_description: This snivelling Greenskin force has somehow set themselves to sea. They cannot, nor should not, last long. Hasten their departure from our dominion.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This ghastly Vampire Count force has made the most grave error of setting themselves against us on the waves. It is a lucky thing that the dead float…

missions.localised_description: This ghastly Vampire Count force has made the most grave error of setting themselves against us on the waves. It is a lucky thing that the dead float…

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Dwarfen lands, their holds and their tunnels, are brimming with plunder. Summon the beasts, call them to war - there is hunting to be done!

missions.localised_description: These Dwarfen lands, their holds and their tunnels, are brimming with plunder. Summon the beasts, call them to war - there is hunting to be done!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Empire lands are full of the rich-blooded and the haughty. Their flesh is fat, and so are their coffers. To battle then, for the prize!

missions.localised_description: The Empire lands are full of the rich-blooded and the haughty. Their flesh is fat, and so are their coffers. To battle then, for the prize!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This blood-ground is ready to be ravaged. Summon the herd, begin the hunt! We take what we want, and leave nothing for the carrion!

missions.localised_description: This blood-ground is ready to be ravaged. Summon the herd, begin the hunt! We take what we want, and leave nothing for the carrion!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Greenskin land is filthy, disgusting and remorseless - it is perfect for us. We lay claim to this land, and all within it!

missions.localised_description: This Greenskin land is filthy, disgusting and remorseless - it is perfect for us. We lay claim to this land, and all within it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Amongst the ash, and bones and towering piles of corpses lie treasures unending. The Beastmen will have these treasures; they can keep the bodies.

missions.localised_description: Amongst the ash, and bones and towering piles of corpses lie treasures unending. The Beastmen will have these treasures; they can keep the bodies.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The more land we conquer, the more territory we own, the larger the force needed to control it. Attract more Gors to the herd; expand our might!

missions.localised_description: The more land we conquer, the more territory we own, the larger the force needed to control it. Attract more Gors to the herd; expand our might!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The oceans are treacherous, fraught with danger for those who do not treat them with respectful caution. The herd must take to the seas - conquer!

missions.localised_description: The oceans are treacherous, fraught with danger for those who do not treat them with respectful caution. The herd must take to the seas - conquer!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs' network of tunnels and stone dares to decry our base majesty! Leave nothing of it for them to salvage - turn stone and bones to dust!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfs' network of tunnels and stone dares to decry our base majesty! Leave nothing of it for them to salvage - turn stone and bones to dust!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This shining, 'civilised' Empire settlement is a brazen affront to the glorious filth of the world! The beasts should ride to defile these pretenders. Call the herd. Destroy man!

missions.localised_description: This shining, 'civilised' Empire settlement is a brazen affront to the glorious filth of the world! The beasts should ride to defile these pretenders. Call the herd. Destroy man!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This settlement cannot be allowed to remain - it is too clean, too pure; it is an insult. Bring it to rubble - bring it to ruin!

missions.localised_description: This settlement cannot be allowed to remain - it is too clean, too pure; it is an insult. Bring it to rubble - bring it to ruin!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Greenskin hovels are disgusting; admirably filthy, but they still cannot be allowed to endure. Remove this unworthy pestilence!

missions.localised_description: These Greenskin hovels are disgusting; admirably filthy, but they still cannot be allowed to endure. Remove this unworthy pestilence!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These desiccated cadavers believe themselves to be the true heirs to the Empire, the true inheritors of 'civilisation' - there is no such thing! Destroy them! DESTROY THEM ALL!

missions.localised_description: These desiccated cadavers believe themselves to be the true heirs to the Empire, the true inheritors of 'civilisation' - there is no such thing! Destroy them! DESTROY THEM ALL!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Gorebull is a powerful and useful Hero of great advantage to us on the blood-grounds!

missions.localised_description: The Gorebull is a powerful and useful Hero of great advantage to us on the blood-grounds!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Bray-Shaman is a deeply mysterious but extremely effective Hero. Stalking the blood-grounds with us, its power could be brought to bear excellently.

missions.localised_description: The Bray-Shaman is a deeply mysterious but extremely effective Hero. Stalking the blood-grounds with us, its power could be brought to bear excellently.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Although brutal melee is always preferable, there is tactical advantage in bombarding our enemies from afar. We do not have enough artillery under our command - this should be rectified!

missions.localised_description: Although brutal melee is always preferable, there is tactical advantage in bombarding our enemies from afar. We do not have enough artillery under our command - this should be rectified!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A powerful division of cavalry is crucial to victory. We are fielding very little cavalry - something that should be addressed!

missions.localised_description: A powerful division of cavalry is crucial to victory. We are fielding very little cavalry - something that should be addressed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The melee is everything! Brutal, bloody, savage combat! We do not have nearly enough melee troops - recruit more with haste!

missions.localised_description: The melee is everything! Brutal, bloody, savage combat! We do not have nearly enough melee troops - recruit more with haste!

localised_description.last_approved_text: We prefer to fight with our hands and our hooves and our teeth, yet there is some advantage in softening up the foe with missile fire before the charge. We do not have enough missile troops - this should be rectified!

missions.localised_description: We prefer to fight with our hands and our hooves and our teeth, yet there is some advantage in softening up the foe with missile fire before the charge. We do not have enough missile troops - this should be rectified!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The bigger the beast, the better the slaughter! There are not enough War Beasts in our herds - recruit more with haste!

missions.localised_description: The bigger the beast, the better the slaughter! There are not enough War Beasts in our herds - recruit more with haste!

localised_description.last_approved_text: War Machines help us tear down the world of man. We are not fielding enough - recruit more War Machines and destroy our Uncloven foe!

missions.localised_description: War Machines help us tear down the world of man. We are not fielding enough - recruit more War Machines and destroy our Uncloven foe!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These underlings think to play above their station. Hah! Smash this snivelling, mewling beast into the dirt!

missions.localised_description: These underlings think to play above their station. Hah! Smash this snivelling, mewling beast into the dirt!

localised_description.last_approved_text: An aberration of the highest order dares to move against us. Let no such nonsense stand - eliminate this beastly agent and be done with it.

missions.localised_description: An aberration of the highest order dares to move against us. Let no such nonsense stand - eliminate this beastly agent and be done with it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Stinkin', stupid Beastmen agent needs to be smashed, crushed, sliced! They'll have to put him back together.

missions.localised_description: Stinkin', stupid Beastmen agent needs to be smashed, crushed, sliced! They'll have to put him back together.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This beastly, uncouth Beastmen agent thinks to tread upon our lands. Drain this fool, leave him for the carrion!

missions.localised_description: This beastly, uncouth Beastmen agent thinks to tread upon our lands. Drain this fool, leave him for the carrion!

localised_description.last_approved_text: If these beasts love war so much, we shall bring war to them and show them the fury of the Ruinous Powers. Fell their general; establish dominance!

missions.localised_description: If these beasts love war so much, we shall bring war to them and show them the fury of the Ruinous Powers. Fell their general; establish dominance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Savage brutes that know only war are best defeated, comprehensively, on the battlefield. Cut the head from a snake, and watch the body wither.

missions.localised_description: Savage brutes that know only war are best defeated, comprehensively, on the battlefield. Cut the head from a snake, and watch the body wither.

localised_title.last_approved_text: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

missions.localised_title: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

missions.localised_description: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

localised_description.last_approved_text: On the battlefield, the beasts are ferocious and savage, but so are we. Let our prowess be known; fell the strongest of them and the others will follow suit!

missions.localised_description: On the battlefield, the beasts are ferocious and savage, but so are we. Let our prowess be known; fell the strongest of them and the others will follow suit!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

missions.localised_description: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

missions.localised_description: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

missions.localised_description: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

missions.localised_description: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

localised_description.last_approved_text: There are yet those who have not yet learned Khazrak's name. The blood-ground calls, and he answers.

missions.localised_description: There are yet those who have not yet learned Khazrak's name. The blood-ground calls, and he answers.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter I: Beasts in the Blood-Ground

missions.localised_title: Chapter I: Beasts in the Blood-Ground

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khazrak grows in renown, yet the blood-ground demands more. The One-Eye desires flesh.

missions.localised_description: Khazrak grows in renown, yet the blood-ground demands more. The One-Eye desires flesh.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: What Beasts May Come

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: What Beasts May Come

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Uncloven tremble, for they see their end before Khazrak and his unyielding herd.

missions.localised_description: The Uncloven tremble, for they see their end before Khazrak and his unyielding herd.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: Khazrak of the Endless Brayherd

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Khazrak of the Endless Brayherd

localised_description.last_approved_text: At last, the Middenheim army marches forth from its fastness, lured by the defilement of their so-called civilisation. Now, Khazrak will show them why his name is whispered in horrified tones, why he is the most cunning Beastlord to have ever lived! Should he succeed the Bray-Shamans have promised him a great tribute - a cursed lash that will ensure the fealty of the tribes. Ambush the man-filth outside of Middenheim, in the forests of the Drakwald!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Graktar is camped near the mannish towns of Kelp and Koldust. As suspected, the Beastlord is gathering his loyal Gors to him, ready to fight back! Using his bestial cunning, the One-Eye sends his forces to surround Graktar’s own warherd, trapping him in place. The time to strike is now; with the venom in Khazrak’s possession, Graktar is no match, and that blackened chainmail he wears can be claimed by the true Beastlord of the Drakwald!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Minotaur tribes are formidable but won’t fight for a Bray-Shaman, even one as notorious as the Crowfather. Only a Gorebull - a champion amongst its blood-gorging kin - can rouse the tribes to flock to the Dark Omen’s banner. But time grows short; to capitalise on the shroud of fear across Reikland’s borders the Crowfather must act soon. Malagor must dominate the Minotaurs with his eldritch might, forcing them to supplication.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now the chapel of Grunberg is burnt to flaming rubble, Malagor wishes to exact one more cruelty upon the race of Man. Having seen a smoking, festering carcass of a griffon in his earlier vision, Malagor knows his final target is the Knights Griffon. Upon their destruction will his foul fetishes be elevated to blasphemous Icons of vilification

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dark Gods are pleased… mankind is ravaged. They have been taunted, hunted and broken by the Children of Chaos. The land is ripe for an even greater invasion; for other followers of the Ruinous Powers to make their mark, as paltry as it will be compared to the triumphs of the Cloven Ones. Yet, there remains defiance - the armies of man-filth muster as one, refusing the inevitable. No matter! This is but another opportunity for the Beastmen to prove themselves the most worthy of the Dark Powers' servants. Find this "gathering of might" and ensure the fall of man!

missions.localised_description: The Dark Gods are pleased… mankind is ravaged. They have been taunted, hunted and broken by the Children of Chaos. The land is ripe for an even greater invasion; for other followers of the Ruinous Powers to make their mark, as paltry as it will be compared to the triumphs of the Cloven Ones. Yet, there remains defiance - the armies of man-filth muster as one, refusing the inevitable. No matter! This is but another opportunity for the Beastmen to prove themselves the most worthy of the Dark Powers' servants. Find this "gathering of might" and ensure the fall of man!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Sigmar has ever-been a warrior god, and his clergy have followed his example. They are no mere priests or tranquil monks but warriors all - as eager to split skulls with hammer as preach from a pulpit. At the head of the Cult is the Grand Theogonist, and while many have filled the role over the years, most - if not all - have been intimidating men; full of fury and bombast, and piously devoted to Sigmar's tenets.

Should the Empire come under threat, then it is not always state troops that must face the threat alone. The Cult of Sigmar has often answered the call to war, with the Grand Theogonist at its head, eager as any of his Warrior Priests to smite the foe. It was on one such doomed campaign that the Jade Griffon - a talisman of the Theogonist's office, said to have been blessed by Magnus the Pious himself - went missing. The Grand Theogonist at the time was brought low by Chaos filth, and the Jade Griffon lost somewhere in Kislev.

Many years later, and word has reached Volkmar the Grim that the Jade Griffon has resurfaced. The Grand Theogonist senses that the time is right to go in search of this precious antiquity. Volkmar issues a proclamation that he intends to march for Kislev. In the vanguard of his force go the desperate and the fanatical - those that have lost everything but their faith. Let their zeal light the way.

missions.localised_description:
Sigmar has ever-been a warrior god, and his clergy have followed his example. They are no mere priests or tranquil monks but warriors all - as eager to split skulls with hammer as preach from a pulpit. At the head of the Cult is the Grand Theogonist, and while many have filled the role over the years, most - if not all - have been intimidating men; full of fury and bombast, and piously devoted to Sigmar's tenets.

Should the Empire come under threat, then it is not always state troops that must face the threat alone. The Cult of Sigmar has often answered the call to war, with the Grand Theogonist at its head, eager as any of his Warrior Priests to smite the foe. It was on one such doomed campaign that the Jade Griffon - a talisman of the Theogonist's office, said to have been blessed by Magnus the Pious himself - went missing. The Grand Theogonist at the time was brought low by Chaos filth, and the Jade Griffon lost somewhere in Kislev.

Many years later, and word has reached Volkmar the Grim that the Jade Griffon has resurfaced. The Grand Theogonist senses that the time is right to go in search of this precious antiquity. Volkmar issues a proclamation that he intends to march for Kislev. In the vanguard of his force go the desperate and the fanatical - those that have lost everything but their faith. Let their zeal light the way.

localised_description.last_approved_text: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with breaching Ghorst's lair, thus distracting the liche and halting the Undead servant's search before it can truly begin.

missions.localised_description: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with breaching Ghorst's lair, thus distracting the liche and halting the Undead servant's search before it can truly begin.

localised_description.last_approved_text: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with taking Templehof from the Necromancer's filthy clutches, diverting the Undead servant from his search.

missions.localised_description: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with taking Templehof from the Necromancer's filthy clutches, diverting the Undead servant from his search.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Witch Hunters of the Holy Order of Sigmar have a certain talent for extracting information, even from those of an Undead persuasion. When torture isn't an option there are certain hexes and rituals that may well work. In any case, crucial information has been learned regarding the Necromancer's plans, and they are diabolical indeed. Should Helman and the Brothers Ghorst get hold of the Jade Griffon, then he will use a dark spell from his Cursed Book, one that will taint the talisman and flood it with fell magic. On learning this, Volkmar angrily rises from his chair and spits orders. The Jade Griffon must be found before Ghorst gets his hands on it. And if that means every Kislevite dwelling upturned in the search, then so be it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Despite the Grand Theogonist's best efforts, the Vampires have somehow unearthed the Jade Griffon first, Sigmar damn them! But Volkmar the Grim is not known for giving up. He sends his best Templars of the Holy Order after the Undead thieves. Witch Hunters are famously dogged in pursuing their prey and this agent is no different. Word soon reaches Volkmar that the Witch Hunter has picked up the trail and has divined that the Necromancer is heading for Hel Fenn...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
There has always been a darkness about Volkmar. Not for nothing is he known as "the Grim". Those who know Volkmar well, such as Karl Franz, realise that this brooding nature is a fierce internal piety, frustration that Chaos still thrives and a grim determination to purge the Empire's foes. Yet, the office of the Grand Theogonist has always attracted enemies, from both within and without. Volkmar, a man who has never suffered fools, has burned alliances and gained many opponents during Altdorf's courtly political games, so when the malicious rumours started to circulate about Volkmar's behaviour, there were many suspects.

 The rumours were few at first, but have since spread like balefire - "Volkmar communes with Daemons"; "The Grand Theogonist wishes to depose the Emperor"; "He is the arch-heretic". Despite the Emperor's urging, Volkmar refused to waste time defending himself from such vapid gossip. This played into his unseen enemy's hands, and now the Staff of Command - the symbol of the Grand Theogonist's august office - has been reluctantly taken and locked away by the Holy Order of Sigmar, such is the feeling against Volkmar. Even Franz, his closest friend, is politically tied to remain a mere observer whilst the Witch Hunters investigate the allegations, baseless as they are.

Spurred on by strong support within the Cult of Sigmar, Volkmar has at last decided he must act and despatches loyal Warrior Priests throughout the realm to track down the deviant rumour-mongers.

missions.localised_description:

Those who know Volkmar well, such as Karl Franz, realise that this brooding nature is a fierce internal piety, frustration that Chaos still thrives and a grim determination to purge the Empire's foes. Volkmar, a man who has never suffered fools, has burned alliances and gained many opponents during Altdorf's courtly political games, so when the malicious rumours started to circulate about Volkmar's behaviour, there were many suspects.

Despite the Emperor's urging, Volkmar refused to waste time defending himself from such vapid gossip. This played into his unseen enemy's hands, and now the Staff of Command - the symbol of the Grand Theogonist's august office - has been reluctantly taken and locked away by the Holy Order of Sigmar, such is the feeling against Volkmar. Even Franz, his closest friend, is politically tied to remain a mere observer whilst the Witch Hunters investigate the allegations, baseless as they are.

Spurred on by strong support within the Cult of Sigmar, Volkmar has at last decided he must act and despatches loyal Warrior Priests throughout the realm to track down the deviant rumour-mongers.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
While tending to their flocks, the Warrior Priests counter the rumours about their liege and spread words of truth - of Volkmar's faith and devotion to Sigmar. They also gather intelligence on the source of these lies, yet no instigator is found.

All is not lost, there are a couple of possible leads. A few tales by wary villagers back in Reikland tell of priests of the Wolf God, Ulric, besmirching Volkmar's name. Tensions between the two cults are often fraught but cordial. However, ever since Volkmar and his Arch Lectors voted against the Ar-Ulric's candidate in the election for Emperor, relations have been strained.

If the Cult of Ulric is spreading these fell rumours, then Volkmar will need the support of the Arch Lectors once more.

missions.localised_description:

All is not lost, there are a couple of possible leads. A few tales by wary villagers back in Reikland tell of priests of the Wolf God, Ulric, besmirching Volkmar's name. Tensions between the two cults are often fraught but cordial. However, ever since Volkmar and his Arch Lectors voted against the Ar-Ulric's candidate in the election for Emperor, relations have been strained.

If the Cult of Ulric is spreading these fell rumours, then Volkmar will need the support of the Arch Lectors once more.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Cult of Sigmar's movements have not gone unnoticed. And in response, there are large troop movements, especially in the north, in Middenland, a stronghold of Ulric worship. The Emperor is concerned, but dare not intervene and start a full-scale civil war. Nevertheless, the Cult of Sigmar must bolster its home city should a confrontation become inevitable.

missions.localised_description: The Cult of Sigmar's movements have not gone unnoticed. And in response, there are large troop movements, especially in the north, in Middenland, a stronghold of Ulric worship. The Emperor is concerned, but dare not intervene and start a full-scale civil war. Nevertheless, the Cult of Sigmar must bolster its home city should a confrontation become inevitable.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grave tidings from Altdorf! The Cult Of Ulric has moved against the city. Never before have the followers of Ulric been so aggressive, maybe there is something more behind this? Even as Karl Franz plays peacekeeper, Volkmar must show the Sigmarites' strength; after all, Sigmar was a warrior in his mortal life and would never cower from a fight. The War Altar of Sigmar should be brought forth as a show of power and defiance!

missions.localised_description: Grave tidings from Altdorf! The Cult Of Ulric has moved against the city. Never before have the followers of Ulric been so aggressive, maybe there is something more behind this? Even as Karl Franz plays peacekeeper, Volkmar must show the Sigmarites' strength; after all, Sigmar was a warrior in his mortal life and would never cower from a fight. The War Altar of Sigmar should be brought forth as a show of power and defiance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Ulricans main force has moved away from Altdorf's walls due to the brilliant statesmanship of the Emperor. Volkmar, however, is in a rage! The slurs of Ulric's supporters and their armies' trespass must be answered. The Grand Theogonist deploys a Warrior Priest to seek them out.

missions.localised_description: The Ulricans main force has moved away from Altdorf's walls due to the brilliant statesmanship of the Emperor. Volkmar, however, is in a rage! The slurs of Ulric's supporters and their armies' trespass must be answered. The Grand Theogonist deploys a Warrior Priest to seek them out.

The slurs of Ulric's supporters and their armies' trespass must be answered. The Grand Theogonist deploys a Warrior Priest to seek them out.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The plot is revealed! The Necromancer, in concert with a cabal of Vampires, plan to plunge Sylvania - and then all the Empire - into endless night! The Jade Griffon is the relic they plan to use to power this despicable deed. That such a holy symbol should be considered for this heresy is more than motivation enough for Volkmar to summon a mighty host, as the Vampire Counts must be brought to battle and stopped at all costs! Hel Fenn is a cursed place, where much blood has been spilt, but perhaps it is a good omen to fight here? After all, it was here that the death of Mannfred von Carstein occurred, for a time. If Sigmar sees fit more monsters will perish here!

missions.localised_description: The plot is revealed! The Necromancer, in concert with a cabal of Vampires, plan to plunge Sylvania - and then all the Empire - into endless night! The Jade Griffon is the relic they plan to use to power this despicable deed. That such a holy symbol should be considered for this heresy is more than motivation enough for Volkmar to summon a mighty host, as the Vampire Counts must be brought to battle and stopped at all costs! Hel Fenn is a cursed place, where much blood has been spilt, but perhaps it is a good omen to fight here? After all, it was here that the death of Mannfred von Carstein occurred, for a time. If Sigmar sees fit more monsters will perish here!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The army of the Ar-Ulric has been found, several leagues from Altdorf. They are in the midst of deploying, clearly expecting battle. Volkmar will not disappoint, as his reputation and honour have been despoiled by the Cult of Ulric. While fighting between two such noble religions is regretful, the Middenlanders must be taught a lesson, with victory ensuring the Staff of Command's return.

missions.localised_description: The army of the Ar-Ulric has been found, several leagues from Altdorf. They are in the midst of deploying, clearly expecting battle. Volkmar will not disappoint, as his reputation and honour have been despoiled by the Cult of Ulric. While fighting between two such noble religions is regretful, the Middenlanders must be taught a lesson, with victory ensuring the Staff of Command's return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Helman arrives with his minions to see that the Cult of Sigmar are already excavating the site, presumably looking for the casket that contains the missing pages of the Liber Noctus. Such a large expenditure of resources proves to Ghorst beyond doubt the pages' importance. Once rebound, this book will give the Necromancer untold power! While the temptation to attack immediately is strong, the cunning Ghorst decides to hold back, letting the Arch Lector do the hard graft and find the casket. In the meantime, the Necromancer prepares an ambush to relieve the Sigmarites of the pages as soon as they have been found!

missions.localised_description: Helman arrives with his minions to see that the Cult of Sigmar are already excavating the site, presumably looking for the casket that contains the missing pages of the Liber Noctus. Such a large expenditure of resources proves to Ghorst beyond doubt the pages' importance. Once rebound, this book will give the Necromancer untold power! While the temptation to attack immediately is strong, the cunning Ghorst decides to hold back, letting the Arch Lector do the hard graft and find the casket. In the meantime, the Necromancer prepares an ambush to relieve the Sigmarites of the pages as soon as they have been found!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad is pleased - the forces of men muster to fight in an army grand-enough to appease the Vampire Count's ego. His sword shall drink deeply from the mortals gathered and Ostermark will burn! A great summoning is needed to call all the creatures of the night from their lairs and awaken those in their graves. As for the living that face Vlad, they will join his ranks soon enough!

missions.localised_description: Vlad is pleased - the forces of men muster to fight in an army grand-enough to appease the Vampire Count's ego. His sword shall drink deeply from the mortals gathered and Ostermark will burn! A great summoning is needed to call all the creatures of the night from their lairs and awaken those in their graves. As for the living that face Vlad, they will join his ranks soon enough!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad has found the meteor site. He wastes little time gathering further intelligence on who or what lays claim to it, for he is keen to return to the court of Sylvania in case any of his kin get 'ambitious'. A lightning strike at the mine is the best approach. Anyone foolish enough to stand in his way will be obliterated or inducted into his army's ranks...

missions.localised_description: Vlad has found the meteor site. He wastes little time gathering further intelligence on who or what lays claim to it, for he is keen to return to the court of Sylvania in case any of his kin get 'ambitious'. A lightning strike at the mine is the best approach. Anyone foolish enough to stand in his way will be obliterated or inducted into his army's ranks...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The Plague of Blue Roses is a vile disease, sadly common throughout the southern provinces and Tilea. Once its spores have been inhaled, mortal men will quickly perish in a matter of hours, the tell-tale bluish fungus bruises covering their bodies. So it was that a young Helman Ghorst discovered his father and four brothers lying in their beds, taken by the Plague. In a fit of anguish, Helman embraced his dead kin - desperate to contract the plague himself - but fate had other plans for the youngest of the Ghorst family.

Unable to accept his family's deaths, Ghorst sought other, darker means to bring them back. Years later, Helman crossed paths with Mannfred. The Vampire Count saw something in Ghorst, a potential ally perhaps? To that end, he gave Ghorst the Liber Noctus, the Cursed Book of Necromancy. Yet, the pages of greatest lore were missing - torn from their binding and scattered across the Empire. No doubt this was Mannfred's true agenda all along - a test - and should Ghorst be successful, he would imbue one of the Nine Books of Nagash with great power once more.

Ghorst must begin the hunt for the missing pages immediately or risk disappointing the Gravelord, Mannfred, himself. Fast-moving Dire Wolves will allow the Necromancer to cover more ground.

Once its spores have been inhaled, mortal men will quickly perish in a matter of hours, the tell-tale bluish fungus bruises covering their bodies. So it was that a young Helman Ghorst discovered his father and four brothers lying in their beds, taken by the Plague. In a fit of anguish, Helman embraced his dead kin - desperate to contract the plague himself - but fate had other plans for the youngest of the Ghorst family.

Unable to accept his family's deaths, Ghorst sought other, darker means to bring them back. Years later, Helman crossed paths with Mannfred. The Vampire Count saw something in Ghorst, a potential ally perhaps? To that end, he gave Ghorst the Liber Noctus, the Cursed Book of Necromancy. Yet, the pages of greatest lore were missing - torn from their binding and scattered across the Empire. No doubt this was Mannfred's true agenda all along - a test - and should Ghorst be successful, he would imbue one of the Nine Books of Nagash with great power once more.

Ghorst must begin the hunt for the missing pages immediately or risk disappointing the Gravelord, Mannfred, himself. Fast-moving Dire Wolves will allow the Necromancer to cover more ground.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to three townships. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

missions.localised_description: Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to three townships. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations-old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to the province of Reikland. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

missions.localised_description: Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations-old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to the province of Reikland. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of the missing pages is in Ghorst's pallid hands, but there are more still to locate. As Helman's Corpse Cart trundles on rickety roads through the ghoulish countryside, the Necromancer is approached by a hunched-back dreg. The creature bows and scrapes before the Necromancer in false obsequiousness. He brings word from his mistress, a sultry Vampiress who has heard of his quest and has information that could aid him in search for more of the pages. Perhaps a pact is in order?

missions.localised_description: One of the missing pages is in Ghorst's pallid hands, but there are more still to locate. As Helman's Corpse Cart trundles on rickety roads through the ghoulish countryside, the Necromancer is approached by a hunched-back dreg. The creature bows and scrapes before the Necromancer in false obsequiousness. He brings word from his mistress, a sultry Vampiress who has heard of his quest and has information that could aid him in search for more of the pages. Perhaps a pact is in order?

localised_description.last_approved_text: In exchange for spores of the Blue Rose Plague, the Vampire bequeaths Ghorst some pertinent information. The Cult of Sigmar have caught wind of Ghorst's search as, after all, the Necromancer wasn't very subtle in burning down Empire settlements. The Sigmarites are now searching for the last remaining pages to keep them out of Ghorst's, and ultimately Mannfred's, hands. They have tracked the pages to a site deep within the Border Princes - taken there by a Lahmian cult centuries ago, placed in a sealed casket and thrown in a deep gorge to keep them out of Nagash's necrotic hands. Burning the pages would have proved more effective, but many counter-curses ensure the Books of Nagash cannot be so easily destroyed.\n\nAnd so the Cult of Sigmar control the site, hunting for the casket. Ghorst needs the location. The Vampire gives him a redolent smile, stating that while the whereabouts remain a mystery to her, she is aware of a ranking officer that does know. Getting the information from a single Empire soldier shouldn't be too taxing, as will killing him afterwards to ensure his silence. He can then join Ghorst's brothers on the cart!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the location of the pages now known, Ghorst sends an agent to survey the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Blood Drinker thirsts. The sword has lain dormant for centuries, and so the blade has dulled - its once-golden pommel tarnished. The sword must drink, must be bathed in blood - only then will its pommel brighten and blade shine again.\n\nVlad has returned. The sword's one true owner sees it is in a sorry state and begins a campaign to quench its thirst in the blood of Sigmar's sons. Vlad has already decided on a target, he will strike where he did once before; Ostermark sits ripe and plumb like a suckling pig basting over a hot fire. It is ready to be consumed...

The sword must drink, must be bathed in blood - only then will its pommel brighten and blade shine again.\n\nVlad has returned. The sword's one true owner sees it is in a sorry state and begins a campaign to quench its thirst in the blood of Sigmar's sons. Vlad has already decided on a target, he will strike where he did once before; Ostermark sits ripe and plumb like a suckling pig basting over a hot fire. It is ready to be consumed...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad's rampages through Ostermark, yet the Elector Counts seem unfazed. News takes a while to filter through the Empire, perhaps they have only heard rumours and refuse to acknowledge Vlad's return? Either that or they do not care and look inwardly on their own squabbles.\n\nA surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

No doubt the survivors are looking to their own needs, and see the bloodshed and destruction in far off Ostermark as simply not their problem. And so mankind sways further into the clutches of dark gods.\n\nA more surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!
