No doubt the survivors are looking to their own needs, and see the bloodshed and destruction in far off Ostermark as simply not their problem. And so mankind sways further into the clutches of dark gods.\n\nA more surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

missions.localised_description: Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

missions.localised_description: Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Carstein Ring has returned its master to Unlife once more. Vlad, the first Vampire Count, patriarch of the Von Carstein bloodline, is abroad and the world should tremble! However, this resurrection has proven a difficult one. The power of the ring fades, so Vlad must do something about it if he is to use its benighted abilities in future. First there are other priorities; Vlad's absence has been a long one, and his kin have been busy in the intervening centuries. They have been plotting for what Vlad feels is little gain - too interested in their own petty disputes and sibling rivalries. It is time for the first von Carstein to wrest back control from these pretenders!\n\nTo enact his grand plans, Vlad needs a companion, after all where would the Count be without his lady?

missions.localised_description: The Carstein Ring has returned its master to Unlife once more. Vlad, the first Vampire Count, patriarch of the Von Carstein bloodline, is abroad and the world should tremble! However, this resurrection has proven a difficult one. The power of the ring fades, so Vlad must do something about it if he is to use its benighted abilities in future. First there are other priorities; Vlad's absence has been a long one, and his kin have been busy in the intervening centuries. They have been plotting for what Vlad feels is little gain - too interested in their own petty disputes and sibling rivalries. It is time for the first von Carstein to wrest back control from these pretenders!\n\nTo enact his grand plans, Vlad needs a companion, after all where would the Count be without his lady?

localised_description.last_approved_text: So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring provinces will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

missions.localised_description: So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring provinces will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vampires are greedy creatures - they always want more, whether that is an immortal span, more blood, or greater power. Vlad has promised to share such resources, but first he must accrue them...

missions.localised_description: Vampires are greedy creatures - they always want more, whether that is an immortal span, more blood, or greater power. Vlad has promised to share such resources, but first he must accrue them...

localised_description.last_approved_text: So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring territories will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

missions.localised_description: So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring territories will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a powerbase established and much of Sylvania back in his thrall, Vlad can restore the Carstein Ring to its former power. For this he will need warpstone, a material craved by other noisome races and Dark Magic users alike. Vlad is aware of a warpstone seam deep in the Desolation of Nagash. A chunk of Morrslieb fell from the sky and struck the area many years back, scattering the area in the Chaos-infused rock. Assuming it hasn't already been mined to exhaustion, there will be more than enough for Vlad's needs.\n\nAn expedition across the World's Edge Mountains is needed to collect the warpstone, one that Vlad plans on leading himself. To bolster this force, he summons his von Carstein sires from the catacombs, those who have been locked and left to rot within their coffins...

missions.localised_description: With a powerbase established and much of Sylvania back in his thrall, Vlad can restore the Carstein Ring to its former power. For this he will need warpstone, a material craved by other noisome races and Dark Magic users alike. Vlad is aware of a warpstone seam deep in the Desolation of Nagash. A chunk of Morrslieb fell from the sky and struck the area many years back, scattering the area in the Chaos-infused rock. Assuming it hasn't already been mined to exhaustion, there will be more than enough for Vlad's needs.\n\nAn expedition across the World's Edge Mountains is needed to collect the warpstone, one that Vlad plans on leading himself. To bolster this force, he summons his von Carstein sires from the catacombs, those who have been locked and left to rot within their coffins...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad sends one of his agents ahead to scout the area and locate the crash site of the fallen meteor.

missions.localised_description: Vlad sends one of his agents ahead to scout the area and locate the crash site of the fallen meteor.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad sends one of his agents ahead to scout the area and locate the crash site of the fallen meteor.

missions.localised_description: Vlad sends one of his agents ahead to scout the area and locate the crash site of the fallen meteor.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Valaya has wept to see such violence befall our sons. A grudge, once written, must be avenged. Find this forest-dweller, and destroy them!

missions.localised_description: Valaya has wept to see such violence befall our sons. A grudge, once written, must be avenged. Find this forest-dweller, and destroy them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Below the furious nose of Grimnir, this stinking leaf-lover has enacted a great treason against us. Kill them, and erase this grudge!

missions.localised_description: Below the furious nose of Grimnir, this stinking leaf-lover has enacted a great treason against us. Kill them, and erase this grudge!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Before Grungni’s baleful sight, this Elf-scum has dared to step onto our lands. The grudge is written; throw them out, and avenge it!

missions.localised_description: Before Grungni’s baleful sight, this Elf-scum has dared to step onto our lands. The grudge is written; throw them out, and avenge it!

localised_title.last_approved_text: The Folly of the Moss Men Grudge

missions.localised_title: The Folly of the Moss Men Grudge

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though Valaya is aggrieved to see it, these bark-eaters have stolen a victory from the Dawi. This slight cannot go unavenged. See to it!

missions.localised_description: Though Valaya is aggrieved to see it, these bark-eaters have stolen a victory from the Dawi. This slight cannot go unavenged. See to it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grimni rages at the sight of these leaf-lovers raiding our lands. The grudge has been entered into the Dammaz Kron – strike it out!

missions.localised_description: Grimni rages at the sight of these leaf-lovers raiding our lands. The grudge has been entered into the Dammaz Kron – strike it out!

localised_title.last_approved_text: The Ego of the Soil Servants Grudge

missions.localised_title: The Ego of the Soil Servants Grudge

localised_description.last_approved_text: Furious Smednir cries out at these thicketed fools sacking our Karaks. This cannot stand, so says the Book; you must fight, and win, for the grudge!

missions.localised_description: Furious Smednir cries out at these thicketed fools sacking our Karaks. This cannot stand, so says the Book; you must fight, and win, for the grudge!

localised_title.last_approved_text: The Nuisance of the Branch Fancies Grudge

missions.localised_title: The Nuisance of the Branch Fancies Grudge

localised_description.last_approved_text: This vile and unnatural Beastman seems determined to ruin our plans. Show it the fury of the forest - destroy this blight!

missions.localised_description: This vile and unnatural Beastman seems determined to ruin our plans. Show it the fury of the forest - destroy this blight!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What vicious schemes the Chaos Gods wish to rain upon us! Do not let them endanger Athel Loren - smite their corruption from the forest!

missions.localised_description: What vicious schemes the Chaos Gods wish to rain upon us! Do not let them endanger Athel Loren - smite their corruption from the forest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The diminutive mountaineer thinks to sully our plans. Show him otherwise - let him feed the Worldroots!

missions.localised_description: The diminutive mountaineer thinks to sully our plans. Show him otherwise - let him feed the Worldroots!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The haughtiness of man is apparent. Let no agent of the Empire forestall our progress. Turn them to mulch!

missions.localised_description: The haughtiness of man is apparent. Let no agent of the Empire forestall our progress. Turn them to mulch!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The enemy think we can be taken for granted! They are sorely mistaken - show them the error of their ways.

missions.localised_description: The enemy think we can be taken for granted! They are sorely mistaken - show them the error of their ways.

localised_description.last_approved_text: What schemes does she mean to employ against us? See that they are never brought to fruition.

missions.localised_description: What schemes does she mean to employ against us? See that they are never brought to fruition.

localised_description.last_approved_text: What a vile, fungal nuisance this one is! Cut him down to size and stop his sneaky meddling once and for all!

missions.localised_description: What a vile, fungal nuisance this one is! Cut him down to size and stop his sneaky meddling once and for all!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The dead have no place amongst the living. Their place is in the earth, serving as mulch for the trees. See them sent below!

missions.localised_description: The dead have no place amongst the living. Their place is in the earth, serving as mulch for the trees. See them sent below!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Cadaverous and pallid, this Undead heiress must be swiftly and surely dealt with; never again must she darken the forest!

missions.localised_description: Cadaverous and pallid, this Undead heiress must be swiftly and surely dealt with; never again must she darken the forest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Too monstrous for us to suffer, the master of this brayherd should not be allowed to live. Send out Athel Loren's best; deal with this slavering Beastman!

missions.localised_description: Too monstrous for us to suffer, the master of this brayherd should not be allowed to live. Send out Athel Loren's best; deal with this slavering Beastman!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The influence of Chaos cannot be allowed to grow, lest they become any more of a threat to the forest. This Lord must fall!

missions.localised_description: The influence of Chaos cannot be allowed to grow, lest they become any more of a threat to the forest. This Lord must fall!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whatever dark plans this Dwarflord has for the forests, they cannot become reality. Strike him down!

missions.localised_description: Whatever dark plans this Dwarflord has for the forests, they cannot become reality. Strike him down!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This arrogant child of the Empire can no longer be suffered to live. In the name of the forest, have him killed!

missions.localised_description: This arrogant child of the Empire can no longer be suffered to live. In the name of the forest, have him killed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy threatens to make trouble. See that they never take up arms against us.

missions.localised_description: This enemy threatens to make trouble. See that they never take up arms against us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This filthy Greenskin drives his disgusting forces before him. Stop them - cut the head from this fool!

missions.localised_description: This filthy Greenskin drives his disgusting forces before him. Stop them - cut the head from this fool!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What is dead can and will be put down again, along with any dark plans of conquest that may be under way! See to it.

missions.localised_description: What is dead can and will be put down again, along with any dark plans of conquest that may be under way! See to it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though cavernous and dark, this Dwarf stronghold is a good place to make camp!

missions.localised_description: Though cavernous and dark, this Dwarf stronghold is a good place to make camp!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Empire settlements are ready-made for us; let us take up positions here!

missions.localised_description: These Empire settlements are ready-made for us; let us take up positions here!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This settlement is as good as any for us to use as an outpost!

missions.localised_description: This settlement is as good as any for us to use as an outpost!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though filthy and dank, this Greenskin settlement will do well for us.

missions.localised_description: Though filthy and dank, this Greenskin settlement will do well for us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Athel Loren has been seized! Such an affront cannot stand - reclaim it, at once!

missions.localised_description: Athel Loren has been seized! Such an affront cannot stand - reclaim it, at once!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though dingy and morose, this Undead settlement will suffice as an outpost.

missions.localised_description: Though dingy and morose, this Undead settlement will suffice as an outpost.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our kindred have requested that we deal with these warriors. They are the strongest of their kind - their defeat will endear us to our brothers, which is essential for our ultimate victory!

missions.localised_description: Our kindred have requested that we deal with these warriors. They are the strongest of their kind - their defeat will endear us to our brothers, which is essential for our ultimate victory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our forest kith request we capture this place. Doing so will strengthen our bonds with them.

missions.localised_description: Our forest kith request we capture this place. Doing so will strengthen our bonds with them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: If we take down these fierce warriors, it will strike a terrible blow to their morale. Our potential allies ask that we do this in the name of greater friendship between us.

missions.localised_description: If we take down these fierce warriors, it will strike a terrible blow to their morale. Our potential allies ask that we do this in the name of greater friendship between us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Potential friends have asked we take the fight to this army. Defeating them will prove our mettle beyond doubt and their gratitude will greatly endear them to us in return.

missions.localised_description: Potential friends have asked we take the fight to this army. Defeating them will prove our mettle beyond doubt and their gratitude will greatly endear them to us in return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The key to better relations with our potential allies lies in raiding this territory. They have requested it of us, and by doing so our friendship will be shored-up further.

missions.localised_description: The key to better relations with our potential allies lies in raiding this territory. They have requested it of us, and by doing so our friendship will be shored-up further.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our kinsmen have requested that we ransack their enemy's lands, swearing fealty if we succeed. Do this and we will increase our chances of their being brought completely under our rule.

missions.localised_description: Our kinsmen have requested that we ransack their enemy's lands, swearing fealty if we succeed. Do this and we will increase our chances of their being brought completely under our rule.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This filthy Beastlord thinks he can trample our sacred territory. Bluntly put, he must be killed, and a terrible lesson taught to our opponents!

missions.localised_description: This filthy Beastlord thinks he can trample our sacred territory. Bluntly put, he must be killed, and a terrible lesson taught to our opponents!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Chaos has no place amongst the civilised, and this Lord of Chaos walks our lands hitherto unchallenged. Put him to the sword, and demonstrate we are not to be crossed!

missions.localised_description: Chaos has no place amongst the civilised, and this Lord of Chaos walks our lands hitherto unchallenged. Put him to the sword, and demonstrate we are not to be crossed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This bantam-weight warrior thinks he can march through our territory. What idle madness these Dwarfs must dream - put him to the sword!

missions.localised_description: This bantam-weight warrior thinks he can march through our territory. What idle madness these Dwarfs must dream - put him to the sword!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The arrogant and aloof Karl Franz sends one of his leaders against us. Show no mercy to this interloper - strike a blow to the heart of the Empire by cutting him down.

missions.localised_description: The arrogant and aloof Karl Franz sends one of his leaders against us. Show no mercy to this interloper - strike a blow to the heart of the Empire by cutting him down.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the seasons change, so too do the whims of fools. An enemy leader has camped too long near our lands, and so the Spring of our clemency must become the Winter of our wrath!

missions.localised_description: As the seasons change, so too do the whims of fools. An enemy leader has camped too long near our lands, and so the Spring of our clemency must become the Winter of our wrath!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This filthy Greenskin leader thinks he can defile the sanctity of Athel Loren, leading his troops through our lands. Leave nothing for the carrion; destroy them all, Gork (or Mork) will recognise his own.

missions.localised_description: This filthy Greenskin leader thinks he can defile the sanctity of Athel Loren, leading his troops through our lands. Leave nothing for the carrion; destroy them all, Gork (or Mork) will recognise his own.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With every step this Undead leader takes, it corrupts and besmirches our lands with its decaying touch. Put it back in its grave once and for all!

missions.localised_description: With every step this Undead leader takes, it corrupts and besmirches our lands with its decaying touch. Put it back in its grave once and for all!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Beastlord is a thorn in our side; he is indeed mighty, but by felling him the glory gained will be great!

missions.localised_description: This Beastlord is a thorn in our side; he is indeed mighty, but by felling him the glory gained will be great!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Lord of Chaos is most formidable! Killing him will be a decisive blow to their forces but a great victory for Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: This Lord of Chaos is most formidable! Killing him will be a decisive blow to their forces but a great victory for Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: For something so small, this Dwarf is certainly mighty! If we defeat him, we reap the glory found through the killing of a challenging opponent!

missions.localised_description: For something so small, this Dwarf is certainly mighty! If we defeat him, we reap the glory found through the killing of a challenging opponent!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Lord of the Empire may be arrogant, yet he remains a powerful warrior. We should bring him down lest he become more than a mere mayfly irritant.

missions.localised_description: This Lord of the Empire may be arrogant, yet he remains a powerful warrior. We should bring him down lest he become more than a mere mayfly irritant.

localised_description.last_approved_text: No matter their strength, all enemies will fall before us. This foe has great skill and power, in their defeat there is great glory to be gained for Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: No matter their strength, all enemies will fall before us. This foe has great skill and power, in their defeat there is great glory to be gained for Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though slimy and stunted, this Greenskin warrior is nevertheless powerful. To make him little more than carrion feed would bring us many great boons.

missions.localised_description: Though slimy and stunted, this Greenskin warrior is nevertheless powerful. To make him little more than carrion feed would bring us many great boons.

localised_description.last_approved_text: For a mere corpse, this Vampire is surprisingly formidable. Yet the dead should remain dead, with great glory to be found in returning it to the grave.

missions.localised_description: For a mere corpse, this Vampire is surprisingly formidable. Yet the dead should remain dead, with great glory to be found in returning it to the grave.

localised_description.last_approved_text: No brayherd can stand against us. Smash these ingrates to dust!

missions.localised_description: No brayherd can stand against us. Smash these ingrates to dust!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Chaos is a blight upon the world, and one we will see destroyed utterly!

missions.localised_description: Chaos is a blight upon the world, and one we will see destroyed utterly!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What these Dwarfs dream of in the dark and dank depths shall not be wrought upon our lands!

missions.localised_description: What these Dwarfs dream of in the dark and dank depths shall not be wrought upon our lands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Haughty, arrogant Empire forces have no place here. Put them to rout, for Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: Haughty, arrogant Empire forces have no place here. Put them to rout, for Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The forests whisper its desires - that this army be brought utterly to ruin. Enact Athel Loren's will!

missions.localised_description: The forests whisper its desires - that this army be brought utterly to ruin. Enact Athel Loren's will!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This infestation of Orcs and Goblins has no place on this earth - smash them into the dirt, nasty green scumbags!

missions.localised_description: This infestation of Orcs and Goblins has no place on this earth - smash them into the dirt, nasty green scumbags!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These detestable Beastmen infest our lands. They must be pushed back; Athel Loren must not be defiled!

missions.localised_description: These detestable Beastmen infest our lands. They must be pushed back; Athel Loren must not be defiled!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Chaos cannot be allowed to encroach upon the sanctity of Athel Loren. Push its forces back - smash them!

missions.localised_description: Chaos cannot be allowed to encroach upon the sanctity of Athel Loren. Push its forces back - smash them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The pernicious Dwarfs try to sully and plunder the forests; no more! Meet them in battle and crush them further down to size!

missions.localised_description: The pernicious Dwarfs try to sully and plunder the forests; no more! Meet them in battle and crush them further down to size!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pretentious, bejewelled Empire army treads where it should not. Show them the error of their ways!

missions.localised_description: This pretentious, bejewelled Empire army treads where it should not. Show them the error of their ways!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No army has the right to march within our sacred boundaries. They must be repelled, and learn their folly is repaid in blood.

missions.localised_description: No army has the right to march within our sacred boundaries. They must be repelled, and learn their folly is repaid in blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: These fungal pests were not granted permission to enter our territory, nor would they ever be. Squash them, and return purity to these glades.

missions.localised_description: These fungal pests were not granted permission to enter our territory, nor would they ever be. Squash them, and return purity to these glades.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Undead shuffle into our lands in great numbers, bringing with them their corruption and filth. Shatter them and leave their bones for mulch!

missions.localised_description: The Undead shuffle into our lands in great numbers, bringing with them their corruption and filth. Shatter them and leave their bones for mulch!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No army, living or dead, can stand against the might of nature. For Athel Loren, smash these brigands!

missions.localised_description: No army, living or dead, can stand against the might of nature. For Athel Loren, smash these brigands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dwarfholds may be dingy and dark, but they contain many riches; riches that we should claim for ourselves!

missions.localised_description: Dwarfholds may be dingy and dark, but they contain many riches; riches that we should claim for ourselves!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Empire may be arrogant, but their territory is wealthy. Why should they have it all, and not us?

missions.localised_description: The Empire may be arrogant, but their territory is wealthy. Why should they have it all, and not us?

localised_description.last_approved_text: The riches of the earth are rightfully ours. We need only march forth and claim them!

missions.localised_description: The riches of the earth are rightfully ours. We need only march forth and claim them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Greenskins peddle filth wherever they roam, but beneath the dirt treasures can often be found. Treasures that, despite the grime, we should seize!

missions.localised_description: Greenskins peddle filth wherever they roam, but beneath the dirt treasures can often be found. Treasures that, despite the grime, we should seize!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Vampires are decrepit and deceitful, but they hoard great and ancient wealth. How it would benefit us if we were to simply reach out and claim it!

missions.localised_description: The Vampires are decrepit and deceitful, but they hoard great and ancient wealth. How it would benefit us if we were to simply reach out and claim it!

localised_title.last_approved_text: You Can't Take It With You

missions.localised_title: You Can't Take It With You

localised_description.last_approved_text: Athel Loren is threatened, so sound the call - bring more warriors to her defence. Recruit more!

missions.localised_description: Athel Loren is threatened, so sound the call - bring more warriors to her defence. Recruit more!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What the Dwarfs have, we shall take by force. Burn their Holds, and take their treasures by force!

missions.localised_description: What the Dwarfs have, we shall take by force. Burn their Holds, and take their treasures by force!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What mighty towers the Empire constructs! Such affronts to nature should be toppled for their arrogance - see it done!

missions.localised_description: What mighty towers the Empire constructs! Such affronts to nature should be toppled for their arrogance - see it done!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Council has decided, in its wisdom, that this settlement has no right to exist further. See it brought low, for the good of Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: The Council has decided, in its wisdom, that this settlement has no right to exist further. See it brought low, for the good of Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: They pile their filth high and call it a settlement. It is nothing more than heaps of dung, and dung burns SO well…

missions.localised_description: They pile their filth high and call it a settlement. It is nothing more than heaps of dung, and dung burns SO well…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nothing kills the Undead better than fire, which makes this settlement little more than a glorified funeral pyre. Provide the match.

missions.localised_description: Nothing kills the Undead better than fire, which makes this settlement little more than a glorified funeral pyre. Provide the match.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Branchwraiths are powerful, if twisted, additions to any forest defence force. Athel Loren requires more of them - see it done!

missions.localised_description: The Branchwraiths are powerful, if twisted, additions to any forest defence force. Athel Loren requires more of them - see it done!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Waystalkers are the most keen, determined scouts in all of Athel Loren. Bring more of them into our ranks, to give us an edge over our enemies.

missions.localised_description: The Waystalkers are the most keen, determined scouts in all of Athel Loren. Bring more of them into our ranks, to give us an edge over our enemies.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Spellsingers, elegant and deadly, number too few among our ranks. See this remedied, that they may bring their beautiful ways of death to the battlefield!

missions.localised_description: The Spellsingers, elegant and deadly, number too few among our ranks. See this remedied, that they may bring their beautiful ways of death to the battlefield!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Without cavalry, we are at a severe disadvantage - at risk of being outflanked and charged to devastating effect! We must field more to guard the edge!

missions.localised_description: Without cavalry, we are at a severe disadvantage - at risk of being outflanked and charged to devastating effect! We must field more to guard the edge!

localised_title.last_approved_text: To Steed or Not to Steed…

missions.localised_title: To Steed or Not to Steed…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Melee infantry are the spine of any good army, and we are severely lacking in their regard. We must field more to create a strong central core within our forces!

missions.localised_description: Melee infantry are the spine of any good army, and we are severely lacking in their regard. We must field more to create a strong central core within our forces!

localised_description.last_approved_text: We are the warriors of Athel Loren, we strike from afar and with deadly precision. Yet, our armies are lacking in archers and scouts - recruit more, and they will surely give us the edge we require.

missions.localised_description: We are the warriors of Athel Loren, we strike from afar and with deadly precision. Yet, our armies are lacking in archers and scouts - recruit more, and they will surely give us the edge we require.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Without monsters to field, our forces lack the same punch as those of our rivals. We should field some huge creatures as to terrify our enemies!

missions.localised_description: Without monsters to field, our forces lack the same punch as those of our rivals. We should field some huge creatures as to terrify our enemies!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

missions.localised_description: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

missions.localised_description: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

missions.localised_description: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

missions.localised_description: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

localised_description.last_approved_text: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.

missions.localised_description: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.

missions.localised_description: From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: The Oak of Oaks

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: The Oak of Oaks

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.

missions.localised_description: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.

missions.localised_description: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater

localised_description.last_approved_text: Wherever Morghur treads, Chaos follows with him. A dark tide of rivening madness and mutagenic power swirls around Morghur, corrupting and changing all those around him - friend and foe alike. This power, however, is beyond the control of Morghur even - to contain the swirling essence of Chaos that trails the Master of Skulls is beyond the capability of any mortal container. For this essence to be caught, and harnessed, something more... immortal is required. Such vessels are not made easily; they require macabre and difficult to obtain materials, but needs must.\n\nYou must start with the spines of the Orcs.

missions.localised_description: Wherever Morghur treads, Chaos follows with him. A dark tide of rivening madness and mutagenic power swirls around Morghur, corrupting and changing all those around him - friend and foe alike. This power, however, is beyond the control of Morghur even - to contain the swirling essence of Chaos that trails the Master of Skulls is beyond the capability of any mortal container. For this essence to be caught, and harnessed, something more... immortal is required. Such vessels are not made easily; they require macabre and difficult to obtain materials, but needs must.\n\nYou must start with the spines of the Orcs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Greenskin spines are seemingly difficult to come by these days, as their kind has been almost eradicated. Yet no matter, Morghur has his ways, and there are always alternatives, particularly as the Greenskins are so-often spineless in their behaviour. The price must instead by paid in souls - a great number of souls. To this end, Morghur must... harvest them.

missions.localised_description: Greenskin spines are seemingly difficult to come by these days, as their kind has been almost eradicated. Yet no matter, Morghur has his ways, and there are always alternatives, particularly as the Greenskins are so-often spineless in their behaviour. The price must instead by paid in souls - a great number of souls. To this end, Morghur must... harvest them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Defeating the Greenskins was not the difficult part - that was removing the spine in one piece from their bodies. Nevertheless, Morghur now stands over the emptied corpses of a dozen felled Orcs, their spinal cords stored safely away. His attention turns now, in crazed and macabre bloodlust, to the Dwarfs. Their stern and thick craniums will be the next important part of the ritual. As many as can be obtained must be, and as fast as possible!

missions.localised_description: Defeating the Greenskins was not the difficult part - that was removing the spine in one piece from their bodies. Nevertheless, Morghur now stands over the emptied corpses of a dozen felled Orcs, their spinal cords stored safely away. His attention turns now, in crazed and macabre bloodlust, to the Dwarfs. Their stern and thick craniums will be the next important part of the ritual. As many as can be obtained must be, and as fast as possible!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfen skulls are of great importance to the ritual. Yet thick and hardy as they are, the innate Dwarfen inability to channel the Winds of Magic leaves them at a significant disadvantage. The leaves rustle and the trees themselves seem to shiver as Morghur unveils the final part of his plan: the Wood Elves. The Asrai and their forests are steeped in magic, old as the world itself. A waystone, thieved from deep within the sanctuary forests of Athel Loren, will be more than sufficient to sate Morghur's desires. Let none of the Elves or Treekin stand in your way - cut them down in the name of this quest!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfen skulls are of great importance to the ritual. Yet thick and hardy as they are, the innate Dwarfen inability to channel the Winds of Magic leaves them at a significant disadvantage. The leaves rustle and the trees themselves seem to shiver as Morghur unveils the final part of his plan: the Wood Elves. The Asrai and their forests are steeped in magic, old as the world itself. A waystone, thieved from deep within the sanctuary forests of Athel Loren, will be more than sufficient to sate Morghur's desires. Let none of the Elves or Treekin stand in your way - cut them down in the name of this quest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The insidious Elves are never far behind; the forests speak to them and reveal all the secrets that lie beneath the canopy. Ariel is no fool either, she knows Morghur better than any of his enemies, and has tracked him down. In her stead, she sends a champion, at the head of an Asrai host, to put an end to Morghur's dreams of destruction and return Athel Loren to 'peace'. This is but a fleeting hope, however, for Morghur will not suffer these forest folk to interrupt his desires. This champion will be eviscerated and returned to Ariel in a dozen Ruinous pieces, each more garishly transformed than the last.

missions.localised_description: The insidious Elves are never far behind; the forests speak to them and reveal all the secrets that lie beneath the canopy. Ariel is no fool either, she knows Morghur better than any of his enemies, and has tracked him down. In her stead, she sends a champion, at the head of an Asrai host, to put an end to Morghur's dreams of destruction and return Athel Loren to 'peace'. This is but a fleeting hope, however, for Morghur will not suffer these forest folk to interrupt his desires. This champion will be eviscerated and returned to Ariel in a dozen Ruinous pieces, each more garishly transformed than the last.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. He must return to his lair, where he can be alone amongst his twisted creations. Within this dank and unknowable cavern, Morghur's physical form is hewn from countless gifts and boons from the Ruinous Powers, coalesced together to create the Master of Skulls. It is here that he will capture the essence of Chaos and make it his own.

missions.localised_description: With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. localised_description.last_approved_text: Eventually, Durthu and his retinue burst into a copse to find a battle fully joined! The Glade Scouts of Athel Loren pitch themselves desperately against hordes of Undead, who rive and shift at them in seemingly-endless waves. Though Durthu has no love for any but those embodied by the forest spirits, he knows the Undead are the greatest scourge and must be purged immediately!

missions.localised_description: Eventually, Durthu and his retinue burst into a copse to find a battle fully joined! localised_description.last_approved_text: Durthu had suspected the hand of the Necromancer Heinrich Kemmler, but instead his nefarious student was behind the Undead horde. The damp and pallid hallmarks of Kemmler are all over his protégé's work as he advances on the forest with his desiccated horde in tow. The forest must be protected, and Durthu will give no quarter in its defence. Let these dark and twisted fiends feel the full wrath of the Deepwood, with the wrathful Ancient as its instrument of war!

missions.localised_description: Durthu had suspected the hand of the Necromancer Heinrich Kemmler, but instead his nefarious student was behind the Undead horde. localised_description.last_approved_text: A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

missions.localised_description: A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

localised_description.last_approved_text: So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is clear now that the Glade Lord has been deceived by Slaanesh; the temptation of power and pleasure was far too corrupting. They have fallen to Chaos, and now the dreaming woods - Athel Caiellin - call. They cannot be allowed to enter that realm of terror and malice with the Cloak of Isha. It must be secured and, for both their own sake and that of the realm, the Glade Lord and retinue must be put to the sword. The forest watches with fearful anticipation; the Night Glens seem to grow darker as the hour of battle approaches. Orion knows he cannot flinch, and that everything he does, he does in the defence of his realm.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a zeal that could inspire any being, Orion breaks into the clearing and blasts the Horn of the Wild Hunt. With a crack of lightning, and the scream of several displaced spirits, the magical aura is purged, and the beast-path revealed. However, the Horn is entirely drained of energy, if only temporarily. Orion is unconcerned, however, as with the passage open, the moment of his revenge is at hand. Rallying the Wood Elves to his side, he pushes onwards to find Morghur and sate his bloodlust. As the Elves edge forward, the path closes in around them and the moment of battle draws near...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Orion and his forces rush to the defence of the Oak of Ages, and find the sole surviving warrior of the feast at the head of the rebel army - a traitor through-and-through. They explains how they were chosen by Anath Raema to be her champion. Having infiltrated the Oak of Ages, Anath Raema - goddess of the savage hunt - planned to supplant Ariel and ascend to an Athel Loren shaped by her malicious desires. Orion's final act must be to destroy this Glade Lord and put Anath Raema's destructive desires to the sword once and for all.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The forests of Athel Loren once again bloom into majesty, yet all is not well within the woods. Durthu wakes; once wise and kind, he is now twisted by ages of war and destruction beyond counting. His rage is limitless, his sorrow unbound. He exists now to protect the Deepwood against any and all interlopers and blackguards. He can sense them, swarming and encroaching upon its bounds. No tactless fool can be suffered to besmirch the sanctity of the forests. They must be crushed; they must ALL be crushed.

Durthu wakes; once wise and kind, he is now twisted by ages of war and destruction beyond counting. His rage is limitless, his sorrow unbound. He exists now to protect the Deepwood against any and all interlopers and blackguards. He can sense them, swarming and encroaching upon its bounds. No tactless fool can be suffered to besmirch the sanctity of the forests. They must be crushed; they must ALL be crushed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though the interlopers have been extricated from the branches and brambles of the Deepwood, and now lie battered and bloodied across the marshes, their foul stench of decay and corruption lingers in the trees. Returning to the glade, Durthu is greeted only by haunted memories and perished spirits of his past. His sorrow and rage are tempered only by his understanding that something is terribly wrong within the Deepwood. There can be no delaying; he summons his loyal Treekin to him, intent on discovering the truth behind the forest's ailment.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Durthu and his kin delve deeper into the forest, led by a growing sense of darkness and half-heard screams. As he continues exploring, the light filtering desperately through the canopy far above him, the screams and sounds of battle grow ever louder. As he marches further on, the restricting miasma of corruption and dread seeps into every pore of the forest, seeming almost to exude from the trees themselves. With increasing haste, Durthu pushes on...

localised_description.last_approved_text: With Durthu's help, the Glade Guard scouts emerge victorious; the battlefield is littered with scattered limbs and Undead detritus. Though afeared of the lumbering, vengeful Ancient of the forest, the Guard nevertheless tell him that this force was but a fraction of a larger, more dangerous Undead horde that lurks not far from here. They advise caution and to wait for further Elven reinforcements, but Durthu knows better than these Asrai. Yet they cannot be wholly blamed for their ignorance - their lives are so fleeting compared to his; he has observed this a thousand times before and undoubtedly will a thousand more. No, there will be no waiting. He will move now, and strike this threat at the source - the Necromancer behind this will die, and his stumbling thralls will collapse like abandoned marionettes.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The High Realm of the Wood Elves, Modryn, has long languished in eternal shadow. No light pierces the dense canopy above yet, even in a land as darkened as this, a new and creeping sense of dread lingers. The Cloak of Isha, much revered relic of the goddess herself, is missing - presumed stolen. The Elves speak of dark omens and shadowy whispers pervading the Night Glens, and even Ariel herself feels the changing of the forest as surely as she feels the shifting of the season. The cloak must be returned and Athel Loren restored. To this end, she dispatches her consort-King, Orion, to lead the hunt. She also sends her most trusted of maidens, who know the forests almost as well as she does, to assist him. Together, they will find the source of this trouble. Indeed, they must, for all hangs in the balance...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nothing in Athel Loren escapes the notice of the Sisters of Thorn. They hear the whispers in the glades, the birdsong in the canopies, and everything in between. Before long, the Sisters locate a message bound for Modryn, and pluck it from its destination with the delicate hand of fate. The letter is most certainly alien to these parts; written and sealed with all manner of foul and forbidden glyphs and mannerisms. It undoubtedly belongs to the Cult of Pleasure; the worshippers of Slaanesh. The message speaks of their prowling of Athel Loren's glades, but nobody can know exactly where. Orion's rage is great. He is moments away from ordering the destruction of the glade, in order to find the interlopers, when the Sisters present an alternate plan. The letter hails from Bretonnia, tracing its source would enable its destination to be ascertained and much destruction avoided. After all, the devastation of Bretonnian lands is much preferable to that of Athel Loren.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Much Bretonnian land is burned in the name of the truth, and Orion watches dispassionately as field after field is torched as part of his investigation. Eventually, in a mansion belonging to a 'Krueger', his scouts discover an unsent letter hidden in a secret chamber, addressed to a Glade Lord. If the letter is to be believed, the Cloak of Isha is to be given to the Cult of Pleasure in exchange for the Mark of Slaanesh. Orion is incensed; a Glade Lord, sworn to the defence of Athel Loren, plots against the forest and plans to usurp it! There is no time to waste, haste must be made back to the forest to confront this errant and treacherous Lord before it is too late!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dark news reaches the court of Athel Loren; shadows loom on the outskirts of the forest, and the waystone fence is threatened. Outposts beyond the perimeter have not been heard from in many moons and are presumed lost, down to the last. Although Orion sped there with the wind at his back he found no evidence of who or what was responsible. Although the desire for revenge runs deep, he knows there can be no offensive against his enemies whilst Athel Loren lies vulnerable; the defences must be rebuilt before any vengeance can be taken. To the battlements!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the perimeters of the forest secured, a relative sense of normality is restored to the forest. However, foulness still lurks beneath the trees, and Orion will see the source of it uncovered and eliminated. Reports reach the King that a herd of Beastmen, using the confusion sown by the attacks, slipped through the perimeter and defiled another waystone. Before he could intercept them, however, they used their hidden beast-paths to slink back into the undergrowth and, with all the subtlety they could muster, out of sight. However, Orion and his scouts detected the foul and pestilent aura of Dark Magic at the site of the Beastman raid - an aura that could belong to only one Beastman that Orion knows of: Morghur. As ill an omen as it is that the Master of Skulls is abroad, the lingering magical detritus provides an opportunity. If it can be analysed then it can be traced, and the enemies of the Elves can be brought to justice. To do this, however, the Spellsingers must be consulted...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Spellsingers are mystical and arcane beings, and Orion does not profess to understand even half of what they do, yet he knows he must be patient as they do it. After days of pondering, enchanting and researching, the Spellsingers emerge, and present Orion with an ancient artefact, imbued with the essence of starwood pyre; the Horn of the Wild Hunt, Orion's treasured relic. A sharp blast will dispel the magical residue left behind by Morghur's minions and reveal the path back to his location. Orion is overjoyed, the burning desire for vengeance bubbling up in him as the moment of justice grows nearer. As if guided by the hand of fate itself, a report reaches him that another raid is taking place. Seizing his chance, he bounds off into the forest, the Horn in hand and his retinue close behind.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Time marches ever onwards, Winter grows ever closer and with it the time of Orion's return to the Oak of Ages, and to renewal. The Wild Riders are charged with the sacred task of seeking out a new host to meet with Ariel. If she finds their choice to be appropriate, she will forge him into the new Orion, who will emerge from the Oak of Ages the following Spring. For this, the most sacred of hunts, the Wild Riders must be called and readied.

If she finds their choice to be appropriate, she will forge him into the new Orion, who will emerge from the Oak of Ages the following Spring. missions.localised_description: Time marches ever onwards, Winter grows ever closer and with it the time of Orion's return to the Oak of Ages, and to renewal. The Wild Riders are charged with the sacred task of seeking out a new host to meet with Ariel. If she finds their choice to be appropriate, she will forge him into the new Orion, who will emerge from the Oak of Ages the following Spring. For this, the most sacred of hunts, the Wild Riders must be called and readied.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wild Riders have searched far and wide, returning with a number of young warriors they feel may please Ariel. Yet the Queen of Athel Loren demands, as ever, that all candidates be tested; put through a crucible of endurance to see who is most worthy. She sends them into the field to fight for the honour of her attention, yet knows others have a more sinister desire. Not all suitors can be trusted, and not all have altruism in their hearts - there are those who would see Orion reborn to their liking, for their own purposes. These evils must be rooted out and defeated, lest they send Athel Loren down the path of ruin.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The suitors of Ariel return, battered but victorious, proud of their achievements in the field and eager to see if they will be chosen for rebirth as King in the Woods. Yet there are forces of darkness that would see this path curtailed all too quickly. A poison, vicious and cloying, flows through the candidates by means of tainted chalices. By morning, they are all as cold as Winter's breath. All except one, who has vanished without trace. Athel Loren is in uproar; fear sets in like a deep chill, which shatters into panic when a rebel force reveals itself, advancing on the Oak of Ages. Enraged and alarmed, Orion rushes back to defend the Oak. Even as he feels his strength sapping away, he knows he must do this one last thing...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Belegar Ironhammer has made bold oaths to reclaim his lost kingdom. The fabled treasures of this legendary fortress should be returned to honest, noble Dawi hands. It is said that King Lunn himself sealed away the mighty hammer of the Angrund Clan and only a true heir shall reclaim it. Among Belegar's many oaths is a pledge to seek out the legendary hammer, but first the area must be purged of Greenskin filth so the search may begin unimpeded!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The path towards King Lunn's lost vault is cluttered with urks and other degenerate creatures. Belegar and his kin must rebuild the former glories of his Ancestors, Hold by Hold, using the bodies and blood of the hated Greenskins as their foundations!

missions.localised_description: The path towards King Lunn's lost vault is cluttered with urks and other degenerate creatures. Belegar and his kin must rebuild the former glories of his Ancestors, Hold by Hold, using the bodies and blood of the hated Greenskins as their foundations!

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of Belegar's doubters was the High King. Thorgrim wanted Eight Peaks back within the Karaz Ankor as much as any Dwarf, but thought the cost in kin and resources too high at this point. Yet Belegar's expedition and the tenacity of the Angrund Clan has impressed the High King. He sends a request to Karak Azul that their Angrund brothers be aided with stalwart Dwarf war machines.

missions.localised_description: One of Belegar's doubters was the High King. Thorgrim wanted Eight Peaks back within the Karaz Ankor as much as any Dwarf, but thought the cost in kin and resources too high at this point. Yet Belegar's expedition and the tenacity of the Angrund Clan has impressed the High King. He sends a request to Karak Azul that their Angrund brothers be aided with stalwart Dwarf war machines.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

missions.localised_description: Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

missions.localised_description: Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs of the Angrund Clan have a special hatred of urki and grobi, even more so than other Dawi, for it was the Greenskins -along with fell underground allies - that drove the descendants of King Lunn from Karak Eight Peaks, a Greathold whose majesty was eclipsed only by Everpeak itself. The entire Angrund Clan can trace their lineage back to King Lunn and all become outraged at the thought of those dark times.\n\nKing Belegar Ironhammer lives with this rage on a daily basis. He is the True King of Eight Peaks and his Clan's goal is to inhabit their mighty Dwarfhold once more. Even now, wherever Ironhammer holes up, trouble with the Greenskins seems to follow. Since the Chaos Moon arose, weeks prior, the raids have dramatically increased. It is not just Skarsnik's minions alone that attack - a new green-skinned enemy has entered the fray. Belegar orders his throng forth, as it is better to meet this fresh threat head on than hide meekly behind the barricades.

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfs of the Angrund Clan have a special hatred of urki and grobi, even more so than other Dawi, for it was the Greenskins -along with fell underground allies - that drove the descendants of King Lunn from Karak Eight Peaks, a Greathold whose majesty was eclipsed only by Everpeak itself. The entire Angrund Clan can trace their lineage back to King Lunn and all become outraged at the thought of those dark times.\n\nKing Belegar Ironhammer lives with this rage on a daily basis. He is the True King of Eight Peaks and his Clan's goal is to inhabit their mighty Dwarfhold once more. Even now, wherever Ironhammer holes up, trouble with the Greenskins seems to follow. Since the Chaos Moon arose, weeks prior, the raids have dramatically increased. It is not just Skarsnik's minions alone that attack - a new green-skinned enemy has entered the fray. Belegar orders his throng forth, as it is better to meet this fresh threat head on than hide meekly behind the barricades.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This should be a time of great celebration throughout the Karaz Ankor, for the urki and grobi have been scattered, their tribes have been broken and the World's Edge Mountains are free of their taint and ripe for reclamation by Dawi hands.\n\nYet, for the Dwarfs of Clan Angrund, led by Belegar Ironhammer, Ancestor of King Lunn, there seems to be no respite. No matter how many times the Greenskins are crushed they seem to emerge again from under their fetid rocks. There have been reports of Greenskin activity on Death Pass and the Silver Road. If Belegar's throngs control these important trade routes, further investigation on where the urks are skulking could be undertaken.

missions.localised_description: This should be a time of great celebration throughout the Karaz Ankor, for the urki and grobi have been scattered, their tribes have been broken and the World's Edge Mountains are free of their taint and ripe for reclamation by Dawi hands.\n\nYet, for the Dwarfs of Clan Angrund, led by Belegar Ironhammer, Ancestor of King Lunn, there seems to be no respite. No matter how many times the Greenskins are crushed they seem to emerge again from under their fetid rocks. There have been reports of Greenskin activity on Death Pass and the Silver Road. If Belegar's throngs control these important trade routes, further investigation on where the urks are skulking could be undertaken.

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Greenskin attacks are different to those Ironhammer has witnessed in his countless years fighting the urks. They seem more disciplined and better equipped than even Skarsnik's rabble. Answers must be sought. Belegar tasks one of his most trusted champions to hunt down, interrogate and then slay one of the Greenskin bosses. Any information this agent gleans will help counter the Greenskin threat.

missions.localised_description: These Greenskin attacks are different to those Ironhammer has witnessed in his countless years fighting the urks. They seem more disciplined and better equipped than even Skarsnik's rabble. Answers must be sought. Belegar tasks one of his most trusted champions to hunt down, interrogate and then slay one of the Greenskin bosses. Any information this agent gleans will help counter the Greenskin threat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Belegar's champion returns with a trove of information. An Orc Warboss had taken Dawi he had found imprisoned deep under Black Crag and all but forgotten by their jailer, Gorfang Rotgut. The Warboss stole away the Dwarfs and, under enslavement, forced them to dig new passages within the Underway, secret to all but his own rabble of filthy Orcs.\n\nBelegar is outraged! He at once recognises the captive Dawi as kin - fine folk taken from Karak Azul in a raid years past. This is a fell deed that demands vengeance! However, Ironhammer knows it is not a grudge he can right on its own; King Kazador of Karak Azul still broods on this outrage and so must be informed at once. Dwarf tradition states that news of such great import be given with a surety - a bond between Kings - so that no Dawi could doubt its severity. Belegar doesn't hesitate and sends his shield as his oath.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nDwarfs are stubborn, but even that fat fool at Everpeak at least acknowledges that the Eight Peaks are lost. Yet, the Angrund Clan refuse to accept the status quo - they deny the truth, that their ancestral home is beyond their meagre, stunted grasp. Even now they are set on another foolish attempt to wrest control from Skarsnik! However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of a fresh expedition quickly reaches him and in his unusually astute Greenskin brain another wicked plan is formulated. To begin, Skarsnik will send this new throng his personal ‘greetings’...

missions.localised_description: It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nDwarfs are stubborn, but even that fat fool at Everpeak at least acknowledges that the Eight Peaks are lost. Yet, the Angrund Clan refuse to accept the status quo - they deny the truth, that their ancestral home is beyond their meagre, stunted grasp. Even now they are set on another foolish attempt to wrest control from Skarsnik! However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of a fresh expedition quickly reaches him and in his unusually astute Greenskin brain another wicked plan is formulated. To begin, Skarsnik will send this new throng his personal ‘greetings’...

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nThe Angrund Clan is no more. However, that doesn’t mean Skarsnik can sit safely on his throne of rat skulls. Many covet the lost valuables buried deep in the ancient Dwarf citadel. However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of an enemy treasure-seeking expedition quickly reaches him and a wicked plan begins to form within the chief gobbo’s mind. For starters, Skarsnik will send his regards to the homelands of those who seek to steal from his domain!

missions.localised_description: It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nThe Angrund Clan is no more. However, that doesn’t mean Skarsnik can sit safely on his throne of rat skulls. Many covet the lost valuables buried deep in the ancient Dwarf citadel. However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of an enemy treasure-seeking expedition quickly reaches him and a wicked plan begins to form within the chief gobbo’s mind. For starters, Skarsnik will send his regards to the homelands of those who seek to steal from his domain!

localised_description.last_approved_text: While the stunties are distracted by the loss of their pathetic Lord, Skarsnik's forces storm through the Peaks, raiding and destroying anything in sight. This is Skarsnik’s way, a method tempered through years of dealing with the power-hungry Orcs that have tried to take his throne: perceive the threat and then utterly destroy the foe before it can act against you!

missions.localised_description: While the stunties are distracted by the loss of their pathetic Lord, Skarsnik's forces storm through the Peaks, raiding and destroying anything in sight. This is Skarsnik’s way, a method tempered through years of dealing with the power-hungry Orcs that have tried to take his throne: perceive the threat and then utterly destroy the foe before it can act against you!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whether the Karaz Ankor functions or not, no Dwarf could sit idle while Skarsnik’s hordes raided across the mountains. Valaya would weep tears of blood if such a thing was left unchallenged, and so the Dwarfs, or their remnants, muster.\n\nOf course, this was what Skarsnik desired all along. It is but another of his ‘sneaky schemes’. By cunning placement of his gobbo scouts, the stunties are lured to Death Pass, where the bulk of his horde lies in wait to ambush them. All that is needed now is the appearance of the Warlord himself!

missions.localised_description: Whether the Karaz Ankor functions or not, no Dwarf could sit idle while Skarsnik’s hordes raided across the mountains. Valaya would weep tears of blood if such a thing was left unchallenged, and so the Dwarfs, or their remnants, muster.\n\nOf course, this was what Skarsnik desired all along. It is but another of his ‘sneaky schemes’. By cunning placement of his gobbo scouts, the stunties are lured to Death Pass, where the bulk of his horde lies in wait to ambush them. All that is needed now is the appearance of the Warlord himself!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Well that was exhausting! It was a sight to warm Skarsnik's rotten heart - to see the Dwarfs scatter with their beards between their little legs! However, the Goblin boss can't help brood - how can he impose his will if an Orc has a better reach? Maybe he needs a long stick like those wizards always carry around with them? While he ponders on the problem, his best 'recruiterz' are sent to bolster the horde, as a few were killed during the fight. The Warlord demands they be replaced by 'somfing arder dan Orcs'.

missions.localised_description: Well that was exhausting! It was a sight to warm Skarsnik's rotten heart - to see the Dwarfs scatter with their beards between their little legs! However, the Goblin boss can't help brood - how can he impose his will if an Orc has a better reach? Maybe he needs a long stick like those wizards always carry around with them? While he ponders on the problem, his best 'recruiterz' are sent to bolster the horde, as a few were killed during the fight. The Warlord demands they be replaced by 'somfing arder dan Orcs'.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs are returning - the fools want another go and don't know when they're beaten! This gives the Warlord another idea, he takes a wicked-lookin' halberd from his pile of shiny stuff. It may have belonged to a humie wizard or one of them long-eared gits - he cares not. Skarsnik summons Kruggler, his most 'trusted' hench-gobbo, and orders him to the battlefield before the Dwarfs' second attack. There he must smear the new 'prodder' in the spent blood of the stunties littering the ground. Skarsnik will follow with an army and collect his new extra pointy, extra nasty prodder after the fight!
