localised_description.last_approved_text: A message has arrived from High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer. The scroll is a long one with well over half of it detailing the many enmities recorded in the Great Book of Grudges against the foul Greenskins, an interminable list that is engraved as deeply on Ungrim’s heart as on that of any other Dwarf. Now Thorgrim plans to set in motion a campaign to strike a telling blow against the urks and grobi, so that their stain might be erased from the face of the Old World once and for all. Before the final blow can be struck, they must be weakened in stages, and the first step is to reconnoitre their territory in force.

missions.localised_description: A message has arrived from High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer. The scroll is a long one with well over half of it detailing the many enmities recorded in the Great Book of Grudges against the foul Greenskins, an interminable list that is engraved as deeply on Ungrim’s heart as on that of any other Dwarf. Now Thorgrim plans to set in motion a campaign to strike a telling blow against the urks and grobi, so that their stain might be erased from the face of the Old World once and for all. Before the final blow can be struck, they must be weakened in stages, and the first step is to reconnoitre their territory in force.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though the Orc and Goblin menace seems to have been dealt with for now, the High King knows that somewhere in the wilds scattered bands of fugitives will be hiding, just waiting for a new Warboss to rise so that they can flock to his banner in another mighty Waaagh! Constant vigilance is called for and Ungrim is ordered to send out scouts to keep watch.

missions.localised_description: Though the Orc and Goblin menace seems to have been dealt with for now, the High King knows that somewhere in the wilds scattered bands of fugitives will be hiding, just waiting for a new Warboss to rise so that they can flock to his banner in another mighty Waaagh! Constant vigilance is called for and Ungrim is ordered to send out scouts to keep watch.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Goblins have been seen sneaking through Dwarfen territories, particularly in the central World's Edge Mountains. Ungrim especially despises these underhand Goblin sneaks who lack even the Orcs' one redeeming feature of being prepared to stand and fight. Fire must be fought with fire. Ungrim sends out an ally to put an end to the foul creature before he can do any harm!

missions.localised_description: Goblins have been seen sneaking through Dwarfen territories, particularly in the central World's Edge Mountains. Ungrim especially despises these underhand Goblin sneaks who lack even the Orcs' one redeeming feature of being prepared to stand and fight. Fire must be fought with fire. Ungrim sends out an ally to put an end to the foul creature before he can do any harm!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The war drums are pounding in the Badlands. The settlements belonging to the Greenskins seethe like anthills as the enraged Orcs gather to strike back at their tormentors. According to the High King’s plan, the trick is to ensure that the counterattack is channelled in a direction of the Dwarf’s choosing so that the final confrontation is on ground that favours them. Broken Leg Gully is a low pass in the World's Edge Mountains perfect for such a battle. All that is required is some bait to draw the raging Greenskin horde there. Summoning a trusted champion, Ungrim instructs him to infiltrate a Greenskin settlement and plant a scroll indicating the presence of a secret tunnel entrance in Broken Leg Gully and leading to the nearby Hold of Karak Kadrin. Such a tunnel doesn’t exist, but in their current state of rage, the Orcs will surely take the bait!

missions.localised_description: The war drums are pounding in the Badlands. The settlements belonging to the Greenskins seethe like anthills as the enraged Orcs gather to strike back at their tormentors. According to the High King’s plan, the trick is to ensure that the counterattack is channelled in a direction of the Dwarf’s choosing so that the final confrontation is on ground that favours them. Broken Leg Gully is a low pass in the World's Edge Mountains perfect for such a battle. All that is required is some bait to draw the raging Greenskin horde there. Summoning a trusted champion, Ungrim instructs him to infiltrate a Greenskin settlement and plant a scroll indicating the presence of a secret tunnel entrance in Broken Leg Gully and leading to the nearby Hold of Karak Kadrin. Such a tunnel doesn’t exist, but in their current state of rage, the Orcs will surely take the bait!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though the agent failed to plant the scroll, it would seem that the ruse wasn't required anyway. The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

missions.localised_description: Though the agent failed to plant the scroll, it would seem that the ruse wasn't required anyway. The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

missions.localised_description: Though the agent failed to plant the scroll, it would seem that the ruse wasn't required anyway. The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

localised_description.last_approved_text: During his escape from the Greenskin settlement, Ungrim's agent spotted a group of Goblin scouts sneaking away to the North. On a hunch, the agent tracked the Goblins north to Broken Leg Gully. Eavesdropping on their foul conversation he learned that they were a scouting party sent out ahead of a large-scale Greenskin attack planned for somewhere in the vicinity. Having read the report, Ungrim dispatches a scout to watch the area whilst he gathers the throng and marches to join them.

missions.localised_description: During his escape from the Greenskin settlement, Ungrim's agent spotted a group of Goblin scouts sneaking away to the North. On a hunch, the agent tracked the Goblins north to Broken Leg Gully. Eavesdropping on their foul conversation he learned that they were a scouting party sent out ahead of a large-scale Greenskin attack planned for somewhere in the vicinity. Having read the report, Ungrim dispatches a scout to watch the area whilst he gathers the throng and marches to join them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dark clouds have enveloped the accursed province of Sylvania. Such a spectacle has not been seen since Count Mannfred von Carstein, the Vampire Lord of that realm, was last vanquished. Now reports reach Ungrim of sinister black-robed old men roaming the high peaks. He suspects that death has regained mastery of Sylvania and the interlopers herald the spread of its corruption to neighbouring regions. The Slayer King will need to act in order to protect his people.

missions.localised_description: Dark clouds have enveloped the accursed province of Sylvania. Such a spectacle has not been seen since Count Mannfred von Carstein, the Vampire Lord of that realm, was last vanquished. Now reports reach Ungrim of sinister black-robed old men roaming the high peaks. He suspects that death has regained mastery of Sylvania and the interlopers herald the spread of its corruption to neighbouring regions. The Slayer King will need to act in order to protect his people.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ungrim's agents send word that they have tracked two of the cloaked figures, who appear to be Necromancers, and have worked out likely locations where they might be cornered. There seems to be no good reason for the Necromancers to be roaming the high peaks, and Ungrim sends word for his agents to act against them to put an end to whatever scheme they are engaged in.

missions.localised_description: Ungrim's agents send word that they have tracked two of the cloaked figures, who appear to be Necromancers, and have worked out likely locations where they might be cornered. There seems to be no good reason for the Necromancers to be roaming the high peaks, and Ungrim sends word for his agents to act against them to put an end to whatever scheme they are engaged in.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whilst the Necromancers could not be found, the throng have reported rumours of Vampiric activity in the darkest corners of Sylvania. Ungrim sends a scout to investigate the area.

missions.localised_description: Whilst the Necromancers could not be found, the throng have reported rumours of Vampiric activity in the darkest corners of Sylvania. Ungrim sends a scout to investigate the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The scout watching Sylvania's border reports a chance encounter with a terrified Sylvanian peasant who lay hidden and witnessed the passing of a hideous army of the dead. At its head rode two pale figures on dead horses, one in crimson armour, the other robed in black. The armoured figure slapped his mount's neck with a mailed fist and cursed in a voice as cold as death "Weeks of searching the mountain caves and still you have failed to find what I desire. If you are wrong about the locations to the northwest, and we should find no dragon's corpse to serve me into death, I shall feast upon your soul". It seems that the Undead Lord is searching for new materials for use in his foul Necromancy. It would seem that the dead have found at least two possible locations for what they seek and are now moving to claim their vile prize. King Ungrim marches from his hall, shouting for the throng to be assembled. In the meantime he must decide which of the Undead hordes his scout should track.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the decoy force destroyed, Ungrim orders his throng to pursue the second Undead horde, again sending a scout ahead to mark the way.

missions.localised_description: With the decoy force destroyed, Ungrim orders his throng to pursue the second Undead horde, again sending a scout ahead to mark the way.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A number of strange incidents have occurred within the Empire of late: tombs have been desecrated and libraries broken into. Oddly, nothing has been taken. The Emperor's spies report that a number of ill-omened individuals have been connected to some of the misdeeds. The trick now is to catch one of them and learn more.

missions.localised_description: A number of strange incidents have occurred within the Empire of late: tombs have been desecrated and libraries broken into. Oddly, nothing has been taken. The Emperor's spies report that a number of ill-omened individuals have been connected to some of the misdeeds. The trick now is to catch one of them and learn more.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The information received indicates that the intrusions are connected with the search for a magical amulet, believed to have been buried in the tomb of a powerful Lord centuries ago. The fact that the enemy are searching over a large area, and in libraries as well as tombs, suggests that they are yet to discover the amulet's precise location. However, they seem to be concentrating their efforts within the eastern realms and this provides a clue. Balthasar Gelt advises the Emperor that the search would best be orchestrated by the Colleges of Magic.

missions.localised_description: The information received indicates that the intrusions are connected with the search for a magical amulet, believed to have been buried in the tomb of a powerful Lord centuries ago. The fact that the enemy are searching over a large area, and in libraries as well as tombs, suggests that they are yet to discover the amulet's precise location. However, they seem to be concentrating their efforts within the eastern realms and this provides a clue. Balthasar Gelt advises the Emperor that the search would best be orchestrated by the Colleges of Magic.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wizard reports back to Gelt that their researches have turned up two possible locations: the barrow of the ancient tribal Chieftain Marbad in Middenland, or the tomb of an unknown Lord in the dusty foothills of distant Estalia. Gelt decides that it is time for research is over. The leads must be investigated in person.

missions.localised_description: The Wizard reports back to Gelt that their researches have turned up two possible locations: the barrow of the ancient tribal Chieftain Marbad in Middenland, or the tomb of an unknown Lord in the dusty foothills of distant Estalia. Gelt decides that it is time for research is over. The leads must be investigated in person.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the last echoes of battle dwindle and the silence descends upon the tomb once more, Gelt searches for any sign of the magical amulet. Grave goods there are aplenty but the amulet is not among them, and even the most rapacious looter amongst the surviving men is strangely reluctant to so much as lay a finger on any of the treasures piled amid the ancient bones. His metallic voice betraying nothing of the frustration he feels, the Supreme Patriarch gives orders to investigate the lead in Estalia.

missions.localised_description: As the last echoes of battle dwindle and the silence descends upon the tomb once more, Gelt searches for any sign of the magical amulet. Grave goods there are aplenty but the amulet is not among them, and even the most rapacious looter amongst the surviving men is strangely reluctant to so much as lay a finger on any of the treasures piled amid the ancient bones. His metallic voice betraying nothing of the frustration he feels, the Supreme Patriarch gives orders to investigate the lead in Estalia.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Balthasar Gelt has always been fascinated with the purity of gold. In his eyes, no other metal can compare. He has laboured long in probing its secrets and inevitably these studies have led him towards solving the ultimate mystery of transmutation - the permanent transformation of base iron into gold. Now his search is nearing its goal, but the Supreme Patriarch requires raw materials for his research.

missions.localised_description: Balthasar Gelt has always been fascinated with the purity of gold. In his eyes, no other metal can compare. He has laboured long in probing its secrets and inevitably these studies have led him towards solving the ultimate mystery of transmutation - the permanent transformation of base iron into gold. Now his search is nearing its goal, but the Supreme Patriarch requires raw materials for his research.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dwarfs have ever-been adept at fashioning metal, and Gelt suspects that their smiths may have uncovered secrets that will be useful to him. However, their methods are guarded more closely than their lives and the Supreme Patriarch will need to employ guile to wrest the knowledge he needs from the ancient Dwarf halls. He despatches a Hero to negotiate with the Dwarfs.

missions.localised_description: Dwarfs have ever-been adept at fashioning metal, and Gelt suspects that their smiths may have uncovered secrets that will be useful to him. However, their methods are guarded more closely than their lives and the Supreme Patriarch will need to employ guile to wrest the knowledge he needs from the ancient Dwarf halls. He despatches a Hero to negotiate with the Dwarfs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Gelt suspected, the Dwarfs flatly refuse to share their knowledge. His emissary does mention that as he prepared to leave the Hold, a Gyrocopter pilot arrived with news of a Greenskin warband that had attacked a Dwarfen trade caravan and stolen the precious Gromril ore it was carrying. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

missions.localised_description: As Gelt suspected, the Dwarfs flatly refuse to share their knowledge. His emissary does mention that as he prepared to leave the Hold, a Gyrocopter pilot arrived with news of a Greenskin warband that had attacked a Dwarfen trade caravan and stolen the precious Gromril ore it was carrying. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The knowledge Balthasar Gelt seeks would have been recorded in one of the Dwarfs' Guild books. Many of these have been destroyed during the fall of the Dwarfholds. One Greenskin Warboss is said to carry a personal store of them, torn pages from which he takes with him whenever he visits "Da Drops". Scouts report that this Boss is currently to be found in Broken Leg Gully. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

missions.localised_description: The knowledge Balthasar Gelt seeks would have been recorded in one of the Dwarfs' Guild books. Many of these have been destroyed during the fall of the Dwarfholds. One Greenskin Warboss is said to carry a personal store of them, torn pages from which he takes with him whenever he visits "Da Drops". Scouts report that this Boss is currently to be found in Broken Leg Gully. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarf lore reveals synergies between alchemy and the manufacture of Black Powder. With the raw materials and key knowledge in place, Gelt sends word ahead to Altdorf to prepare his laboratories whilst he rides for the capital.

missions.localised_description: The Dwarf lore reveals synergies between alchemy and the manufacture of Black Powder. With the raw materials and key knowledge in place, Gelt sends word ahead to Altdorf to prepare his laboratories whilst he rides for the capital.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

missions.localised_description: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

missions.localised_description: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Colleges of Magic in Altdorf are abuzz with intrigue. Every eight years, a wizard who has proven himself worthy may challenge the Master of the Colleges to a magical duel, with the winner becoming the next Supreme Patriarch. The competition even to become a candidate is white hot. Wizards, being what they are, mean the selection process is at best pedantic; at its worst, real enmities can develop. Balthasar Gelt is the Patriarch of the Gold Order, and tipped to win, but a rival Light Wizard, Gottfried Orr, desperate for the position, wants rid of Gelt before they even reach the Hall of Duels. While this is an open secret, no direct accusation can be made as that is not how wizards manage their affairs. However, Gelt is something of a maverick and knows he needs the edge when Orr inevitably makes his move. As such, the Gold Wizard sets about locating a valuable lodestone and harnessing its power. Lodestones sometimes occur in areas struck by lightning - areas such as Kislev, which has recently experienced heavy storm activity.

missions.localised_description: The Colleges of Magic in Altdorf are abuzz with intrigue. Every eight years, a wizard who has proven himself worthy may challenge the Master of the Colleges to a magical duel, with the winner becoming the next Supreme Patriarch. Balthasar Gelt is the Patriarch of the Gold Order, and tipped to win, but a rival Light Wizard, Gottfried Orr, desperate for the position, wants rid of Gelt before they even reach the Hall of Duels. While this is an open secret, no direct accusation can be made as that is not how wizards manage their affairs. However, Gelt is something of a maverick and knows he needs the edge when Orr inevitably makes his move. As such, the Gold Wizard sets about locating a valuable lodestone and harnessing its power. Lodestones sometimes occur in areas struck by lightning - areas such as Kislev, which has recently experienced heavy storm activity.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With his rival dispatched, Gelt returns to Altdorf to face the current Supreme Patriarch, Thyrus Gormann, in the Hall of Duels. Gelt was unconcerned by the Bright Wizard, after all he had a far more powerful contender in Orr. So, perhaps arrogantly, Gelt considered the Staff of Volans his in all but name until confirmed as the Supreme Patriarch.

missions.localised_description: With his rival dispatched, Gelt returns to Altdorf to face the current Supreme Patriarch, Thyrus Gormann, in the Hall of Duels. Gelt was unconcerned by the Bright Wizard, after all he had a far more powerful contender in Orr. So, perhaps arrogantly, Gelt considered the Staff of Volans his in all but name until confirmed as the Supreme Patriarch.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Emperor Karl Franz has received an urgent message from the college of the Celestial Order. Skilled in divination, the Celestial Wizards have been concerned by unusual eddies within the Wind of Azyr. Using the vast magical astrolabe which lies at the heart of the college's sixteen towers, the astromancers have divined a dire conjunction of certain astral bodies, portending doom for the Empire. However, the fluctuations in the sorcerous winds are obscuring the precise nature of the threat. Only by taking observations from another geographic location can the wizards triangulate a more accurate divination.

missions.localised_description: Emperor Karl Franz has received an urgent message from the college of the Celestial Order. Skilled in divination, the Celestial Wizards have been concerned by unusual eddies within the Wind of Azyr. Using the vast magical astrolabe which lies at the heart of the college's sixteen towers, the astromancers have divined a dire conjunction of certain astral bodies, portending doom for the Empire. However, the fluctuations in the sorcerous winds are obscuring the precise nature of the threat. Only by taking observations from another geographic location can the wizards triangulate a more accurate divination.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With fresh observations, the Celestial Wizards are closer to a definitive reading, but their astrolabe requires certain adjustments and intricate additions in order to perform the calculation. The latter will require rare materials which will not come cheaply.

missions.localised_description: With fresh observations, the Celestial Wizards are closer to a definitive reading, but their astrolabe requires certain adjustments and intricate additions in order to perform the calculation. The latter will require rare materials which will not come cheaply.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the adjustments to their magical astrolabe completed, the wizards of the Celestial College report back their findings, and the portents could not be more dire. A great Orc Warboss has arisen somewhere in the lands south of the Black Mountains. His fearsome reputation has gathered many Greenskin tribes behind him in a Waaagh! which is now headed for the main route from the Badlands into the Empire: Black Fire Pass. The first priority is to prevent further Orc warbands from travelling to join the Waaagh! Meanwhile, messengers are sent to summon all allies to face this threat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Theoderic Gausser, Elector Count of Nordland, requests aid. His lands are experiencing increased coastal raids from Norsca and he needs allies to help repel the attackers.

missions.localised_description: Theoderic Gausser, Elector Count of Nordland, requests aid. His lands are experiencing increased coastal raids from Norsca and he needs allies to help repel the attackers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Hearing rumours of increased sightings of Norscan marauder longships along the coast of Nordland, and fearing that they are forerunners of something more sinister, Emperor Karl Franz summons an agent to gather intelligence in the area.

missions.localised_description: Hearing rumours of increased sightings of Norscan marauder longships along the coast of Nordland, and fearing that they are forerunners of something more sinister, Emperor Karl Franz summons an agent to gather intelligence in the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Norscan activity in the Sea of Claws increases almost daily, in order to prove his credentials, Karl Franz needs to respond, firstly by strengthening his forces.

missions.localised_description: Norscan activity in the Sea of Claws increases almost daily, in order to prove his credentials, Karl Franz needs to respond, firstly by strengthening his forces.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whilst he prepares his forces, the Emperor despatches a trusted lieutenant to scout the route and keep him informed of developments.

missions.localised_description: Whilst he prepares his forces, the Emperor despatches a trusted lieutenant to scout the route and keep him informed of developments.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whilst he prepares his forces, the Emperor despatches a trusted lieutenant to scout the route and keep him informed of developments.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The vaults deep below the palace of Altdorf have been breached and the powerful Silver Seal artefact stolen! The guards are strangely hazy about the events on the night of the theft. But wards that should not open for anyone but the Grand Theogonist or the Emperor have been cracked, this is no mundane thief. A Witch Hunter is summoned.

missions.localised_description: The vaults deep below the palace of Altdorf have been breached and the powerful Silver Seal artefact stolen! The guards are strangely hazy about the events on the night of the theft. But wards that should not open for anyone but the Grand Theogonist or the Emperor have been cracked, this is no mundane thief. A Witch Hunter is summoned.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Azhag’s Armour is alright. It’s got spikes in the right places, the odd skull here and there and is decorated with the crusted blood of countless broken enemies. But it’s missing something, and Azhag can’t quite put his finger on what that is. He summons his Shamans to demand answers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Orc Shaman prances about the campfire, gyrating to extremes the boyz have never witnessed before - or ever want to see again! The thumping of the drums and the rattling of his bone charms soon brings on the trance-like state which allows him commune with Gork (or Mork). Having danced himself to exhaustion, he finally collapses. From his prone position on the dusty ground he gasps that Mork and Gork want to see some proper stomping and Azhag should "get one of them big fellas in 'is mob". Once this is done, they might have a way of "blinging 'is armour up proper like".

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Night Goblin boils a potent fungus brew with his secret stash of black caps. Having gulped down the poisonous concoction, he doubles over and emits a peal of manic laughter before twitching spasmodically and blowing purple bubbles. With his bloodshot eyes still unfocussed and staring, he squeaks that Mork (or Gork) wants to see some spidery stompin', so Azhag should get "one of them 'uge spiderz in 'is mob". Once this is done, they might have a way of "blinging 'is armour up proper like".

missions.localised_description: The Night Goblin boils a potent fungus brew with his secret stash of black caps. Having gulped down the poisonous concoction, he doubles over and emits a peal of manic laughter before twitching spasmodically and blowing purple bubbles. With his bloodshot eyes still unfocussed and staring, he squeaks that Mork (or Gork) wants to see some spidery stompin', so Azhag should get "one of them 'uge spiderz in 'is mob". Once this is done, they might have a way of "blinging 'is armour up proper like".

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Shaman's vision suggest that the Greenskin gods are unhappy with Azhag, who seems more interested in listening to the magic crown he wears than "proper fightin' an' stuff". Azhag ignores the voice in his head which is urging him not to waste time on this nonsense, and orders his mob to prepare for a scrap.

missions.localised_description: The Shaman's vision suggest that the Greenskin gods are unhappy with Azhag, who seems more interested in listening to the magic crown he wears than "proper fightin' an' stuff". Azhag ignores the voice in his head which is urging him not to waste time on this nonsense, and orders his mob to prepare for a scrap.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Azhag's mob picks over the corpse-strewn scene of their latest victory, the Shaman suddenly goes rigid, his eyes bulging and glassy as he enters another trance. In a dreamy voice he says that Gork an' Mork are pleased that Azhag has "stopped muckin' about and got stuck in ta da fightin'". They'll overlook his wearing of the humie Necromancer's crown for now. The Shaman declares that Azhag just needs one final bloodbath, one more bout of carnage and the Great Green will enter his armour and make it properly 'Ard! The crown whispers something about the south, some place in Bretonnia. Azhag orders one of "da lads" to take a look-see.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Once Azhag was the Chieftain of a little-known tribe subsisting high in Troll Country. The Greenskin tribes in the far north are bitter rivals, fighting choppa-and-claw over the few spoils the hostile, barren lands provide. Since then, Azhag has come south to the Badlands, but now events seem to be drawing him back to his old stamping ground once more. Azhag has received a tip from an unlikely source: a captured gobbo from a rival tribe, desperate not to be eaten. The snivelling little git claims he knows of an abandoned tomb-city, once the seat of a great King who worshipped dark powers. Within this necropolis are said to be great treasures... Azhag cuffs one of his own Goblin Bosses around the ear and hoofs him out of the camp, telling him not to come back until he's found this mythical place.

missions.localised_description: Once Azhag was the Chieftain of a little-known tribe subsisting high in Troll Country. The Greenskin tribes in the far north are bitter rivals, fighting choppa-and-claw over the few spoils the hostile, barren lands provide. Since then, Azhag has come south to the Badlands, but now events seem to be drawing him back to his old stamping ground once more. Azhag has received a tip from an unlikely source: a captured gobbo from a rival tribe, desperate not to be eaten. The snivelling little git claims he knows of an abandoned tomb-city, once the seat of a great King who worshipped dark powers. Within this necropolis are said to be great treasures... Azhag cuffs one of his own Goblin Bosses around the ear and hoofs him out of the camp, telling him not to come back until he's found this mythical place.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Despite low expectations, the Goblin scout has found a possible location for this lost city that Azhag's increasingly-loony Shaman insists on calling Todtheim. The Shaman rants on about some humie Necromancer who has some connection with the place and whose iron crown is rumoured to be there. The crown is said to allow its wearer to wield sorcerous powers. He also mutters something about the crown's ability to possess its wearer, but Azhag isn't paying attention anymore. The scout has found an "'orrible" place that stinks of the Ruinous Powers. However, to loot it will be no easy feat as circling above the ruins are flying creatures, flocks of fell bats and other, more monstrous things. To be able to fully explore the dead city, Azhag's mob will need to control the skies as well as the land.

However, to loot it will be no easy feat as circling above the ruins are flying creatures, flocks of fell bats and other, more monstrous things. To be able to fully explore the dead city, Azhag's mob will need to control the skies as well as the land.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With plenty of "shooterz" in his mob, Azhag feels ready to launch his raid on the tomb city. His mobs must cull the flying Undead and Chaos denizens, and then hunt through the tombs and monsters' lairs within the catacombs below. The Chaos Wastes are a weird and dangerous place though, so he sends a scout ahead to mark the way.

The Chaos Wastes are a weird and dangerous place though, so he sends a scout ahead to mark the way.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Azhag really wants to go south. Not all that unusual for an Orc brought up in Troll Country, after all, the squishiest humies and shiniest loot is in the Empire (which is ironically now in da north since the slaughterer upped sticks and went to the Badlands!). But Azhag's top Bosses know, that's not why he wants to go south - something else is pushing him to go that way. He is prone to bouts of staring into space or arguing with his magical crown, but when he snaps out of this he is the old Azhag, intent on "fightin' and lootin'".

missions.localised_description: Azhag really wants to go south. Not all that unusual for an Orc brought up in Troll Country, after all, the squishiest humies and shiniest loot is in the Empire (which is ironically now in da north since the slaughterer upped sticks and went to the Badlands!). But Azhag's top Bosses know, that's not why he wants to go south - something else is pushing him to go that way. He is prone to bouts of staring into space or arguing with his magical crown, but when he snaps out of this he is the old Azhag, intent on "fightin' and lootin'".

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Azhag's Waaagh! rampages through the soft southern lands, his tactics become increasingly 'un-Orcy', straying from the usual Greenskin staple of 'outnumber and charge'. The Orc Warboss now fights with more complex strategies - pincer movements, refused flanks and their like. He even sends out scouts ahead so that he can pick the best targets for his horde, rather than just smashing anything they come across - something he calls "strategy" apparently. All the while he argues with a voice in his head, seemingly coming from the dark crown he looted up north. His boyz shrug to themselves. As long as da Boss is fightin', who cares if he's actin' a bit loony?

missions.localised_description: As Azhag's Waaagh! rampages through the soft southern lands, his tactics become increasingly 'un-Orcy', straying from the usual Greenskin staple of 'outnumber and charge'. The Orc Warboss now fights with more complex strategies - pincer movements, refused flanks and their like. He even sends out scouts ahead so that he can pick the best targets for his horde, rather than just smashing anything they come across - something he calls "strategy" apparently. All the while he argues with a voice in his head, seemingly coming from the dark crown he looted up north. His boyz shrug to themselves. As long as da Boss is fightin', who cares if he's actin' a bit loony?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whilst raiding their way southwards, Azhag's boyz are merciless as they ravage and plunder the land. Many of them continue to note marked changes in Azhag. He uses un-Orcish words, goes into trances, mumbles to himself constantly and often tries to explain orders instead of simply cracking skulls and bellowing. But again, the hordes forgive such peculiarities as the victories and loot stack up. All in the name of "The Slaughterer"!

missions.localised_description: Whilst raiding their way southwards, Azhag's boyz are merciless as they ravage and plunder the land. Many of them continue to note marked changes in Azhag. He uses un-Orcish words, goes into trances, mumbles to himself constantly and often tries to explain orders instead of simply cracking skulls and bellowing. But again, the hordes forgive such peculiarities as the victories and loot stack up. All in the name of "The Slaughterer"!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Azhag’s path takes him south into the Badlands. But while the Crown pressures the Orc to continue his southern route, his iron will reasserts itself. He cannot resist opportunities to raid or confront forces raised against him, and so his army zig-zags along its journey, heading south when the crown holds dominance but frequently detouring when Azhag regains control. He does, however, once again send a scout south, seemingly at the crown's behest.

missions.localised_description: Azhag’s path takes him south into the Badlands. But while the Crown pressures the Orc to continue his southern route, his iron will reasserts itself. He cannot resist opportunities to raid or confront forces raised against him, and so his army zig-zags along its journey, heading south when the crown holds dominance but frequently detouring when Azhag regains control. He does, however, once again send a scout south, seemingly at the crown's behest.

He cannot resist opportunities to raid or confront forces raised against him, and so his army zig-zags along its journey, heading south when the crown holds dominance but frequently detouring when Azhag regains control. He does, however, once again send a scout south, seemingly at the crown's behest.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Goblin scout has brought word that an unusual number of Gyrocopters have been seen travelling back and forth between various Dwarf Holds and the northerly World's Edge Mountains. Something is clearly brewing. Anything that might bring the stunties out from behind the doors of their mountain fastnesses has got to be good news. Grimgor decides to take the uncharacteristically subtle move of cuffing his agent around the head and sending the Goblin sneaking back out to discover more information.

missions.localised_description: A Goblin scout has brought word that an unusual number of Gyrocopters have been seen travelling back and forth between various Dwarf Holds and the northerly World's Edge Mountains. Something is clearly brewing. Anything that might bring the stunties out from behind the doors of their mountain fastnesses has got to be good news. Grimgor decides to take the uncharacteristically subtle move of cuffing his agent around the head and sending the Goblin sneaking back out to discover more information.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Unable to carry out his original mission, and knowing what his fate will be if he reports this failure to Grimgor, the Goblin searches frantically for any information he can find to try and save his own miserable hide.

missions.localised_description: Unable to carry out his original mission, and knowing what his fate will be if he reports this failure to Grimgor, the Goblin searches frantically for any information he can find to try and save his own miserable hide.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having weakened the Dwarfs (and had a good time doing so), Grimgor now despatches a Goblin scout to locate the Chaos Warband, knowing that the remaining throng will also be drawn to it and that the resulting battle will be another opportunity to slake his insatiable lust for war, albeit temporarily. Whilst he awaits word, he looks for other targets for his wrath.

missions.localised_description: Having weakened the Dwarfs (and had a good time doing so), Grimgor now despatches a Goblin scout to locate the Chaos Warband, knowing that the remaining throng will also be drawn to it and that the resulting battle will be another opportunity to slake his insatiable lust for war, albeit temporarily. Whilst he awaits word, he looks for other targets for his wrath.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grimgor's scout has sent word of movement in the north. He is moving in closer to observe whilst the rest of the mob travels to the location.

missions.localised_description: Grimgor's scout has sent word of movement in the north. He is moving in closer to observe whilst the rest of the mob travels to the location.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grimgor's scout has sent word of movement in the north. He is moving in closer to observe whilst the rest of the mob travels to the location.

missions.localised_description: Grimgor's scout has sent word of movement in the north. He is moving in closer to observe whilst the rest of the mob travels to the location.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Several Goblins have been spotted sneaking around the Badlands. It stands to reason that they're up to no good, and there may be some fighting to be had at the end of it. Grimgor orders his scouts to bring one of them to him.

missions.localised_description: Several Goblins have been spotted sneaking around the Badlands. It stands to reason that they're up to no good, and there may be some fighting to be had at the end of it. Grimgor orders his scouts to bring one of them to him.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The cringing Goblin reveals that he was on the trail of another Orc Warboss, said to have found a powerful axe somewhere in the mountains and headed north in search of some humies to try it out on. Eager for the chance of loot, the Goblin was hurrying to join his mob, but adds that no-one has heard from the Warboss since, though there are plenty of rumours of him amongst the various Greenskin tribes. Grimgor delays his plan to squish the Goblin spy and instead sends him to find out who knows anything of value, and to torture the information out of them.

missions.localised_description: The cringing Goblin reveals that he was on the trail of another Orc Warboss, said to have found a powerful axe somewhere in the mountains and headed north in search of some humies to try it out on. Eager for the chance of loot, the Goblin was hurrying to join his mob, but adds that no-one has heard from the Warboss since, though there are plenty of rumours of him amongst the various Greenskin tribes. Grimgor delays his plan to squish the Goblin spy and instead sends him to find out who knows anything of value, and to torture the information out of them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The cringing Goblin reveals that he was on the trail of another Orc Warboss, said to have found a powerful axe somewhere in the mountains and headed north to Black Fire Pass in search of some humies to try it out on. Eager for the chance of loot, the Goblin was hurrying to join his mob, but adds that no-one has heard from the Warboss since. Grimgor delays his plan to squish the Goblin spy and instead sends him to sneak around Black Fire Pass.

missions.localised_description: The cringing Goblin reveals that he was on the trail of another Orc Warboss, said to have found a powerful axe somewhere in the mountains and headed north to Black Fire Pass in search of some humies to try it out on. Eager for the chance of loot, the Goblin was hurrying to join his mob, but adds that no-one has heard from the Warboss since. Grimgor delays his plan to squish the Goblin spy and instead sends him to sneak around Black Fire Pass.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having infiltrated another tribe, the Goblin listened to rumours being discussed around the campfire and eventually came up with the name of a Greenskin who might have more information. Waylaying his victim, he extracted further information before despatching him. It seems that the Warboss was probably headed for Black Fire Pass, on the borders of the Empire. The Goblin now heads to the area to continue his investigation.

missions.localised_description: Having infiltrated another tribe, the Goblin listened to rumours being discussed around the campfire and eventually came up with the name of a Greenskin who might have more information. Waylaying his victim, he extracted further information before despatching him. It seems that the Warboss was probably headed for Black Fire Pass, on the borders of the Empire. The Goblin now heads to the area to continue his investigation.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having failed to find a target, and knowing that to return to Grimgor empty-handed would spell certain death, the Goblin shows unusual initiative by surmising that the Warboss was probably headed for Black Fire Pass, on the borders of the Empire. He heads for the area to continue his investigation.

missions.localised_description: Having failed to find a target, and knowing that to return to Grimgor empty-handed would spell certain death, the Goblin shows unusual initiative by surmising that the Warboss was probably headed for Black Fire Pass, on the borders of the Empire. He heads for the area to continue his investigation.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The axe-carrying Warboss met a powerful Empire force at Black Fire Pass and was defeated. Presumably, the magic choppa remains with his corpse. All indications are that the humies remain in the pass, preparing to march back up north, but they might be persuaded to stay long enough for Grimgor to have a crack at them. The Black Orc Warboss orders his mob to march on the pass, and to announce their approach by burning everything en route. The humie scum will have no choice but to stay and face a far deadlier threat than that 'pretenda' that now lies rotting in the pass with Grimgor's choppa!

missions.localised_description: The axe-carrying Warboss met a powerful Empire force at Black Fire Pass and was defeated. Presumably, the magic choppa remains with his corpse. All indications are that the humies remain in the pass, preparing to march back up north, but they might be persuaded to stay long enough for Grimgor to have a crack at them. The Black Orc Warboss orders his mob to march on the pass, and to announce their approach by burning everything en route. The humie scum will have no choice but to stay and face a far deadlier threat than that 'pretenda' that now lies rotting in the pass with Grimgor's choppa!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the rest of the mob otherwise occupied, one of the boyz ranges ahead, eager to see whether the humies are still about and ready for a scrap.

missions.localised_description: With the rest of the mob otherwise occupied, one of the boyz ranges ahead, eager to see whether the humies are still about and ready for a scrap.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the rest of the mob otherwise occupied, one of the boyz ranges ahead, eager to see whether the humies are still about and ready for a scrap.

missions.localised_description: With the rest of the mob otherwise occupied, one of the boyz ranges ahead, eager to see whether the humies are still about and ready for a scrap.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the vengeful eyes of Grimnir did we witness wrongs committed by a Bretonnian dog! A grudge has been committed against the Dawi. Hunt down this umgi and slay him!

missions.localised_description: Under the vengeful eyes of Grimnir did we witness wrongs committed by a Bretonnian dog! A grudge has been committed against the Dawi. Hunt down this umgi and slay him!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by a wrathful Grimnir, a fell Northman attacked our honourable throng. The sorry cur, lackey of the Ruinous Powers that he is, must pay with his life!

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by a wrathful Grimnir, a fell Northman attacked our honourable throng. The sorry cur, lackey of the Ruinous Powers that he is, must pay with his life!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Valaya's sorrowful eyes did we see a terrible act. A Dwarf attacking honourable kin in battle. The Slayer Oath will not expunge such a sin, only his death can atone the shame of his ancestors!

missions.localised_description: Under Valaya's sorrowful eyes did we see a terrible act. A Dwarf attacking honourable kin in battle. The Slayer Oath will not expunge such a sin, only his death can atone the shame of his ancestors!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As seen by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the umgi of Sigmar's blood, a former guest of the Karaz Ankor now strikes out against our warriors! A despicable, dishonourable act that must be paid for with his life!

missions.localised_description: As seen by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the umgi of Sigmar's blood, a former guest of the Karaz Ankor now strikes out against our warriors! A despicable, dishonourable act that must be paid for with his life!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beheld by Grungni's defiant eyes, the fell urki record yet another wrong in our great book. The beast attacked a throng of proud Dawi. A wrong that must be put right with its death!

missions.localised_description: Beheld by Grungni's defiant eyes, the fell urki record yet another wrong in our great book. The beast attacked a throng of proud Dawi. A wrong that must be put right with its death!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by a disgusted Grungni, enemy of all Vampires and their fell minions, did one of their Undead creatures attack our brave kin. This is a grudge that can only be settled with the abomination's death.

missions.localised_description: Seen by a disgusted Grungni, enemy of all Vampires and their fell minions, did one of their Undead creatures attack our brave kin. This is a grudge that can only be settled with the abomination's death.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by the unforgiving eyes of Grimnir, this umgi has murdered a brave Dawi hero! We should not expect anything less from traitorous Umgi, but now vengeance must be settled. Find and kill this manling!

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by the unforgiving eyes of Grimnir, this umgi has murdered a brave Dawi hero! We should not expect anything less from traitorous Umgi, but now vengeance must be settled. Find and kill this manling!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the withering gaze of Valaya, a vile Champion of Dum has killed a hero of our folk. Such a terrible act must not go unrecorded or unpunished! Claim the umgi's head and erase this fell grudge!

missions.localised_description: Under the withering gaze of Valaya, a vile Champion of Dum has killed a hero of our folk. Such a terrible act must not go unrecorded or unpunished! Claim the umgi's head and erase this fell grudge!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Viewed by a deplored Grimnir, this Dwarf has broken a sacred trust and killed one of his own. This is a grudge that must be answered for Kin-slaying is the worst of crimes. Find this traitor and kill him!

missions.localised_description: Viewed by a deplored Grimnir, this Dwarf has broken a sacred trust and killed one of his own. This is a grudge that must be answered for Kin-slaying is the worst of crimes. Find this traitor and kill him!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Observed by Grimnir's raging glare, a vile umgi assassin has slain a great hero before his saga was fully formed! An outrage. Slay this manling murderer!

missions.localised_description: Observed by Grimnir's raging glare, a vile umgi assassin has slain a great hero before his saga was fully formed! An outrage. Slay this manling murderer!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Grungni's worldly gaze, the fell grobi scum-sucker has slain the honoured Dawi. This is a grudge we cannot tolerate! Slay the urk - dreng him now!

missions.localised_description: Under Grungni's worldly gaze, the fell grobi scum-sucker has slain the honoured Dawi. This is a grudge we cannot tolerate! Slay the urk - dreng him now!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Valaya's stern gaze, the Zangunaz has slain the brave Dawi. We must have vengeance! Settle this grudge with the Vampire abomination's destruction.

missions.localised_description: Seen by Valaya's stern gaze, the Zangunaz has slain the brave Dawi. We must have vengeance! Settle this grudge with the Vampire abomination's destruction.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by Grungni's wrathful eyes, this umgi Knight has dared to trespass on Dwarfen lands and commence manling mischief! Such wanton vandalism cannot be left to pass. Kill the trespasser!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by Grungni's wrathful eyes, this umgi Knight has dared to trespass on Dwarfen lands and commence manling mischief! Such wanton vandalism cannot be left to pass. Kill the trespasser!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Grimnir's enraged sight, the Chaos filth has attacked a Dwarfhold. Slay the fool, and right this grudge!

missions.localised_description: Under Grimnir's enraged sight, the Chaos filth has attacked a Dwarfhold. Slay the fool, and right this grudge!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dok'd by Valaya's distressed eyes, this Dawi traitor has attacked one of his High King's own settlements. So a grudge is recorded, and will not be erased until this sorry, scraggy kruti is dead!

missions.localised_description: Dok'd by Valaya's distressed eyes, this Dawi traitor has attacked one of his High King's own settlements. So a grudge is recorded, and will not be erased until this sorry, scraggy kruti is dead!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As seen by Grungni's withering gaze, this umgi wazzock has attacked a Hold of the Karaz Ankor. This is a gross trespass on our sovereign mountains! A grudge has been recorded, his death the price to clear it.

missions.localised_description: As seen by Grungni's withering gaze, this umgi wazzock has attacked a Hold of the Karaz Ankor. This is a gross trespass on our sovereign mountains! A grudge has been recorded, his death the price to clear it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Spied by Grimnir's raging sight, the Greenskin dared to attack an honoured Dwarfhold. Scum! Filthy urk and grobi scum! Find and kill it to appease Grimnir and release this grudge!

missions.localised_description: Spied by Grimnir's raging sight, the Greenskin dared to attack an honoured Dwarfhold. Scum! Filthy urk and grobi scum! Find and kill it to appease Grimnir and release this grudge!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Watched by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the Undead creature has desecrated our Hold - a fell grudge indeed! Appease the ancestors and kill the abomination.

missions.localised_description: Watched by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the Undead creature has desecrated our Hold - a fell grudge indeed! Appease the ancestors and kill the abomination.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by Grimnir's disappointed glare, this army of Bretonnian curs stole victory from our throng. Such a grudge should be avenged!

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by Grimnir's disappointed glare, this army of Bretonnian curs stole victory from our throng. Such a grudge should be avenged!

localised_title.last_approved_text: The False Pride of Knights Grudge

missions.localised_title: The False Pride of Knights Grudge

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Grungni's indignant eyes, the Chaos horde has cheated its way to victory against our brave Dawi throng - a grave grudge indeed! Right this wrong, and hunt down the Chaos filth.

missions.localised_description: Seen by Grungni's indignant eyes, the Chaos horde has cheated its way to victory against our brave Dawi throng - a grave grudge indeed! Right this wrong, and hunt down the Chaos filth.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Valaya's stern gaze, the rival wattocks of a failing Hold have claimed victory against us! Foolish Dawi - it is a grudge that must be settled!

missions.localised_description: Under Valaya's stern gaze, the rival wattocks of a failing Hold have claimed victory against us! Foolish Dawi - it is a grudge that must be settled!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Spied by a raging Grimnir, the umgi - who once claimed kith and kinship with the Dawi - dare to entrap and slay our throng. Hunt down this army and wipe the grudge from the Dammaz Kron!

missions.localised_description: Spied by a raging Grimnir, the umgi - who once claimed kith and kinship with the Dawi - dare to entrap and slay our throng. Hunt down this army and wipe the grudge from the Dammaz Kron!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by Grimnir's vengeful sight, the Greenskin mob attacks our own throng and fell urk treachery has forced a dishonourable retreat! We cannot - will not - let such a stain on Dawi courage past. A grudge is recorded, ensure it is settled!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by Grimnir's vengeful sight, the Greenskin mob attacks our own throng and fell urk treachery has forced a dishonourable retreat! We cannot - will not - let such a stain on Dawi courage past. A grudge is recorded, ensure it is settled!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Observed by the judgemental glare of Valaya, the filthy blood drinkers have claimed victory against honest, breathing, beard-growing Dawi. They are an affront to the Mother Goddess, hunt down this host and send them back to the dark!

missions.localised_description: Observed by the judgemental glare of Valaya, the filthy blood drinkers have claimed victory against honest, breathing, beard-growing Dawi. They are an affront to the Mother Goddess, hunt down this host and send them back to the dark!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen through Grungni's resentful gaze, the manling Knights in their shoddy, umgak armour have raided this Dawi-claimed region. Defeat these cretins to restore honour.

missions.localised_description: Seen through Grungni's resentful gaze, the manling Knights in their shoddy, umgak armour have raided this Dawi-claimed region. Defeat these cretins to restore honour.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Grimnir's raging sight, the Chaos corrupted umgi have raided our lands - a fell grudge indeed! Find these urks and defeat them, only then will Grimnir let such an atrocity against the Dawi relent.

missions.localised_description: Under Grimnir's raging sight, the Chaos corrupted umgi have raided our lands - a fell grudge indeed! Find these urks and defeat them, only then will Grimnir let such an atrocity against the Dawi relent.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Via Valaya's despairing glare, our territory has been raided - not by urk filth but by our own kin! A vile betrayal, a terrible grudge, and one that must be paid in Clan blood!

missions.localised_description: Via Valaya's despairing glare, our territory has been raided - not by urk filth but by our own kin! A vile betrayal, a terrible grudge, and one that must be paid in Clan blood!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In Gazul's vengeful sight, the manlings of the Empire have raided Dwarfen lands and taken Dwarfen treasure! This must be paid for in blood!

missions.localised_description: In Gazul's vengeful sight, the manlings of the Empire have raided Dwarfen lands and taken Dwarfen treasure! This must be paid for in blood!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the outraged sight of Grimnir, the grobi scum raid our mountains as they always have. Another grudge for the great book, another wrong to be righted, more Greenskins to hunt and kill!

missions.localised_description: Under the outraged sight of Grimnir, the grobi scum raid our mountains as they always have. Another grudge for the great book, another wrong to be righted, more Greenskins to hunt and kill!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by Thungni, an Undead host has raided our lands. Hunt down this horde of filthy bloodsuckers and visit vengeance upon them!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by Thungni, an Undead host has raided our lands. Hunt down this horde of filthy bloodsuckers and visit vengeance upon them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by Smednir's furious, fuming gaze, their crone of a goddess has sent her Knights sacking Dawi lands. Find these trespassers and hold them to account!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by Smednir's furious, fuming gaze, their crone of a goddess has sent her Knights sacking Dawi lands. Find these trespassers and hold them to account!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Valaya's agonised eyes, the northern manlings have despoiled our home, stolen artefacts and tainted sacred vaults. A grudge is in place, vengeance will be ours!

missions.localised_description: Seen by Valaya's agonised eyes, the northern manlings have despoiled our home, stolen artefacts and tainted sacred vaults. A grudge is in place, vengeance will be ours!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In Grungni's deplored sight, our kin have defiled a rival Hold. Such desecration of our own Karaks by treacherous Dawi cannot be tolerated! Find the enemy throng and punish them!

missions.localised_description: In Grungni's deplored sight, our kin have defiled a rival Hold. Such desecration of our own Karaks by treacherous Dawi cannot be tolerated! Find the enemy throng and punish them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Grimnir's vengeful stare, the Empire has betrayed and defiled our Holds, stealing our secrets and ruining proud Dwarfen works - as is typical of their kind. Find this army and claim retribution.

missions.localised_description: Under Grimnir's vengeful stare, the Empire has betrayed and defiled our Holds, stealing our secrets and ruining proud Dwarfen works - as is typical of their kind. Find this army and claim retribution.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beheld by a wrathful Grimnir, the old enemy, a Greenskin mob has sacked a Dwarfhold. The rage is deep, this is a grudge like no other! Find the grobi scum responsible and wipe them out!

missions.localised_description: Beheld by a wrathful Grimnir, the old enemy, a Greenskin mob has sacked a Dwarfhold. The rage is deep, this is a grudge like no other! Find the grobi scum responsible and wipe them out!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Regarded by Valaya's resentful eyes, Uzkular have invaded and sacked our proud Dwarfhold. Revenge must be enacted; the grudge put right. Find this grave-scum host and destroy them!

missions.localised_description: Regarded by Valaya's resentful eyes, Uzkular have invaded and sacked our proud Dwarfhold. Revenge must be enacted; the grudge put right. Find this grave-scum host and destroy them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Valaya's disappointed glare, infighting amongst the Dawi has led to an insurgency of Greenskins here. The grudge has been listed - end this despicable green influx!

missions.localised_description: Under Valaya's disappointed glare, infighting amongst the Dawi has led to an insurgency of Greenskins here. The grudge has been listed - end this despicable green influx!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the wrathful sight of Grimnir did Dwarfs of a rival Clan take this settlement by force. We cannot abide such wilful trespass. Remove them and restore the Dwarfhold to its rightful owners.

missions.localised_description: Under the wrathful sight of Grimnir did Dwarfs of a rival Clan take this settlement by force. We cannot abide such wilful trespass. Remove them and restore the Dwarfhold to its rightful owners.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Viewed by a weeping Valaya, rival Dwarfs have taken a Hold in lieu of a debt allegedly owed by the original inhabitants' ancestors. Lies! Restore the true owners.

missions.localised_description: Viewed by a weeping Valaya, rival Dwarfs have taken a Hold in lieu of a debt allegedly owed by the original inhabitants' ancestors. Lies! Restore the true owners.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by Grungni, the urk and grobi bastards have taken our Dwarfhold. Is there a fouler grudge ever recorded? Get it back!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by Grungni, the urk and grobi bastards have taken our Dwarfhold. Is there a fouler grudge ever recorded? Get it back!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the Greenskins have taken a Dwarfhold. A vile sin, this grudge has been entered into the book and must now be wiped clean. Take the Hold back and kill any grobi in our way!

missions.localised_description: Seen by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the Greenskins have taken a Dwarfhold. A vile sin, this grudge has been entered into the book and must now be wiped clean. Take the Hold back and kill any grobi in our way!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by a weeping Valaya, the enemy did come to our ancient home and ruin it. The Halls of the Ancestors lie discarded, the vaults raided! This is a black grudge, return the Hold and slay any who get in our way!

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by a weeping Valaya, the enemy did come to our ancient home and ruin it. The Halls of the Ancestors lie discarded, the vaults raided! This is a black grudge, return the Hold and slay any who get in our way!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As seen by Thungni's raging glare, innocent Dawi travelling through Stirland have been taken by the von Carstein Zangunaz and slain. Their bodies have been risen and made to perform a dread revel - a puppet re-enactment of Jaeger's travesty of a play, "Stoutheart Beardcomber and the Ostlander's Wife". This is a terrible grudge - for it is a terrible play - and one that must be paid with von Carstein heads!

missions.localised_description: As seen by Thungni's raging glare, innocent Dawi travelling through Stirland have been taken by the von Carstein Zangunaz and slain. Their bodies have been risen and made to perform a dread revel - a puppet re-enactment of Jaeger's travesty of a play, "Stoutheart Beardcomber and the Ostlander's Wife". This is a terrible grudge - for it is a terrible play - and one that must be paid with von Carstein heads!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Smednir's annoyed gaze, did the Dwarfs from Kraka Drak send their emissaries to Everpeak covered in Chaos-tainted beard ticks! Many Dawi set their beards alight to rid themselves of the parasitic embuggerence or covered their beards in acrid powder, which had the unfortunate side effect of bleaching said facial hair a drastic blonde colour! A grudge is recorded against the Norse Dwarfs - one that should be settled by ignoring these lice-carriers for a long time.

missions.localised_description: Under Smednir's annoyed gaze, did the Dwarfs from Kraka Drak send their emissaries to Everpeak covered in Chaos-tainted beard ticks! Many Dawi set their beards alight to rid themselves of the parasitic embuggerence or covered their beards in acrid powder, which had the unfortunate side effect of bleaching said facial hair a drastic blonde colour! A grudge is recorded against the Norse Dwarfs - one that should be settled by ignoring these lice-carriers for a long time.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Via Morgrim's discriminating glare, the manlings of Kislev are befouling sacred Dwarfen ale by mixing it with their distilled potato juice! Such contempt for honest Dwarfs ales tainted by this 'vodka' - they have even dared name it a 'boilermaker' - cannot be tolerated! This is a grudge of the highest order, let us show these manlings how Dawi feel about this... violation!

missions.localised_description: Via Morgrim's discriminating glare, the manlings of Kislev are befouling sacred Dwarfen ale by mixing it with their distilled potato juice! Such contempt for honest Dwarfs ales tainted by this 'vodka' - they have even dared name it a 'boilermaker' - cannot be tolerated! This is a grudge of the highest order, let us show these manlings how Dawi feel about this... violation!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Valaya's angry eyes, the Bretonnians have slain many thaggoraki in their fell nest to save a clutch of maidens, both umgi and Dawi. But it turns out that the kruti Knights, while gladly escorting the damsels back to safety, left the fair Dwarf maids to fend for themselves with sorry excuses about there not being enough room on the backs of their nags. An outrage and one that must be paid for with these Knights' blood.

missions.localised_description: Seen by Valaya's angry eyes, the Bretonnians have slain many thaggoraki in their fell nest to save a clutch of maidens, both umgi and Dawi. But it turns out that the kruti Knights, while gladly escorting the damsels back to safety, left the fair Dwarf maids to fend for themselves with sorry excuses about there not being enough room on the backs of their nags. An outrage and one that must be paid for with these Knights' blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beheld in Grimnir's seething sight, Bugman's Brewery was once the greatest of all brewhouses, where the fabled Bugman's XXXXX was created - a few casks of which still exist. But it all ended when the grobi fell upon the fortified brewery, enslaving and killing the Bugman Clan, and - worst of all - drinking the ale! Such an atrocity is a grudge that can never be truly settled. Go and slay Greenskins to salve this open wound!

missions.localised_description: Beheld in Grimnir's seething sight, Bugman's Brewery was once the greatest of all brewhouses, where the fabled Bugman's XXXXX was created - a few casks of which still exist. But it all ended when the grobi fell upon the fortified brewery, enslaving and killing the Bugman Clan, and - worst of all - drinking the ale! Such an atrocity is a grudge that can never be truly settled. Go and slay Greenskins to salve this open wound!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by a vengeful Grimnir, the Orcs have taken great delight in reminding us of their 'claim' on the Dragonback Mountains, of how they have defiled Ekrund and stolen its wealth. Enough! Even if we lack the stout hearts to take it back, we can spike their grog. Let us give them a taste of Dwarf medicine!

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by a vengeful Grimnir, the Orcs have taken great delight in reminding us of their 'claim' on the Dragonback Mountains, of how they have defiled Ekrund and stolen its wealth. Enough! Even if we lack the stout hearts to take it back, we can spike their grog. Let us give them a taste of Dwarf medicine!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Morgrim's disappointed glare, did the Dwarfs of Karak Ziflin steal away a cook bound for the kitchens of Karaz-a-Karak! The secret of his nutty fig pudding recipe was the reason - a spiteful move to deprive the High King of one of his favourites in petty retribution for a difficult Reckoner's inspection. A grudge has been recorded and there will be no negotiations with Ziflin until they give up the Halfling!

missions.localised_description: Under Morgrim's disappointed glare, did the Dwarfs of Karak Ziflin steal away a cook bound for the kitchens of Karaz-a-Karak! The secret of his nutty fig pudding recipe was the reason - a spiteful move to deprive the High King of one of his favourites in petty retribution for a difficult Reckoner's inspection. A grudge has been recorded and there will be no negotiations with Ziflin until they give up the Halfling!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by a concerned Valaya, the Karaz Ankor's ambassador to Nuln has returned with his beard shaved off! Apparently, the Countess Emmanuelle didn't take kindly to the Dawi's chance remark about the accuracy of the pupils at the Imperial Gunnery school! This is an affront to all Dwarfs - Nuln must pay!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by a concerned Valaya, the Karaz Ankor's ambassador to Nuln has returned with his beard shaved off! Apparently, the Countess Emmanuelle didn't take kindly to the Dawi's chance remark about the accuracy of the pupils at the Imperial Gunnery school! This is an affront to all Dwarfs - Nuln must pay!

localised_description.last_approved_text: By Grungni's indignant glare, the Imperial School of Engineers in the umgi city of Altdorf has claimed technical superiority over our kin! Such an offensive boast cannot go unchallenged, Dwarfen supremacy must be retained at all costs! Show the foolish manlings and their umgak machinery Dwarfen supremacy!

missions.localised_description: By Grungni's indignant glare, the Imperial School of Engineers in the umgi city of Altdorf has claimed technical superiority over our kin! Such an offensive boast cannot go unchallenged, Dwarfen supremacy must be retained at all costs! Show the foolish manlings and their umgak machinery Dwarfen supremacy!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In the stern eyes of Valaya did the Elector Count of Ostermark commission skilled Dwarf Engineers to raise a mighty fortress and then short-change the Dawi by two pennies. An outrage! Ransack Ostermark to recover the cost!

missions.localised_description: In the stern eyes of Valaya did the Elector Count of Ostermark commission skilled Dwarf Engineers to raise a mighty fortress and then short-change the Dawi by two pennies. An outrage! Ransack Ostermark to recover the cost!
Success

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows - kill him!

missions.localised_description: Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows - kill him!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This bearded mortal is a threat to our plans. Send the oath-shackled fool to an early grave and take his soul for good measure!

missions.localised_description: This bearded mortal is a threat to our plans. Send the oath-shackled fool to an early grave and take his soul for good measure!

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of Sigmar's little thralls challenges us. Ensure his death.

missions.localised_description: One of Sigmar's little thralls challenges us. Ensure his death.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, he should be devoured by you and you alone!

missions.localised_description: The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, he should be devoured by you and you alone!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, she should be devoured by you and your alone!

missions.localised_description: The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, she should be devoured by you and your alone!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskins are nothing more than noisome beasts, and now one of their number acts against us. Kill it.

missions.localised_description: The Greenskins are nothing more than noisome beasts, and now one of their number acts against us. Kill it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy him.

missions.localised_description: The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy him.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy her.

missions.localised_description: The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy her.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Chaos Gods are capricious - they demand one who was formally favoured be slain. Do it before they turn on you.

missions.localised_description: The Chaos Gods are capricious - they demand one who was formally favoured be slain. Do it before they turn on you.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Dwarf Lord has the blood of the hated God, Grimnir, coursing through his veins. Cut him open and imbibe his life-force, for the favour of the Ruinous Powers awaits.

missions.localised_description: This Dwarf Lord has the blood of the hated God, Grimnir, coursing through his veins. Cut him open and imbibe his life-force, for the favour of the Ruinous Powers awaits.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This man's soul demands to be ripped from his body and offered to our Dark Masters. Find him, slay him and take his soul for Chaos!

missions.localised_description: This man's soul demands to be ripped from his body and offered to our Dark Masters. Find him, slay him and take his soul for Chaos!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Lord is a thorn in our side! Pluck him from our flesh as every thorn should be!

missions.localised_description: This Lord is a thorn in our side! Pluck him from our flesh as every thorn should be!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Only Khorne values the mongrel souls of the Orcs - find this Orc Lord and take its life in the Blood God's name.

missions.localised_description: Only Khorne values the mongrel souls of the Orcs - find this Orc Lord and take its life in the Blood God's name.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Vampire thinks he is powerful, he arrogantly believes he can challenge the Chaos Gods themselves! By their blade, decapitate this Undead thrall!

missions.localised_description: This Vampire thinks he is powerful, he arrogantly believes he can challenge the Chaos Gods themselves! By their blade, decapitate this Undead thrall!

localised_description.last_approved_text: You are the one the Dark Gods favour as the Champion of Champions. Archaon's host is close, hunt down and kill the pretender!

missions.localised_description: You are the one the Dark Gods favour as the Champion of Champions. Archaon's host is close, hunt down and kill the pretender!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The High King's throng is close - if you take Grudgebearer's head the whole Dwarf Race will bear an eternal grudge - a glorious act indeed!

missions.localised_description: The High King's throng is close - if you take Grudgebearer's head the whole Dwarf Race will bear an eternal grudge - a glorious act indeed!
