localised_description.last_approved_text: The Ruinous Powers dare to set foot in lands claimed by von Carstein. Get the invaders, show them a new god - show them death!

missions.localised_description: The Ruinous Powers dare to set foot in lands claimed by von Carstein. Get the invaders, show them a new god - show them death!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs send their stunted kin to our lands in some foolish notion to steal our territory. They are not welcome here - eject the living from our lands!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfs send their stunted kin to our lands in some foolish notion to steal our territory. They are not welcome here - eject the living from our lands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Empire claim these lands as their own… They are trespassers! Invaders! See them destroyed!

missions.localised_description: The Empire claim these lands as their own… They are trespassers! Invaders! See them destroyed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy force is stomping around our lands. Show them the darkness of the grave!

missions.localised_description: This enemy force is stomping around our lands. Show them the darkness of the grave!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Orcs invade our lands. Find them, steal their breath and make them dead!

missions.localised_description: The Orcs invade our lands. Find them, steal their breath and make them dead!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A rival stalks our lands at the head of an Undead host. We must show him who the true ruler of the night is!

missions.localised_description: A rival stalks our lands at the head of an Undead host. We must show him who the true ruler of the night is!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy Vampire army shall fall before the might of our unholy host. Tread them into dust!

missions.localised_description: This enemy Vampire army shall fall before the might of our unholy host. Tread them into dust!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These mountain pigs have no place on the dread oceans. Sink their metal boats!

missions.localised_description: These mountain pigs have no place on the dread oceans. Sink their metal boats!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The ships of the Elector Counts are no match for our Dreadfleet. Seek out the Imperial ships and sink them.

missions.localised_description: The ships of the Elector Counts are no match for our Dreadfleet. Seek out the Imperial ships and sink them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Make this enemy fleet nothing more than a sorry collection of ghost ships!

missions.localised_description: Make this enemy fleet nothing more than a sorry collection of ghost ships!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Hunt down the Greenskin vessels that dare to stay afloat, send them down to the icy depths.

missions.localised_description: Hunt down the Greenskin vessels that dare to stay afloat, send them down to the icy depths.

localised_description.last_approved_text: An enemy Vampire fleet is no match for our mighty ships of bone and blood. Send the pretender's vessels to the depths.

missions.localised_description: An enemy Vampire fleet is no match for our mighty ships of bone and blood. Send the pretender's vessels to the depths.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Dwarfen region is ripe for harvesting. Send forth our legions to reap their lands!

missions.localised_description: This Dwarfen region is ripe for harvesting. Send forth our legions to reap their lands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This region of the Empire sits stagnant and rotting like an ageing corpse. Sack it and dispose of the remains.

missions.localised_description: This region of the Empire sits stagnant and rotting like an ageing corpse. Sack it and dispose of the remains.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Like a rotting corpse, this region is ripe for plunder. Send forth forces to reap their lands!

missions.localised_description: Like a rotting corpse, this region is ripe for plunder. Send forth forces to reap their lands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This region claimed by the Greenskins is ripe for harvest. Send our legions forth to do this.

missions.localised_description: This region claimed by the Greenskins is ripe for harvest. Send our legions forth to do this.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Undead region should be searched, and anything of value brought to us. Send out your forces.

missions.localised_description: This Undead region should be searched, and anything of value brought to us. Send out your forces.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As our eternal empire grows, so too, does the need to raise additional forces to protect our borders and expand further. We should raise an Undead host.

missions.localised_description: As our eternal empire grows, so too, does the need to raise additional forces to protect our borders and expand further. We should raise an Undead host.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Sea is not Manann's domain, but the dead's. Send forth the Ghost Ships - raise the Dreadfleet.

missions.localised_description: The Sea is not Manann's domain, but the dead's. Send forth the Ghost Ships - raise the Dreadfleet.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Dwarfen settlement is a canker on our plans. Destroy it. Steal its secrets and then bathe it in fire and blood.

missions.localised_description: This Dwarfen settlement is a canker on our plans. Destroy it. Steal its secrets and then bathe it in fire and blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The mortal settlement of the false Emperor should be no more. Reap what you can from it and then bring fire!

missions.localised_description: The mortal settlement of the false Emperor should be no more. Reap what you can from it and then bring fire!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This settlement offends our Undead majesty. Steal anything of value and then burn it to the ground, if you so wish.

missions.localised_description: This settlement offends our Undead majesty. Steal anything of value and then burn it to the ground, if you so wish.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The accursed Greenskin blight of a settlement must be purged. Take anything of value and put the rest to fire!

missions.localised_description: The accursed Greenskin blight of a settlement must be purged. Take anything of value and put the rest to fire!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No Vampire has the right to exist - except our lord - reap this lair. And then destroy it with fire.

missions.localised_description: No Vampire has the right to exist - except our lord - reap this lair. And then destroy it with fire.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Summon a Wight King - this ancient warrior's martial skills will help our damned cause.

missions.localised_description: Summon a Wight King - this ancient warrior's martial skills will help our damned cause.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Vampire Count under our dominion is a powerful ally. Just remember, they are as ambitious in their quest for power as us.

missions.localised_description: A Vampire Count under our dominion is a powerful ally. Just remember, they are as ambitious in their quest for power as us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The sorrowful wails of a Tomb Banshee are needed, their shrill screams should send enemies fleeing for their pitiful lives. Summon such a harridan.

missions.localised_description: The sorrowful wails of a Tomb Banshee are needed, their shrill screams should send enemies fleeing for their pitiful lives. Summon such a harridan.

localised_description.last_approved_text: We need a Necromancer in our legions. A wretched magic user whose abilities will aid our unbreathing legions. Consider recruiting one soon.

missions.localised_description: We need a Necromancer in our legions. A wretched magic user whose abilities will aid our unbreathing legions. Consider recruiting one soon.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Cavalry of the Undead is a fearsome spectacle, adding speed to our shambling forces. Add their might to our roster.

missions.localised_description: The Cavalry of the Undead is a fearsome spectacle, adding speed to our shambling forces. Add their might to our roster.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our melee hordes can overwhelm any foe and will never succumb to mortal concerns such as fear. Raise them!

missions.localised_description: Our melee hordes can overwhelm any foe and will never succumb to mortal concerns such as fear. Raise them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The pets of the Vampire Counts are fearsome Unliving creatures whose only desire is to serve. Read the books and summon them to our cause!

missions.localised_description: The pets of the Vampire Counts are fearsome Unliving creatures whose only desire is to serve. Read the books and summon them to our cause!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nagash never took much stock in war machines but he was wrong. Recruit engines of death - make their deadly mechanisms work in service to us!

missions.localised_description: Nagash never took much stock in war machines but he was wrong. Recruit engines of death - make their deadly mechanisms work in service to us!
Success
Success

localised_description.last_approved_text: All are pawns of Chaos, all must serve. Do as the Dark Gods wish and begin the destruction. Thus is the way prepared for the End Times.

missions.localised_description: All are pawns of Chaos, all must serve. Do as the Dark Gods wish and begin the destruction. Thus is the way prepared for the End Times.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A loyal servant to the Chaos Gods is one that enacts carnage - that raids and destroys and scatters the mortals before him.

missions.localised_description: A loyal servant to the Chaos Gods is one that enacts carnage - that raids and destroys and scatters the mortals before him.

localised_description.last_approved_text: All hail the champions of Chaos, it is they who the eyes of the Gods fall upon. They are the ones that risk damnation in exchange for a chance of greatness - continue the slaughter!

missions.localised_description: All hail the champions of Chaos, it is they who the eyes of the Gods fall upon. They are the ones that risk damnation in exchange for a chance of greatness - continue the slaughter!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The destroyer comes, and with him the favour of the Ruinous Powers. The southern lands of milk and honey will wither at his touch.

missions.localised_description: The destroyer comes, and with him the favour of the Ruinous Powers. The southern lands of milk and honey will wither at his touch.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Behold the Everchosen! The Daemons rejoice for the End Times are here. Destroy and corrupt those that still hold out against the inevitable. Chaos has come - the world will be broken!

missions.localised_description: Behold the Everchosen! The Daemons rejoice for the End Times are here. Destroy and corrupt those that still hold out against the inevitable. Chaos has come - the world will be broken!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Karaz Ankor has fallen into decline, assaulted by fell enemies above and below the ground… but no more! Everpeak has stirred, the High King demands that the Dwarf realm be brought back to its former glory. Let the task begin in earnest!

missions.localised_description: The Karaz Ankor has fallen into decline, assaulted by fell enemies above and below the ground… but no more! Everpeak has stirred, the High King demands that the Dwarf realm be brought back to its former glory. Let the task begin in earnest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Time of Woes a distant memory, the Dwarfs should look to the future and the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. The more territory around and even beyond their traditional mountain homes the Dwarfs can claim, the more the Ancestors will be pleased.

missions.localised_description: With the Time of Woes a distant memory, the Dwarfs should look to the future and the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. The more territory around and even beyond their traditional mountain homes the Dwarfs can claim, the more the Ancestors will be pleased.

localised_description.last_approved_text: There must be more Dwarf expeditions deployed - let them take the regions in the High King's name, and wipe out many grudges regarding those who stand against the Dwarf race. In this way the Karaz Ankor will be returned to its rightful glory!

missions.localised_description: There must be more Dwarf expeditions deployed - let them take the regions in the High King's name, and wipe out many grudges regarding those who stand against the Dwarf race. In this way the Karaz Ankor will be returned to its rightful glory!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: One Dwarfhold at a Time

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: One Dwarfhold at a Time

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Karaz Ankor will be great again, for Thorgrim has sworn it and the High King never reneges on an oath. Every Dwarf worth his beard bears the same bond. There are still regions outside of Dwarfen control, they must be brought under Karaz-a-Karak's dominion as soon as possible.

missions.localised_description: The Karaz Ankor will be great again, for Thorgrim has sworn it and the High King never reneges on an oath. Every Dwarf worth his beard bears the same bond. There are still regions outside of Dwarfen control, they must be brought under Karaz-a-Karak's dominion as soon as possible.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Not since Valaya and Grungni strode the mountains have the Dawi been in such a position. A few more realms taken will see the Karaz Ankor at its rightful stature - an empire ruled from Everpeak by a High King whose reign is as enduring as the mountains themselves. One last push, brave Dawi, one final push...

missions.localised_description: Not since Valaya and Grungni strode the mountains have the Dawi been in such a position. A few more realms taken will see the Karaz Ankor at its rightful stature - an empire ruled from Everpeak by a High King whose reign is as enduring as the mountains themselves. One last push, brave Dawi, one final push...

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: A Second Golden Age

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: A Second Golden Age

localised_description.last_approved_text: The election of a new Emperor has oft-led to turmoil as the machinations of the Elector Counts play out. But as the nobles conduct their petty power-struggles, the nation fractures. It is up to the newly-elected sovereign to begin the process of reunification - bringing an entire province under his rule must be a priority.

missions.localised_description: The election of a new Emperor has oft-led to turmoil as the machinations of the Elector Counts play out. But as the nobles conduct their petty power-struggles, the nation fractures. It is up to the newly-elected sovereign to begin the process of reunification - bringing an entire province under his rule must be a priority.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Even the worst Emperors in history, and - to our shame - there have been many, could claim to have more than one province under their rule. To truly bring the Empire back to greatness, the throne must exert its power to provinces further afield.

missions.localised_description: Even the worst Emperors in history, and - to our shame - there have been many, could claim to have more than one province under their rule. To truly bring the Empire back to greatness, the throne must exert its power to provinces further afield.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It was Magnus of Nuln that ended the turbulent Time of the Three Emperors, by defeating the Chaos Lord, Asavar Kul. In the wake of such a victory the Empire was united. To withstand another such invasion, we must be united again with more provinces under the Emperor's rule.

missions.localised_description: It was Magnus of Nuln that ended the turbulent Time of the Three Emperors, by defeating the Chaos Lord, Asavar Kul. In the wake of such a victory the Empire was united. To withstand another such invasion, we must be united again with more provinces under the Emperor's rule.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: As Magnus Did, So Shall We

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: As Magnus Did, So Shall We

localised_description.last_approved_text: The time of feuding Elector Counts and petty squabbles between provinces is over. The encroaching threat from the north cannot be ignored any longer. To face the armies of Chaos the Empire must be as one. Only then does mankind stand a chance against the Dark Powers and their minions.

missions.localised_description: The time of feuding Elector Counts and petty squabbles between provinces is over. The encroaching threat from the north cannot be ignored any longer. To face the armies of Chaos the Empire must be as one. Only then does mankind stand a chance against the Dark Powers and their minions.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This time will be known as the Age of Franz; not since Magnus the Pious has there been an Emperor so beloved of his people and successful in bringing the provinces under Sigmar's banner. Such glory infuriates the Dark Gods, and they will strike hard to destroy the dynasty of the Reikland Princes. Unite the last of the realms, for Chaos comes!

missions.localised_description: This time will be known as the Age of Franz; not since Magnus the Pious has there been an Emperor so beloved of his people and successful in bringing the provinces under Sigmar's banner. Such glory infuriates the Dark Gods, and they will strike hard to destroy the dynasty of the Reikland Princes. Unite the last of the realms, for Chaos comes!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: The Age of Franz

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: The Age of Franz

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grimgor's traditional stompin' ground was the northern peaks of the World's Edge Mountains, where he laid waste to Kislev and even marched through Sylvania, bedecking his banners with Vampire fangs. Since coming south to slap Gorfang Rotgut, Grimgor might as well hang around for a bit, and sort this sorry lot out. Gits.

missions.localised_description: Grimgor's traditional stompin' ground was the northern peaks of the World's Edge Mountains, where he laid waste to Kislev and even marched through Sylvania, bedecking his banners with Vampire fangs. Since coming south to slap Gorfang Rotgut, Grimgor might as well hang around for a bit, and sort this sorry lot out. Gits.

localised_description.last_approved_text: If the Greenskins are going to fear Grimgor - as they should - then he must take control and build up a great green empire from which he can launch an invasion to crush all enemies. The local tribes must fall into line or get a proper bootin'.

missions.localised_description: If the Greenskins are going to fear Grimgor - as they should - then he must take control and build up a great green empire from which he can launch an invasion to crush all enemies. The local tribes must fall into line or get a proper bootin'.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: Get da Gits in Order

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: Get da Gits in Order

localised_description.last_approved_text: It's time to stop messing around and put the boot in! The Badlands, the World's Edge, the Empire - all of it is Grimgor's! Destroy the trespassers, take their lands and get the Waaagh! started.

missions.localised_description: It's time to stop messing around and put the boot in! The Badlands, the World's Edge, the Empire - all of it is Grimgor's! Destroy the trespassers, take their lands and get the Waaagh! started.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: Put da Boot In

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Put da Boot In

localised_description.last_approved_text: The momentum shifts as the Orc realms expand. The Dwarfs quail, the Empire shudders, even the forces of Chaos stutter as the Green Tide rises. Now is the time to bring outlying territories into Grimgor's clutches.

missions.localised_description: The momentum shifts as the Orc realms expand. The Dwarfs quail, the Empire shudders, even the forces of Chaos stutter as the Green Tide rises. Now is the time to bring outlying territories into Grimgor's clutches.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Waaagh! is upon the Greenskins. The Orcs gather in great numbers and so they must bring as many regions under Grimgor's iron fist as possible - such an act will appease Gork and Mork and ensure that Grimgor's name is remembered for all time!

missions.localised_description: A Waaagh! is upon the Greenskins. The Orcs gather in great numbers and so they must bring as many regions under Grimgor's iron fist as possible - such an act will appease Gork and Mork and ensure that Grimgor's name is remembered for all time!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Since Count Mannfred's unfortunate defeat at Hel Fenn, Sylvania has been in decline. No longer is it feared as the dread land where the dead do not rest, but instead is seen as Stirland's bastard child. Now a von Carstein resides in Castle Drakenhof once again, it is time for the Vampires to take dominion over their haunted realm.

missions.localised_description: Since Count Mannfred's unfortunate defeat at Hel Fenn, Sylvania has been in decline. No longer is it feared as the dread land where the dead do not rest, but instead is seen as Stirland's bastard child. Now a von Carstein resides in Castle Drakenhof once again, it is time for the Vampires to take dominion over their haunted realm.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Mannfred's influence must spread across all of Sylvania and beyond into the Empire itself if he is to realise his dread ambition of becoming the first and only Eternal Emperor. But before he can rule, a powerbase should be established and fresh troops risen for the challenges ahead.

missions.localised_description: Mannfred's influence must spread across all of Sylvania and beyond into the Empire itself if he is to realise his dread ambition of becoming the first and only Eternal Emperor. But before he can rule, a powerbase should be established and fresh troops risen for the challenges ahead.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: The Spread of Undeath

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: The Spread of Undeath

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now is the time for Fell Bats to blot out the sun, for gloom to fall upon the lands of the living and the Long Night to begin. Mannfred's dominion shall extend far and wide if the prophecies in the Liber Noctus are to come true.

missions.localised_description: Now is the time for Fell Bats to blot out the sun, for gloom to fall upon the lands of the living and the Long Night to begin. Mannfred's dominion shall extend far and wide if the prophecies in the Liber Noctus are to come true.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Mannfred's fell influence saturates the lands, but for the scions of Sigmar's Blood to truly fear the power of the Vampires then all the Old World must be taken in von Carstein's name. Nothing is beyond the reach of the Midnight Aristocracy!

missions.localised_description: Mannfred's fell influence saturates the lands, but for the scions of Sigmar's Blood to truly fear the power of the Vampires then all the Old World must be taken in von Carstein's name. Nothing is beyond the reach of the Midnight Aristocracy!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

localised_description.last_approved_text: The time is now - Mannfred von Carstein needs to make his move and take Sigmar's throne, or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. Mannfred will rule over all as an Eternal Emperor - an immortal King that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

missions.localised_description: The time is now - Mannfred von Carstein needs to make his move and take Sigmar's throne, or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. Mannfred will rule over all as an Eternal Emperor - an immortal King that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Slayers to the fore, chanting songs of battle doom, Thorgrim’s throng sets forth for the Troll Country. Ahead lie countless dangers, but the Masters of Steel and Stone are ever dauntless, and if they should meet their end in the icy wastes, they shall do so with bright honour, climbing over the bodies of their defeated foes as they set foot upon the Path of Grimnir.

missions.localised_description: With the Slayers to the fore, chanting songs of battle doom, Thorgrim’s throng sets forth for the Troll Country. Ahead lie countless dangers, but the Masters of Steel and Stone are ever dauntless, and if they should meet their end in the icy wastes, they shall do so with bright honour, climbing over the bodies of their defeated foes as they set foot upon the Path of Grimnir.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The High King's scout reports the presence of numerous Orc and Goblin warriors engaged in some sort of ritual activity which appears to be centred around several Shamans. Given that the Pillar of Bone is known to be a nexus of arcane power, Thorgrim is determined to disrupt the ritual. With the reassuring "Thwoppa, Thwoppa, Thwoppa" of Gyrocopter rotors overhead, he orders the battle horns sounded. The new flying units will have an early opportunity to prove their usefulness.

missions.localised_description: The High King's scout reports the presence of numerous Orc and Goblin warriors engaged in some sort of ritual activity which appears to be centred around several Shamans. Given that the Pillar of Bone is known to be a nexus of arcane power, Thorgrim is determined to disrupt the ritual. With the reassuring "Thwoppa, Thwoppa, Thwoppa" of Gyrocopter rotors overhead, he orders the battle horns sounded. The new flying units will have an early opportunity to prove their usefulness.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Thane returns and makes his report. A dark cloud has descended over Sylvania, and in the midst of its gloom he found several sacked caravans, surrounded with the broken detritus of a desperate fight. Though there were no corpses, a freezing dread pervaded the area. As he picked through the remnants, the Thane was disturbed by a moaning sound and was horrified when shambling figures emerged from the fog. The dead walk Sylvania’s benighted land once more! Cutting a path out, the warrior made his escape. In the sickly moonlight he passed bands of the Undead, all of them lurching northwards toward the vile fog-enshrouded marshes of Hel Fenn. Sprinkling sand on the fresh ink with which he has recorded all of this, Thorgrim slams shut the Book of Grudges, ordering the horns to be sounded and the throng armed. Evil stalks Sylvania once more and the axes of the Dwarfs will oppose it, and as of old, they will face it at Hel Fenn.

missions.localised_description: The Thane returns and makes his report. A dark cloud has descended over Sylvania, and in the midst of its gloom he found several sacked caravans, surrounded with the broken detritus of a desperate fight. Though there were no corpses, a freezing dread pervaded the area. As he picked through the remnants, the Thane was disturbed by a moaning sound and was horrified when shambling figures emerged from the fog. The dead walk Sylvania’s benighted land once more! Cutting a path out, the warrior made his escape. In the sickly moonlight he passed bands of the Undead, all of them lurching northwards toward the vile fog-enshrouded marshes of Hel Fenn. Sprinkling sand on the fresh ink with which he has recorded all of this, Thorgrim slams shut the Book of Grudges, ordering the horns to be sounded and the throng armed. Evil stalks Sylvania once more and the axes of the Dwarfs will oppose it, and as of old, they will face it at Hel Fenn.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The scout reports smoke on the horizon near to Black Fire Pass and a great pall of dust betraying the passage of countless marching feet. The Waaagh! approaches! Thorgrim dispatches messengers to his allies. It is time for old allies to stand shoulder-to-shoulder in the bone-scattered pass, with the fate of the Old World once again balanced upon a blade’s edge.

missions.localised_description: The scout reports smoke on the horizon near to Black Fire Pass and a great pall of dust betraying the passage of countless marching feet. The Waaagh! approaches! Thorgrim dispatches messengers to his allies. It is time for old allies to stand shoulder-to-shoulder in the bone-scattered pass, with the fate of the Old World once again balanced upon a blade’s edge.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The flow of Greenskins towards the north must be halted. Make haste, for any concentration of grobi spells trouble for Dwarfen kind. If the Orcs and Goblins were of a mind to ambush the King's army, however, then Thundering Falls would be a good place to do it...

missions.localised_description: The flow of Greenskins towards the north must be halted. Make haste, for any concentration of grobi spells trouble for Dwarfen kind. If the Orcs and Goblins were of a mind to ambush the King's army, however, then Thundering Falls would be a good place to do it...

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the throng marches north, Ungrim finds his step matching itself to an ever more insistent rhythm. What began as the faintest flutter has now swelled into a pulsing cadence that drives him on. As the Slayer King crests a ridge near High Pass, a crashing discordancy rises within the symphony yet still aligns itself with the overall construction. Climbing to the summit of the pass is a great Ruinous host marching beneath the dread banner of a mighty Lord of Chaos. Ungrim’s gaze falls upon the Chaos Lord, his adversary's head snaps up and their eyes lock. The symphony rises to a crescendo and Ungrim’s axe pulses in his hands as he screams his battle cry.

missions.localised_description: As the throng marches north, Ungrim finds his step matching itself to an ever more insistent rhythm. What began as the faintest flutter has now swelled into a pulsing cadence that drives him on. As the Slayer King crests a ridge near High Pass, a crashing discordancy rises within the symphony yet still aligns itself with the overall construction. Climbing to the summit of the pass is a great Ruinous host marching beneath the dread banner of a mighty Lord of Chaos. Ungrim’s gaze falls upon the Chaos Lord, his adversary's head snaps up and their eyes lock. The symphony rises to a crescendo and Ungrim’s axe pulses in his hands as he screams his battle cry.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskin horde is heading for Broken Leg Gully, which links with Karak Kadrin nearby. As Ungrim considers these tidings, the war horns sound. The Waaagh! has come!

missions.localised_description: The Greenskin horde is heading for Broken Leg Gully, which links with Karak Kadrin nearby. As Ungrim considers these tidings, the war horns sound. The Waaagh! has come!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskins have taken Ungrim's bait and an immense horde has boiled out of the Badlands, heading north for Broken Leg Gully. If truth be told, Ungrim Ironfist hasn’t particularly enjoyed the tasks that his High King has set before him up until this point. There is an underhandedness to them that is a murky mirror to the vile nature of the urks and grobi. The Slayer King prefers the clean simplicity of the shieldwall, and now he will cleanse himself in a battle of annihilation on the slopes of Broken Leg Gully.

missions.localised_description: The Greenskins have taken Ungrim's bait and an immense horde has boiled out of the Badlands, heading north for Broken Leg Gully. If truth be told, Ungrim Ironfist hasn’t particularly enjoyed the tasks that his High King has set before him up until this point. There is an underhandedness to them that is a murky mirror to the vile nature of the urks and grobi. The Slayer King prefers the clean simplicity of the shieldwall, and now he will cleanse himself in a battle of annihilation on the slopes of Broken Leg Gully.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having pursued the enemy for several days, Ungrim's throng finally tracks them down to an ill-omened shrine near the River Stir on the borders of Talabecland and Stirland. There is no sign of a dragon cave and it would seem that this force was merely a distraction. Nevertheless, they are a threat that needs dealing with. The Undead horde are arrayed for battle around the shrine, before which some sort of summoning ritual is being conducted by a black-robed figure. Desperate to interrupt the evil rite, the Dwarfs charge.

missions.localised_description: Having pursued the enemy for several days, Ungrim's throng finally tracks them down to an ill-omened shrine near the River Stir on the borders of Talabecland and Stirland. There is no sign of a dragon cave and it would seem that this force was merely a distraction. Nevertheless, they are a threat that needs dealing with. The Undead horde are arrayed for battle around the shrine, before which some sort of summoning ritual is being conducted by a black-robed figure. Desperate to interrupt the evil rite, the Dwarfs charge.

localised_description.last_approved_text: After a hard march, even for the doughty Dwarfs, they come upon the Undead. Their numbers are higher than Ungrim had anticipated. It would seem that the two forces that crossed Sylvania's border have combined into one great army of the dead. Facing the entrance to a great cave, a pale figure in a black cloak stands with arms upraised, a pale nimbus of liche-light surrounding him. Eerie words of summoning drift upon the chill wind. Though the Vampire Lord seems absorbed with his rite, the dead who serve him are not. They adopt a defensive stance around their Lord. Pale skeletal warriors await the Dwarfs in a silence broken only by mindless moans of numberless Zombies and the feral cackling of Ghouls and other nameless horrors.

missions.localised_description: After a hard march, even for the doughty Dwarfs, they come upon the Undead. Their numbers are higher than Ungrim had anticipated. It would seem that the two forces that crossed Sylvania's border have combined into one great army of the dead. Facing the entrance to a great cave, a pale figure in a black cloak stands with arms upraised, a pale nimbus of liche-light surrounding him. Eerie words of summoning drift upon the chill wind. Though the Vampire Lord seems absorbed with his rite, the dead who serve him are not. They adopt a defensive stance around their Lord. Pale skeletal warriors await the Dwarfs in a silence broken only by mindless moans of numberless Zombies and the feral cackling of Ghouls and other nameless horrors.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A torrid sun beats down on the troops as they traverse the dusty plains before the Estalian foothills. Strangely though, the men feel a growing chill in their marrow the closer the ominous peaks come. When the Supreme Patriarch signals a halt before a cleft in a cliff, many hardened veterans can barely master their fear at the waves of freezing enmity emanating from the dark opening. Gelt himself seems unaffected though, apart from a grim satisfaction that this is surely the tomb he seeks.

missions.localised_description: A torrid sun beats down on the troops as they traverse the dusty plains before the Estalian foothills. Strangely though, the men feel a growing chill in their marrow the closer the ominous peaks come. When the Supreme Patriarch signals a halt before a cleft in a cliff, many hardened veterans can barely master their fear at the waves of freezing enmity emanating from the dark opening. Gelt himself seems unaffected though, apart from a grim satisfaction that this is surely the tomb he seeks.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Gelt leads his men beneath the rough stone lintel of the ancient barrow mound, the shadows crowd in upon him, dimming even the light emanating from his raised staff. Creeping despair wreathes the hearts of the warriors as they descend, tightening its coils as ominous sounds echo in the gloom: bone on stone, pitted blade on rusted scabbard. It seems that the loyalty of the buried king's ancient retainers remains firm even in death.

missions.localised_description: As Gelt leads his men beneath the rough stone lintel of the ancient barrow mound, the shadows crowd in upon him, dimming even the light emanating from his raised staff. Creeping despair wreathes the hearts of the warriors as they descend, tightening its coils as ominous sounds echo in the gloom: bone on stone, pitted blade on rusted scabbard. It seems that the loyalty of the buried king's ancient retainers remains firm even in death.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the route scouted ahead, Gelt sets out for Broken Leg Gully to claim the Gromril for his own. The Dwarfs can keep their secrets, Gelt will discover the means himself!

missions.localised_description: With the route scouted ahead, Gelt sets out for Broken Leg Gully to claim the Gromril for his own. The Dwarfs can keep their secrets, Gelt will discover the means himself!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the route scouted ahead, Gelt sets out for Broken Leg Gully to claim the Gromril for his own. The Dwarfs can keep their secrets, Gelt will discover the means himself!

missions.localised_description: With the route scouted ahead, Gelt sets out for Broken Leg Gully to claim the Gromril for his own. The Dwarfs can keep their secrets, Gelt will discover the means himself!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It seems that the process of transmutation is dangerously unpredictable, and Gelt has barely survived the resulting explosion. However, his first-hand experience of the forces involved gives him an insight into an artefact that may reduce the risk. Gelt’s researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity.

missions.localised_description: It seems that the process of transmutation is dangerously unpredictable, and Gelt has barely survived the resulting explosion. However, his first-hand experience of the forces involved gives him an insight into an artefact that may reduce the risk. Gelt’s researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Gelt's contact reports that the recent storms are almost certainly due to the activities of a Chaos host rumoured to be attempting the conjuration of the mighty Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Kholek Suneater, the so-called "Herald of the Tempest", somewhere high in the southern-most tip of the World's Edge Mountains. Gelt persuades the Emperor that this represents a threat to the Empire and sets off at the head of an army to intervene.

missions.localised_description: Gelt's contact reports that the recent storms are almost certainly due to the activities of a Chaos host rumoured to be attempting the conjuration of the mighty Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Kholek Suneater, the so-called "Herald of the Tempest", somewhere high in the southern-most tip of the World's Edge Mountains. Gelt persuades the Emperor that this represents a threat to the Empire and sets off at the head of an army to intervene.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The wild storm activity around the battle site yields a lodestone of magnificent proportions. Satisfied with his bounty, Gelt retraces his steps to Altdorf, confident that this will see off Orr’s challenge. The rival Light Wizard, however, has other ideas. He ambushes Gelt and a ferocious eldritch battle ensues.

missions.localised_description: The wild storm activity around the battle site yields a lodestone of magnificent proportions. Satisfied with his bounty, Gelt retraces his steps to Altdorf, confident that this will see off Orr’s challenge. The rival Light Wizard, however, has other ideas. He ambushes Gelt and a ferocious eldritch battle ensues.

Satisfied with his bounty, Gelt retraces his steps to Altdorf, confident that this will see off Orr’s challenge. The rival Light Wizard, however, has other ideas. He ambushes Gelt and a ferocious eldritch battle ensues.

He ambushes Gelt and a ferocious eldritch battle ensues.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Hoping that his Dwarfen allies will arrive in time to aid him, Karl Franz prepares to face the Greenskin onslaught, aware that this is the greatest test that he has yet faced in his reign as Emperor.

missions.localised_description: Hoping that his Dwarfen allies will arrive in time to aid him, Karl Franz prepares to face the Greenskin onslaught, aware that this is the greatest test that he has yet faced in his reign as Emperor.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Those that would break away from the rule of the Emperor are nothing but tenacious. They have sent a request for assistance to their allies in the north, and this appeal has been answered with covert detachments of men. Our spies have revealed the massing of a military force in the Bloodpine Woods. Take the fight to them before they can grow into an army.

missions.localised_description: Those that would break away from the rule of the Emperor are nothing but tenacious. They have sent a request for assistance to their allies in the north, and this appeal has been answered with covert detachments of men. Our spies have revealed the massing of a military force in the Bloodpine Woods. Take the fight to them before they can grow into an army.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a massive Norscan force en route to Nordland's shores, the Emperor must show that his reign is one of military strength; that none should doubt the power of the Emperor. He must drive the Norscan army back into the Sea of Claws!

missions.localised_description: With a massive Norscan force en route to Nordland's shores, the Emperor must show that his reign is one of military strength; that none should doubt the power of the Emperor. He must drive the Norscan army back into the Sea of Claws!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Vampiress (for such she seems to be) has chosen to fight near a shrine of ill omen. She has raised an army of corpses to defend herself with.

missions.localised_description: The Vampiress (for such she seems to be) has chosen to fight near a shrine of ill omen. She has raised an army of corpses to defend herself with.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Trapped by the waters, the Vampiress (for such she seems to be) has been brought to bay near a shrine of ill omen. She is raising an army of corpses to defend herself with.

missions.localised_description: Trapped by the waters, the Vampiress (for such she seems to be) has been brought to bay near a shrine of ill omen. She is raising an army of corpses to defend herself with.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Word has come back from Azhag's sneak-thief scout. Down in Bretonnia, those stoopid humies prance about on their ponies on the burial mound of Grudsnik. No wonder the gods ain't 'appy, dat's 'allowed ground. Go give 'em a big slap...

missions.localised_description: Word has come back from Azhag's sneak-thief scout. Down in Bretonnia, those stoopid humies prance about on their ponies on the burial mound of Grudsnik. No wonder the gods ain't 'appy, dat's 'allowed ground. Go give 'em a big slap...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The crown awaits, and already Azhag can hear a faint whispering voice of ancient evil drawing him onwards.

missions.localised_description: The crown awaits, and already Azhag can hear a faint whispering voice of ancient evil drawing him onwards.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Again Azhag's strange decisions have borne fruit. The scout he send out reports that finally, the humie fugitives gather in numbers great enough to offer battle at a place called Butcher's Hill. Azhag laughs as he surveys their forces, then twitches and thumps his iron crown, "Shuddup iron 'at, we'll go south later. I got some bizniss 'ere first!".

missions.localised_description: Again Azhag's strange decisions have borne fruit. The scout he send out reports that finally, the humie fugitives gather in numbers great enough to offer battle at a place called Butcher's Hill. Azhag laughs as he surveys their forces, then twitches and thumps his iron crown, "Shuddup iron 'at, we'll go south later. I got some bizniss 'ere first!".

localised_description.last_approved_text: In the Southern Badlands the primitive Savage Orcs gather to hinder Azhag’s horde. The Slaughterer needs to dominate these tribes, so forces the Savage Orcs, led by some git called ‘Slagga’, to acknowledge him!

missions.localised_description: In the Southern Badlands the primitive Savage Orcs gather to hinder Azhag’s horde. The Slaughterer needs to dominate these tribes, so forces the Savage Orcs, led by some git called ‘Slagga’, to acknowledge him!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Shrewdly concluding that reporting in person again to Grimgor would likely have fatal consequences, the Goblin agent has instead sent word via a naïve (and doomed) Snotling messenger. It seems that the Dwarfs have got wind of a Chaos Warband returning from the Dark Lands to the East where they have collected a consignment of equipment from the wicked Chaos Dwarfs. The Dwarfs have gathered several throngs to intercept them as they pass through the northern World's Edge Mountains. One of these throngs is en route through Broken Leg Gully. Grimgor seizes his axe and marches forth immediately, pausing only to boot the Snotling out of his path. His bodyguard, Da Immortulz, follow, with the rest of the Greenskins a safe-ish distance behind them.

missions.localised_description: Shrewdly concluding that reporting in person again to Grimgor would likely have fatal consequences, the Goblin agent has instead sent word via a naïve (and doomed) Snotling messenger. It seems that the Dwarfs have got wind of a Chaos Warband returning from the Dark Lands to the East where they have collected a consignment of equipment from the wicked Chaos Dwarfs. The Dwarfs have gathered several throngs to intercept them as they pass through the northern World's Edge Mountains. One of these throngs is en route through Broken Leg Gully. Grimgor seizes his axe and marches forth immediately, pausing only to boot the Snotling out of his path. His bodyguard, Da Immortulz, follow, with the rest of the Greenskins a safe-ish distance behind them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The scout reports that a force of Chaos Warriors is approaching High Pass in the northern World's Edge Mountains. They are clearly returning north from the Dark Lands where they are known to trade with the wicked Chaos Dwarfs for items of power. On course from the south is a second force, this one belonging to the Dwarfs and clearly intent on intercepting the first army. With the scent of battle in his nostrils, Grimgor marches over the reporting scout, heading north.

missions.localised_description: The scout reports that a force of Chaos Warriors is approaching High Pass in the northern World's Edge Mountains. They are clearly returning north from the Dark Lands where they are known to trade with the wicked Chaos Dwarfs for items of power. On course from the south is a second force, this one belonging to the Dwarfs and clearly intent on intercepting the first army. With the scent of battle in his nostrils, Grimgor marches over the reporting scout, heading north.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With his mob following a safe distance behind him, Grimgor stomps toward Black Fire Pass, a murderous red gleam in his eye. Any boyz reckless enough to come near, hear him growling, "I'm gonna stomp 'em to dust, I'm gonna grind their bones. I'm gonna pile 'em up inna big fire and roast 'em. I'm gonna bash 'eads, break faces and jump up and down on da bits dat are left. An' den I'm gonna get really mean."

missions.localised_description: With his mob following a safe distance behind him, Grimgor stomps toward Black Fire Pass, a murderous red gleam in his eye. Any boyz reckless enough to come near, hear him growling, "I'm gonna stomp 'em to dust, I'm gonna grind their bones. I'm gonna pile 'em up inna big fire and roast 'em. I'm gonna bash 'eads, break faces and jump up and down on da bits dat are left. An' den I'm gonna get really mean."

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Dwarfen artillery brigade was foolish enough to leave the safety of its keep, marching too close to the Greenskin host. Smash them from front and back before they can even load their guns!

missions.localised_description: A Dwarfen artillery brigade was foolish enough to leave the safety of its keep, marching too close to the Greenskin host. Smash them from front and back before they can even load their guns!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having haunted the Vaults for several days, Kemmler’s forces have intercepted several warbands of Chaos Raiders. Their presence suggests some hidden purpose. Kemmler traces their movements onto a glacier in the high peaks. Lost memories return to Kemmler and he recalls tales of a great Champion of Chaos slain by the hand of Sigmar himself in battle. Could this be the tomb of Krell?

missions.localised_description: Having haunted the Vaults for several days, Kemmler’s forces have intercepted several warbands of Chaos Raiders. Their presence suggests some hidden purpose. Kemmler traces their movements onto a glacier in the high peaks. Lost memories return to Kemmler and he recalls tales of a great Champion of Chaos slain by the hand of Sigmar himself in battle. Could this be the tomb of Krell?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kemmler receives word of a likely location for Marbad’s tomb in southern Middenland. On the fringes of the forest lies a barrow mound so huge that it can easily be mistaken for a natural hill. However, places of death are not easily disguised against those who serve death. Though its exact nature is unclear to most, the barrow’s innate power has drawn others to it, and the agent reports that a local tribe of Forest Goblins uses its summit for their rituals. It seems likely that any attempt by Kemmler to disturb Marbad’s eternal rest will also stir up the Greenskins. However, no challenge is sufficiently daunting to deny the Lichemaster an opportunity to paw through a trove of ancient grave goods in his unending search for power.

missions.localised_description: Kemmler receives word of a likely location for Marbad’s tomb in southern Middenland. On the fringes of the forest lies a barrow mound so huge that it can easily be mistaken for a natural hill. However, places of death are not easily disguised against those who serve death. Though its exact nature is unclear to most, the barrow’s innate power has drawn others to it, and the agent reports that a local tribe of Forest Goblins uses its summit for their rituals. It seems likely that any attempt by Kemmler to disturb Marbad’s eternal rest will also stir up the Greenskins. However, no challenge is sufficiently daunting to deny the Lichemaster an opportunity to paw through a trove of ancient grave goods in his unending search for power.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having summoned a lesser Vampire from Sylvania, Kemmler dispatches her to la Maisontaal. Her task is to use her exotic beauty to beguile the leader of the mercenaries into accepting a contract to attack the abbey's defenders. Within hours, she returns and reports that the mercenaries will launch their attack the following night. Kemmler readies his force and as the sounds of battle rise from the abbey he signals for his Undead horde to move in for the kill. The abbey will fall, and the Lichemaster's eyes glitter at the prospect of the power he will unearth within its walls.

missions.localised_description: Having summoned a lesser Vampire from Sylvania, Kemmler dispatches her to la Maisontaal. Her task is to use her exotic beauty to beguile the leader of the mercenaries into accepting a contract to attack the abbey's defenders. Within hours, she returns and reports that the mercenaries will launch their attack the following night. Kemmler readies his force and as the sounds of battle rise from the abbey he signals for his Undead horde to move in for the kill. The abbey will fall, and the Lichemaster's eyes glitter at the prospect of the power he will unearth within its walls.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A sickly moon hangs low over the foothills of the Grey Mountains, casting a corpse-pale light on the plains beyond. The Lichemaster stands atop a ridge, watching as an Empire army emerges from Axe Bite Pass and marches toward the Abbey. Across the plain, the tiny figure of a Bretonnian rider can be dimly discerned as he rides frantically along the road from the Abbey to the fortress of Montfort. Kemmler’s plan has worked even better than he could have hoped! The fools of both blind nations are each other's throats thanks to his machinations! As the two forces clash, Kemmler signals for his Undead horde to move in for the kill. The abbey will fall, and the Lichemaster’s eyes glitter at the prospect of the power he will unearth within its walls.

missions.localised_description: A sickly moon hangs low over the foothills of the Grey Mountains, casting a corpse-pale light on the plains beyond. Kemmler’s plan has worked even better than he could have hoped! The fools of both blind nations are each other's throats thanks to his machinations! As the two forces clash, Kemmler signals for his Undead horde to move in for the kill. The abbey will fall, and the Lichemaster’s eyes glitter at the prospect of the power he will unearth within its walls.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Necromancer returns and makes his sly obeisance before Count Mannfred. He has travelled throughout the Badlands, conducting dark summoning rituals at the many battle sites to be found there. Having questioned the spirits of countless slain warriors, he eventually located a likely site on the southern border of the region. Unfortunately, he has been unable to investigate the area fully due to the presence of large numbers of primitive Savage Orc tribes who roam the plains there, watched over by the crude idols of their gods. It seems that the Vampire Count will need to reconnoitre the area in force if he is to gain the answers he seeks, since the Savage Orcs are unlikely to let any intrusion into their territory go unchallenged.

missions.localised_description: The Necromancer returns and makes his sly obeisance before Count Mannfred. He has travelled throughout the Badlands, conducting dark summoning rituals at the many battle sites to be found there. Having questioned the spirits of countless slain warriors, he eventually located a likely site on the southern border of the region. Unfortunately, he has been unable to investigate the area fully due to the presence of large numbers of primitive Savage Orc tribes who roam the plains there, watched over by the crude idols of their gods. It seems that the Vampire Count will need to reconnoitre the area in force if he is to gain the answers he seeks, since the Savage Orcs are unlikely to let any intrusion into their territory go unchallenged.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Necromancer sends word that Grudsnik’s mound lies to the east of Castle Carcassonne whose Duke commands a powerful garrison. Doubtless this puny mortal will try to interfere with Mannfred's plans, but no matter; his corpse will serve the Count as well as that of any other man.

missions.localised_description: The Necromancer sends word that Grudsnik’s mound lies to the east of Castle Carcassonne whose Duke commands a powerful garrison. Doubtless this puny mortal will try to interfere with Mannfred's plans, but no matter; his corpse will serve the Count as well as that of any other man.

localised_description.last_approved_text: An expeditionary force of soldiers have been sighted at Hel Fenn. The Empire will regret deploying troops this far from home. The Vampire Counts must crush their army, drive the terrified survivors from your lands, and raise their dead into your service.

missions.localised_description: An expeditionary force of soldiers have been sighted at Hel Fenn. The Empire will regret deploying troops this far from home. The Vampire Counts must crush their army, drive the terrified survivors from your lands, and raise their dead into your service.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The thrall reports that the Greenskins have gathered in great numbers around the Pillar of Bone and that their Shamans are engaged in one of their primitive rituals to their gods, Gork and Mork. Mannfred fingers his sword thoughtfully then calls to his Wight King captains to ready the army.

missions.localised_description: The thrall reports that the Greenskins have gathered in great numbers around the Pillar of Bone and that their Shamans are engaged in one of their primitive rituals to their gods, Gork and Mork. Mannfred fingers his sword thoughtfully then calls to his Wight King captains to ready the army.
Success
Success

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having realised the limits that mortality placed on him, Heinrich Kemmler made it his life’s work to escape them. He became a great and much-feared Necromancer... until his rivals brought him to his knees. Now he wanders the land, his body broken and his mind blasted. However, somewhere within, his innate lust for power still burns. As his faltering steps take him close to an ancient barrow he hears a whisper that cuts through the chaotic whirl of his shattered thoughts. Almost unbidden, the words of summoning form on Kemmler’s lips.

missions.localised_description: Having realised the limits that mortality placed on him, Heinrich Kemmler made it his life’s work to escape them. He became a great and much-feared Necromancer... until his rivals brought him to his knees. Now he wanders the land, his body broken and his mind blasted. However, somewhere within, his innate lust for power still burns. As his faltering steps take him close to an ancient barrow he hears a whisper that cuts through the chaotic whirl of his shattered thoughts. Almost unbidden, the words of summoning form on Kemmler’s lips.

localised_description.last_approved_text: “What iss thy will, Masssster?” the thoughts enter Kemmler’s head, resonating like the echoes of a crypt. The Necromancer’s unfocussed gaze shifts to take in an imposing figure, clad in tarnished gold and bronze armour, which stands before the barrow’s broken door stone. The blazing eyes of the Wight King are a fixed point around which Kemmler’s thoughts coalesce and steady themselves. Though covered in sores and clad in beggar’s rags, the black tendrils of necromantic power wind through his frame and he is the Lichemaster once more. “Bring… the others” he croaks.

missions.localised_description: “What iss thy will, Masssster?” the thoughts enter Kemmler’s head, resonating like the echoes of a crypt. The Necromancer’s unfocussed gaze shifts to take in an imposing figure, clad in tarnished gold and bronze armour, which stands before the barrow’s broken door stone. The blazing eyes of the Wight King are a fixed point around which Kemmler’s thoughts coalesce and steady themselves. Though covered in sores and clad in beggar’s rags, the black tendrils of necromantic power wind through his frame and he is the Lichemaster once more. “Bring… the others” he croaks.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Heinrich Kemmler, his mind restored, surveys the silent groups of armoured Wights arrayed before him. He raises his eyes to the distant mountain peaks which he wandered for so long during his madness. Some impulse draws him back there. Possibly it is a last vestige of the once-mad, but his days of plundering Wizard's towers and temples in his search for dark truths have taught him to trust his instincts. Some source of power lies in those peaks, and Kemmler intends to find it.

missions.localised_description: Heinrich Kemmler, his mind restored, surveys the silent groups of armoured Wights arrayed before him. He raises his eyes to the distant mountain peaks which he wandered for so long during his madness. Some impulse draws him back there. Possibly it is a last vestige of the once-mad, but his days of plundering Wizard's towers and temples in his search for dark truths have taught him to trust his instincts. Some source of power lies in those peaks, and Kemmler intends to find it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Some vestiges of Kemmler's old power have begun to leech back into his emaciated form. He feels ready to seek out the nexus he sensed. Sending a scout to establish its precise location, Kemmler readies himself for the challenge to come.

missions.localised_description: Some vestiges of Kemmler's old power have begun to leech back into his emaciated form. He feels ready to seek out the nexus he sensed. Sending a scout to establish its precise location, Kemmler readies himself for the challenge to come.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Some vestiges of Kemmler's old power have begun to leech back into his emaciated form. He feels ready to seek out the nexus he sensed. Sending a scout to establish its precise location, Kemmler readies himself for the challenge to come.

missions.localised_description: Some vestiges of Kemmler's old power have begun to leech back into his emaciated form. He feels ready to seek out the nexus he sensed. Sending a scout to establish its precise location, Kemmler readies himself for the challenge to come.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Morbidly questing after the secrets of death, a Necromancer deeply steeped in the lore of the dead stands on the threshold between worlds, neither wholly alive, nor one of the Undead. As a Master Necromancer, Heinrich Kemmler’s thirst for power has seen him plunder countless lichyards and sacred tombs in search of ominous artefacts or the raw materials for his hideous arcane experiments. Now the Lichemaster is on the trail of the resting place of an ancient tribal King: Marbad of the Endal tribe. Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire. A once-powerful man, his tomb will doubtless contain vestiges of his great spirit, and Kemmler intends to bend this to his own purposes. The search begins in the libraries and archives of the Empire.

missions.localised_description: Morbidly questing after the secrets of death, a Necromancer deeply steeped in the lore of the dead stands on the threshold between worlds, neither wholly alive, nor one of the Undead. As a Master Necromancer, Heinrich Kemmler’s thirst for power has seen him plunder countless lichyards and sacred tombs in search of ominous artefacts or the raw materials for his hideous arcane experiments. Now the Lichemaster is on the trail of the resting place of an ancient tribal King: Marbad of the Endal tribe. Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire. A once-powerful man, his tomb will doubtless contain vestiges of his great spirit, and Kemmler intends to bend this to his own purposes. The search begins in the libraries and archives of the Empire.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The ravaged lands are in turmoil. Refugees and fugitives clog the roads, attempting to flee the area. Kemmler has received word that many ancient tomes from the great archive in Altdorf have been loaded into wagons to be taken to safety. By intercepting travellers in the area, Kemmler hopes to lay his hands on the load and find the clues he seeks.

missions.localised_description: The ravaged lands are in turmoil. Refugees and fugitives clog the roads, attempting to flee the area. Kemmler has received word that many ancient tomes from the great archive in Altdorf have been loaded into wagons to be taken to safety. By intercepting travellers in the area, Kemmler hopes to lay his hands on the load and find the clues he seeks.

localised_description.last_approved_text: King Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire. He fell in battle against a Greenskin horde, sacrificing himself to save the man who would unite the tribes of men into the Empire. Such greatness of spirit is a noble thing for most men, but to Kemmler it represents only a potential source of power waiting to be tapped. The tomb will doubtless contain vestiges of Marbad’s spirit, and Kemmler intends to bend this to his own purposes. Texts looted from the Empire’s scriptoriums indicate a location somewhere in Middenland, but the exact site remains a secret, almost certainly to deter the activities of fiends such as Kemmler. He despatches an agent to search Middenland for further clues.

Texts looted from the Empire’s scriptoriums indicate a location somewhere in Middenland, but the exact site remains a secret, almost certainly to deter the activities of fiends such as Kemmler. He despatches an agent to search Middenland for further clues.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The abbey at La Maisontaal in northern Bretonnia has long held Heinrich Kemmler’s interest. It is a major centre of worship for the nature god, Taal, and is therefore worthy of destruction in Kemmler’s eyes. More significantly, it serves as a repository for several powerful artefacts. Unfortunately, the abbey is well defended by the forces of the local Duke, meaning that any straightforward attack upon it would prove costly. Fortunately the Lichemaster has a plan of pleasingly wicked deviousness. First of all he requires raw materials.

missions.localised_description: The abbey at La Maisontaal in northern Bretonnia has long held Heinrich Kemmler’s interest. It is a major centre of worship for the nature god, Taal, and is therefore worthy of destruction in Kemmler’s eyes. More significantly, it serves as a repository for several powerful artefacts. Unfortunately, the abbey is well defended by the forces of the local Duke, meaning that any straightforward attack upon it would prove costly. Fortunately the Lichemaster has a plan of pleasingly wicked deviousness. First of all he requires raw materials.

localised_description.last_approved_text: His first plan having failed, Kemmler decides to proceed with caution, hoping that an opportunity will present itself. He sets watch upon the abbey and waits for news.

missions.localised_description: His first plan having failed, Kemmler decides to proceed with caution, hoping that an opportunity will present itself. He sets watch upon the abbey and waits for news.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the last Empire warrior is cut down, Kemmler drives his Crypt Ghouls away. They hiss and gibber resentfully, keen to feast upon the new corpse flesh, but the Lichemaster needs these cadavers unblemished for his scheme to work. He takes up the dark puppet strings of Necromancy and soon a band of Empire troops stands before him once more with only the odd spatter of gore and their dead eyes betraying their true nature. With a rasping chuckle, Kemmler sets off for Axe Bite Pass, the main route through the Grey Mountains for pilgrims travelling to the abbey. Once there, he intends to have his new ‘Empire recruits’ waylay pilgrims as they make their way through the pass. Once word of this supposed aggression reaches the Abbey, it would be strange if there is no response, and Kemmler will be ready to capitalise on the ensuing strife.

missions.localised_description: As the last Empire warrior is cut down, Kemmler drives his Crypt Ghouls away. They hiss and gibber resentfully, keen to feast upon the new corpse flesh, but the Lichemaster needs these cadavers unblemished for his scheme to work. He takes up the dark puppet strings of Necromancy and soon a band of Empire troops stands before him once more with only the odd spatter of gore and their dead eyes betraying their true nature. With a rasping chuckle, Kemmler sets off for Axe Bite Pass, the main route through the Grey Mountains for pilgrims travelling to the abbey. Once there, he intends to have his new ‘Empire recruits’ waylay pilgrims as they make their way through the pass. Once word of this supposed aggression reaches the Abbey, it would be strange if there is no response, and Kemmler will be ready to capitalise on the ensuing strife.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kemmler's watchers report that a rich and elderly merchant has taken up residence in the lay quarters of the abbey. It seems that the man is originally from the Empire but made his fortune working the trade through the pass. Originally hailing from Talabecland, he the merchant is a devotee of Taal. He has come to spend his final years at the abbey, and has used his fortune to employ a band of mercenaries from his homeland to see him safely through the pass one last time. The mercenaries remain at the abbey, awaiting a suitable contract from another passing merchant. Kemmler spots an opportunity but it is one that will require the services of a silver-tongued temptress.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kemmler sends a scout to the Abbey to see what effect his wicked scheme has had on its denizens.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having summoned a lesser Vampire from Sylvania, Kemmler dispatches her to la Maisontaal. Her task is to use her exotic beauty to beguile the leader of the mercenaries into accepting a contract to attack the abbey's defenders.

missions.localised_description: Having summoned a lesser Vampire from Sylvania, Kemmler dispatches her to la Maisontaal. Her task is to use her exotic beauty to beguile the leader of the mercenaries into accepting a contract to attack the abbey's defenders.

localised_description.last_approved_text: While the first Vampire Count, Vlad von Carstein, was the most physically powerful of the Vampire Counts, Mannfred was far more cunning. And when Vlad was slain during the climactic battle of the Vampire Wars, Mannfred did not involve himself in the infighting that followed. Instead, he travelled far and wide, seeking to deepen his knowledge of Necromantic lore and dark artefacts. Now that Mannfred has returned to Sylvania, he is more powerful than ever. Having asserted his dominance, he makes preparations to unearth some of the evil relics that his studies hinted at.

missions.localised_description: While the first Vampire Count, Vlad von Carstein, was the most physically powerful of the Vampire Counts, Mannfred was far more cunning. And when Vlad was slain during the climactic battle of the Vampire Wars, Mannfred did not involve himself in the infighting that followed. Instead, he travelled far and wide, seeking to deepen his knowledge of Necromantic lore and dark artefacts. Now that Mannfred has returned to Sylvania, he is more powerful than ever. Having asserted his dominance, he makes preparations to unearth some of the evil relics that his studies hinted at.

localised_description.last_approved_text: During his studies amongst the bone-dry papyrus and scrolls made of skin in the ancient city of Lahmia, Count Mannfred uncovered several references to a suit of mail imbued with great power. In ages past, the armour’s original owner, a king of Nehekhara, fell in battle somewhere in the southern Badlands - beyond this the armour passes from the record. The Count summons a Necromancer. Though quite mad, the man is adept at rooting out forbidden knowledge, like all those of his benighted kind. He should prove ideal for the task of seeking out any traces of the lost king.

missions.localised_description: During his studies amongst the bone-dry papyrus and scrolls made of skin in the ancient city of Lahmia, Count Mannfred uncovered several references to a suit of mail imbued with great power. In ages past, the armour’s original owner, a king of Nehekhara, fell in battle somewhere in the southern Badlands - beyond this the armour passes from the record. The Count summons a Necromancer. Though quite mad, the man is adept at rooting out forbidden knowledge, like all those of his benighted kind. He should prove ideal for the task of seeking out any traces of the lost king.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Savage Orcs routed, Count Mannfred draws upon his dark arts, dragging the reluctant spirit of the dead Nehekharan king back to the surface. It seems that the king’s army was scattered by a sudden sandstorm, and slain by a horde of Greenskins. The Greenskin Warboss, Grudsnik, stripped the king's corpse of the magnificent armour. The spirit knows no more, and Count Mannfred releases it. The name of Grudsnik is known to the Vampire Lord. Grudsnik da Magnificent was once the scourge of Bretonnia. Such was his reputation that his followers built a great burial mound for him protected by Shamanic fetishes. Such wards are of little concern to Mannfred, and he now sends the Necromancer west to scout out the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: To ordinary men, the Necromancer is a vile, withered thing, willing to trade the last shreds of his soul in exchange for the forbidden knowledge of the grave. Yet this impudent ambition can on occasion prove of use to a true lord of death such as Count Mannfred. As they strive for petty advantage over each other, these vermin are adept at worming out hidden lore, and it would seem that one of them has unearthed just such a secret now. The Vampire Count issues a summon to his benighted court.

missions.localised_description: To ordinary men, the Necromancer is a vile, withered thing, willing to trade the last shreds of his soul in exchange for the forbidden knowledge of the grave. Yet this impudent ambition can on occasion prove of use to a true lord of death such as Count Mannfred. As they strive for petty advantage over each other, these vermin are adept at worming out hidden lore, and it would seem that one of them has unearthed just such a secret now. The Vampire Count issues a summon to his benighted court.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Necromancer does not fawn and grovel in Mannfred’s presence like so many of their cretinous kind. Instead, he dares to bargain and even threaten a Vampire Count at the height of his power! Mannfred is intrigued. It would seem that this worm has stumbled across a dark tome of ominous power. Count Mannfred is, of course, welcome to the book - for a price. With a sly smile, the Necromancer lets it be known that he has placed a curse in its pages, destroying the book should he come to harm. It would seem that Mannfred must meet his petty demand… for now.

missions.localised_description: This Necromancer does not fawn and grovel in Mannfred’s presence like so many of their cretinous kind. Instead, he dares to bargain and even threaten a Vampire Count at the height of his power! Mannfred is intrigued. It would seem that this worm has stumbled across a dark tome of ominous power. Count Mannfred is, of course, welcome to the book - for a price. With a sly smile, the Necromancer lets it be known that he has placed a curse in its pages, destroying the book should he come to harm. It would seem that Mannfred must meet his petty demand… for now.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This was a book that eluded his earlier studies. Delving within the ancient flayed skin covers of the fell tome, the Count finds much of interest. Amongst the pages is an examination of binding; funnelling Dark Magic into ancient physical artefacts. When a great quantity of spirit essence is released, it can be harnessed and bound into an item through the use of magical power. Mannfred knows of such a locus, an Arcane Fulcrum of bone deep in the Badlands. It is where Greenskins gather to conduct their pathetic shamanic rites. He dispatches one of his minions to survey the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
There is no hearth the White Dwarf calls home. He wanders the Karaz Ankor, mostly in disguise, with hooded cloak hiding his face, if not his magnificent beard. When Dwarfkind is in trouble, when an ancient grudge needs settling, then Grombrindal will be there to lend his legendary axe and mighty skills in battle - a great boon for any throng!

In most cases, it is the White Dwarf that seeks out such peril. He will arrive unheralded before, or even during, battle - when all looks lost. However, there have been occasions when Grombrindal has been 'summoned'. If the tales hold true, opening a cask and pouring a flagon of the local master brewer's most precious ale - all while cursing the Black Goblin in flawless ancient Khazalid - mean the White Dwarf will appear soon after.

That is how a group of renowned Rangers claimed to get Grombrindal's attention. After the White Dwarf had quaffed his flagon of Bugman's Troll Chaser (so called, as all you want to do is find and kill a Troll after one swig), the Rangers relayed their message - that none other than the greatest Brewmaster himself, Josef Bugman, was in need of the White Dwarf's aid. Grombrindal, helped himself to another flagon and downed it in one. After wiping his whiskers with his sleeve, he bade the Rangers accompany him to the Grey Mountains and from there to Bugman's Brewery. As the Rangers broke camp, none dared to enquire as to why Grombrindal's armour was missing many of its fine scales, and the White Dwarf himself certainly didn't care to mention it.
