In most cases, it is the White Dwarf that seeks out such peril. He will arrive unheralded before, or even during, battle - when all looks lost. However, there have been occasions when Grombrindal has been 'summoned'. If the tales hold true, opening a cask and pouring a flagon of the local master brewer's most precious ale - all while cursing the Black Goblin in flawless ancient Khazalid - mean the White Dwarf will appear soon after.

That is how a group of renowned Rangers claimed to get Grombrindal's attention. After the White Dwarf had quaffed his flagon of Bugman's Troll Chaser (so called, as all you want to do is find and kill a Troll after one swig), the Rangers relayed their message - that none other than the greatest Brewmaster himself, Josef Bugman, was in need of the White Dwarf's aid. Grombrindal, helped himself to another flagon and downed it in one. After wiping his whiskers with his sleeve, he bade the Rangers accompany him to the Grey Mountains and from there to Bugman's Brewery. As the Rangers broke camp, none dared to enquire as to why Grombrindal's armour was missing many of its fine scales, and the White Dwarf himself certainly didn't care to mention it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: These are dark days indeed. The foothills of the Grey Mountains swarm with grobi and Beastmen. The White Dwarf has killed many of these creatures in his long life and yet they still seem to prosper! Despite the urgency of Josef's message, Grombrindal cannot simply let such numbers of urks - be they Greenskin or Cloven - to increase, for they will be a constant threat to all Dawi. Even with his armour in a state of disrepair, he orders his accompanying throng to ready their axes - it is war!

Even with his armour in a state of disrepair, he orders his accompanying throng to ready their axes - it is war!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Bugman's scouts have tracked the Chaos Lord and his fell Beastmen to Marbad's Tomb. The White Dwarf should bring this enemy to battle at once!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Norse Dwarfs of Kraka Drak are in peril and Grombrindal feels their need, as he does the needs of all Dawi. Eschewing his favoured method of travelling incognito, the White Dwarf gathers a throng and heads north to help his Norse kin, even as Great King Thorgard Cromson seals the Hold and prepares for war.\n\nThe White Dwarf despises urks, but reserves a special hatred for the forces of Chaos, for it was the Ruinous Powers that took his kin and liege, Grimnir, away. The revered Ancestor was last seen millennia ago wandering into the Chaos Wastes. Before marching north, Grombrindal sets his Rune Axe on an Oath Stone and pledges to slay many servants of the Dark Gods on this latest of great labours. Only when the tally has been reached will the runes in the mighty axe-head glow once more. The White Dwarf sets about this task immediately by hunting down and slaying as many of the Chaos filth as he can find.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The White Dwarf approaches Kraka Drak but the Norse Dwarfs are famously cautious, especially when facing cunning pawns like those sent by the vile God's magic and trickery. To best aid the Dawi of Kraka Drak, Grombrindal must first gain their trust.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Norse Dawi firmly in support of Grombrindal, he wastes no time mustering a great throng. But first he must bring the urks to battle, sending a scout to choose an advantageous battleground.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Does the White Dwarf commune with the Ancestor Gods? This is a question oft-asked by Longbeards at the fireside as they drink long into the night. Some say "of course", whereas others believe he is an Ancestor God himself and a few think he has no more influence in this area than any other pious Dawi.

Whatever the case, there have been persistent tales throughout the ages that Valaya looks upon Grombrindal with fondness, and even some sagas proclaiming that they were lovers at the dawn of history. After all, it is Her cloak which shrouds the legendary Dwarf warrior.

And so it was that Grombrindal received a vision from the Goddess, a new rune to be sewn into his cloak with thread spun from the hair of Dwarf maidens from the Temple of Valaya in Everpeak. The rune will light the darkest reaches of the Karaz Ankor and reveal a hidden evil to the White Dwarf...

missions.localised_description:
Does the White Dwarf commune with the Ancestor Gods? This is a question oft-asked by Longbeards at the fireside as they drink long into the night. Some say "of course", whereas others believe he is an Ancestor God himself and a few think he has no more influence in this area than any other pious Dawi.

Whatever the case, there have been persistent tales throughout the ages that Valaya looks upon Grombrindal with fondness, and even some sagas proclaiming that they were lovers at the dawn of history. After all, it is Her cloak which shrouds the legendary Dwarf warrior.

And so it was that Grombrindal received a vision from the Goddess, a new rune to be sewn into his cloak with thread spun from the hair of Dwarf maidens from the Temple of Valaya in Everpeak. The rune will light the darkest reaches of the Karaz Ankor and reveal a hidden evil to the White Dwarf...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grombrindal described the rune he had seen in his dreams to the Runesmith. The wise old Dwarf had many centuries under his belt, but was shocked by the complexity and potential power of such a marking. Although this rune was of Valaya's making - the Runesmith could see her hand all over it - it nevertheless uses elements of her brother Gods. To craft such a rune, additional knowledge would be needed; firstly from the Runesmiths in the Dwarfhold of Karak Kadrin where Grimnir's influence is strongest...

missions.localised_description: Grombrindal described the rune he had seen in his dreams to the Runesmith. The wise old Dwarf had many centuries under his belt, but was shocked by the complexity and potential power of such a marking. Although this rune was of Valaya's making - the Runesmith could see her hand all over it - it nevertheless uses elements of her brother Gods. To craft such a rune, additional knowledge would be needed; firstly from the Runesmiths in the Dwarfhold of Karak Kadrin where Grimnir's influence is strongest...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Runesmith sends word that progress has been made, but further learning is needed. This time he must travel to Karak Azul, where the residents claim direct lineage to the God of Miners and Smiths, Grungni. Within the runeforges of this Greathold are Grungni's secrets, secrets that will finally unlock the power of the Valaya's new rune...

Within the runeforges of this Greathold are Grungni's secrets, secrets that will finally unlock the power of the Valaya's new rune...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
On his way back from Karak Azul, while traversing the Underway, the Runesmith is ambushed by grobi scum! The Goblins attack but are quickly sent on their way by the enraged Dwarf and his bodyguard. It is only in the aftermath that the Runesmith realises the attack was a diversion - the thieves had stolen his copious notes on forming the new rune!

Grombrindal soon discovers that this is not mere kruti luck, but a ploy by Skarsnik, Goblin Warlord of Karak Eight Peaks. The devious gobbo has somehow learned of the Runesmith's powerful knowledge and stolen the notes, but to what actual end remains unknown.

The White Dwarf learns this tale of woe from another of Valaya's visions. The only Gromril-lining is that if this had been a chance encounter, then the Runesmith would likely have been slain there and then!

The White Dwarf is enraged at this injustice and immediately begins the hunt for the Runesmith's lore, killing all Greenskins that get in his way!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Runesmith's books and vast reams of notes on runecraft and ley-seams have been recovered, so the rune can finally be crafted. As the pattern is sewn into the cloak with a Gromril needle it does indeed begin to illuminate, with any who touch being blessed with a dread knowledge indeed. Something dead stirs in the deeps, so Grombrindal sends a pathfinder to mark the way.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Orcs and Goblins are the most detested of urks in a long litany of enemies recorded in the books of grudges that each Dwarfhold keeps sacred. The White Dwarf has slain countless Orcs and hordes of grobi in his time. He has a special hatred in his heart for Goblins, and a black-hooded one in particular!\n\nAnd now, the Greenskins gather again; a vast Waaagh! is forming in the south. The White Dwarf wastes no time, making his way in secrecy to join the throngs defending the Karaz Ankor. As soon as he reveals himself the Dawi rejoice, gather their axes and start killing the hated urki and grobi!

missions.localised_description: The Orcs and Goblins are the most detested of urks in a long litany of enemies recorded in the books of grudges that each Dwarfhold keeps sacred. The White Dwarf has slain countless Orcs and hordes of grobi in his time. He has a special hatred in his heart for Goblins, and a black-hooded one in particular!\n\nAnd now, the Greenskins gather again; a vast Waaagh! is forming in the south. The White Dwarf wastes no time, making his way in secrecy to join the throngs defending the Karaz Ankor. As soon as he reveals himself the Dawi rejoice, gather their axes and start killing the hated urki and grobi!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The Orcs and Goblins are the most detested of urks in a long litany of enemies recorded in the books of grudges that each Dwarfhold keeps sacred. The White Dwarf has slain countless Orcs and hordes of grobi in his time. He has a special hatred in his heart for Goblins, and a black-hooded one in particular!

Even with the Greenskins smashed and scattered, the world can never truly be rid of them. But the White Dwarf knows that dominating the Badlands will certainly keep the green filth at bay, even if it does not lead to their outright extinction.

There is one Orc Warboss who has survived his race's doom, who even now gathers the remnants of the tribes for the beginnings of an early Waaagh! The White Dwarf foresees the threat and so the Badlands must stay in Dawi hands.

missions.localised_description:
The Orcs and Goblins are the most detested of urks in a long litany of enemies recorded in the books of grudges that each Dwarfhold keeps sacred. The White Dwarf has slain countless Orcs and hordes of grobi in his time. He has a special hatred in his heart for Goblins, and a black-hooded one in particular!

Even with the Greenskins smashed and scattered, the world can never truly be rid of them. But the White Dwarf knows that dominating the Badlands will certainly keep the green filth at bay, even if it does not lead to their outright extinction.

There is one Orc Warboss who has survived his race's doom, who even now gathers the remnants of the tribes for the beginnings of an early Waaagh! The White Dwarf foresees the threat and so the Badlands must stay in Dawi hands.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The Waaagh! grows in power. Many of the Dwarfholds fall under attack, and the Dawi feel hard-pressed. The White Dwarf appears at the forefront of such battles, as he has done throughout history. His Rune Helm - forged in the glorious forges of Zhufbar - glows, replenishing lost Dwarfen courage, a commodity that is rarely lacking in the first place, of course.

The emboldened Dwarfs repulse the Greenskin invaders, but the urks always return - such is the power of this Waaagh!

Grombrindal knows this situation cannot be allowed to continue and so leads a throng from the gates of the Karak and into the wild. He is intent on hunting down Orc supply dumps, and hitting them hard where they live for once!

missions.localised_description:
The Waaagh! grows in power. Many of the Dwarfholds fall under attack, and the Dawi feel hard-pressed. The White Dwarf appears at the forefront of such battles, as he has done throughout history. His Rune Helm - forged in the glorious forges of Zhufbar - glows, replenishing lost Dwarfen courage, a commodity that is rarely lacking in the first place, of course.

The emboldened Dwarfs repulse the Greenskin invaders, but the urks always return - such is the power of this Waaagh!

Grombrindal knows this situation cannot be allowed to continue and so leads a throng from the gates of the Karak and into the wild. He is intent on hunting down Orc supply dumps, and hitting them hard where they live for once!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
When Grombrindal arrives at an Orc settlement he is disappointed to discover it is already a burnt out husk with piles of dead bodies everywhere. His anger rises - who would dare rob the White Dwarf of Greenskins to slay?

The answer comes quickly. Sat on a pile of Orc corpses, drinking ale from a fine horn is a half-naked Dwarf sporting a massive slice of crescent-shaped hair, it is none other than Gotrek Gurnisson! The Slayer nods a greeting as Grombrindal sits down beside him. Gotrek offers the horn, and the White Dwarf drinks mightily - although it is a thirst not truly earned. The two legends share a few words, and Gotrek makes to leave soon after, for he has an umgi poet to find. He does offer some sage advice before disappearing into the night: the Warboss at the centre of this Waaagh! is gathering together a mighty horde of monsters. Gurnisson suggests he recruit a group of Slayers he can vouch for. Gotrek would join himself, but this umgi partner of his seems to be missing and no doubt needs to rescued.

The meeting of two great Dawi heroes ends, and Grombrindal sets out to find the Slayers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Slayers now part of Grombrindal's throng, it is time to end this Warboss' Waaagh! Grombrindal sends a Thane out to find the Orc-filth's horde.

missions.localised_description: With the Slayers now part of Grombrindal's throng, it is time to end this Warboss' Waaagh! Grombrindal sends a Thane out to find the Orc-filth's horde.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Slayers now part of Grombrindal's throng, it is time to end this Warboss' Waaagh! Grombrindal sends a Thane out to find the Orc-filth's horde.

missions.localised_description: With the Slayers now part of Grombrindal's throng, it is time to end this Warboss' Waaagh! Grombrindal sends a Thane out to find the Orc-filth's horde.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The White Dwarf's throng of brave Dawi prepare to face the Chaos Lord and his Beastmen allies. As Grombrindal looks across the way he sees the Chaos Dragon - ridden by the despicable iron-clad manling of Chaos - and rages.

The Chaos Lord calls from across the desecrated tomb: "We meet again, Whitebeard. I thank my master for awarding us another chance to pluck the scales from your armour and whiskers from your beard." The dragon raises its left claw to show scales of Glimril embedded in its flesh.

Grombrindal swears long and deep in ancient Khazalid, uttering insults which haven't been spoken in centuries. The White Dwarf swings his axe in yearning for bloodshed - many urks will die this day!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A dread host of Chaos - one that has hounded the Norse Dwarfs - are deploying for a fight. They wish to spill Dawi blood upon the snow, no doubt in tribute to the vile God of rage and murder. However, the Dwarfs shall not lie meekly in the frost and ice - they are led by the White Dwarf, who has placed an oath upon his axe. Only when this legion of the damned is slaughtered will the many entwined runes upon Grombrindal's weapon burn with power again!

missions.localised_description: A dread host of Chaos - one that has hounded the Norse Dwarfs - are deploying for a fight. They wish to spill Dawi blood upon the snow, no doubt in tribute to the vile God of rage and murder. However, the Dwarfs shall not lie meekly in the frost and ice - they are led by the White Dwarf, who has placed an oath upon his axe. Only when this legion of the damned is slaughtered will the many entwined runes upon Grombrindal's weapon burn with power again!

localised_description.last_approved_text: An Undead host has been discovered making its way into the roots of the mountains. The creatures were moving under a devious magical veil that left even Valaya blind to their whereabouts, so she tasked the White Dwarf with adding a new rune to Her cloak to pierce this deceit!\n\nThe rune is now in place and the location of the Undead has been revealed. Although the cloak has been drained of its usual properties, they will no doubt return when this grudge has been settled! The White Dwarf must purge this Undead incursion into the Karaz Ankor at once!

missions.localised_description: An Undead host has been discovered making its way into the roots of the mountains. The creatures were moving under a devious magical veil that left even Valaya blind to their whereabouts, so she tasked the White Dwarf with adding a new rune to Her cloak to pierce this deceit!\n\nThe rune is now in place and the location of the Undead has been revealed. Although the cloak has been drained of its usual properties, they will no doubt return when this grudge has been settled! The White Dwarf must purge this Undead incursion into the Karaz Ankor at once!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Orc lairs destroyed and razed thanks to Grombrindal and Gotrek's earlier efforts, the Waaagh! finds itself isolated, unable to sustain itself and eventually doomed. But rather than let it limp on and eventually succumb to infighting, there are many grudges against its Warboss to settle. There is no better time to strike!\n\nGrombrindal lures the Orcs to a battlefield of his choosing, using a simple bait and switch manoeuvre with volunteers from Karak Azul. And so it is that Rune Helm will glow bright, instilling Dwarfs with heart and courage at Thundering Falls!

missions.localised_description: With the Orc lairs destroyed and razed thanks to Grombrindal and Gotrek's earlier efforts, the Waaagh! finds itself isolated, unable to sustain itself and eventually doomed. But rather than let it limp on and eventually succumb to infighting, there are many grudges against its Warboss to settle. There is no better time to strike!\n\nGrombrindal lures the Orcs to a battlefield of his choosing, using a simple bait and switch manoeuvre with volunteers from Karak Azul. And so it is that Rune Helm will glow bright, instilling Dwarfs with heart and courage at Thundering Falls!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Sylvania has been in decline. No longer is it feared as the dread land where the dead do not rest, but instead seen as Stirland's bastard child! Now Vlad - progenitor of the von Carsteins is abroad once again - it is time for the Vampires to take dominion over their haunted realm.

missions.localised_description: Sylvania has been in decline. No longer is it feared as the dread land where the dead do not rest, but instead seen as Stirland's bastard child! Now Vlad - progenitor of the von Carsteins is abroad once again - it is time for the Vampires to take dominion over their haunted realm.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The von Carsteins' influence must spread across all of Sylvania and beyond into the Empire itself if they are to realise their Imperial ambitions. But before they can rule, a powerbase should be established and fresh troops risen for the challenges ahead.

missions.localised_description: The von Carsteins' influence must spread across all of Sylvania and beyond into the Empire itself if they are to realise their Imperial ambitions. But before they can rule, a powerbase should be established and fresh troops risen for the challenges ahead.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: The Spread of Undeath

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: The Spread of Undeath

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now is the time for Fell Bats to blot out the sun, for gloom to fall upon the lands of the living and the Long Night to begin. The von Carsteins' dominion shall extend far and wide if the prophecies in the Liber Noctus are to come true.

missions.localised_description: Now is the time for Fell Bats to blot out the sun, for gloom to fall upon the lands of the living and the Long Night to begin. The von Carsteins' dominion shall extend far and wide if the prophecies in the Liber Noctus are to come true.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The von Carsteins' fell influence saturates the lands, but for the scions of Sigmar's Blood to truly fear the power of the Vampires then all the Old World must be taken in their name. Nothing is beyond the reach of the Midnight Aristocracy!

missions.localised_description: The von Carsteins' fell influence saturates the lands, but for the scions of Sigmar's Blood to truly fear the power of the Vampires then all the Old World must be taken in their name. Nothing is beyond the reach of the Midnight Aristocracy!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

localised_description.last_approved_text: The time is now - Vlad von Carstein must make his move to take Sigmar's throne or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. The Midnight Aristocracy will rule over all - as Eternal Emperors - immortal Kings that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

missions.localised_description: The time is now - Vlad von Carstein must make his move to take Sigmar's throne or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. The Midnight Aristocracy will rule over all - as Eternal Emperors - immortal Kings that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

localised_description.last_approved_text: The time is now - Vlad von Carstein must make his move to take Sigmar's throne or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. The Midnight Aristocracy will rule over all - as Eternal Emperors - immortal Kings that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

missions.localised_description: The time is now - Vlad von Carstein must make his move to take Sigmar's throne or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. The Midnight Aristocracy will rule over all - as Eternal Emperors - immortal Kings that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The moon hangs low and red, like some engorged tumour, casting its crimson half-light across all of Sylvania. Isabella von Carstein watches it slink along the horizon and plots her next move.\n\nThough she and her husband Vlad have established themselves at the very summit of the Midnight Aristocracy, there are those who would yet try to undo them. To keep them at bay, Isabella must therefore employ ever darker methods. Whilst she plots and prepares, however, she must know more about her foes. As the blood red moon holds its sanguine gaze, she gives flight to a trusted agent; a speck against the celestial opposition, looming down from the heavens.

missions.localised_description: The moon hangs low and red, like some engorged tumour, casting its crimson half-light across all of Sylvania. Isabella von Carstein watches it slink along the horizon and plots her next move.\n\nThough she and her husband Vlad have established themselves at the very summit of the Midnight Aristocracy, there are those who would yet try to undo them. To keep them at bay, Isabella must therefore employ ever darker methods. Whilst she plots and prepares, however, she must know more about her foes. As the blood red moon holds its sanguine gaze, she gives flight to a trusted agent; a speck against the celestial opposition, looming down from the heavens.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The moon has passed into cloud and, when Isabella's agent returns, Sylvania is shrouded in a dark and baleful night. He speaks of insipid Sigmarites amassing nearby, and the Vampire matriarch knows that the Empire only ever comes bearing one thing - destruction. Her blood, such as it is, rises as the realisation dawns like a new moon; if they want war, then war they shall have!

missions.localised_description: The moon has passed into cloud and, when Isabella's agent returns, Sylvania is shrouded in a dark and baleful night. He speaks of insipid Sigmarites amassing nearby, and the Vampire matriarch knows that the Empire only ever comes bearing one thing - destruction. Her blood, such as it is, rises as the realisation dawns like a new moon; if they want war, then war they shall have!

localised_description.last_approved_text: When battle is done, the fields are soaked in less cruor than Isabella expected, or indeed desired. Such paltry forces could not really have been meant for her - for they were no threat at all, and could never challenge her Undead hegemony. There must be more to their machinations, she muses, as she drags terrified and hapless captive Empire soldiers into the bowels of her fortress to extract information in cruel and unusual ways.\n\nTheir dying gasps reveal that they were sent to capture not Vampires, but worshippers of Chaos - the savage, depraved Beastmen. Isabella is intrigued, even as her charges scream in agony. If she could deal with the Beastmen herself, the power they seek could be hers instead...

missions.localised_description: When battle is done, the fields are soaked in less cruor than Isabella expected, or indeed desired. Such paltry forces could not really have been meant for her - for they were no threat at all, and could never challenge her Undead hegemony. There must be more to their machinations, she muses, as she drags terrified and hapless captive Empire soldiers into the bowels of her fortress to extract information in cruel and unusual ways.\n\nTheir dying gasps reveal that they were sent to capture not Vampires, but worshippers of Chaos - the savage, depraved Beastmen. Isabella is intrigued, even as her charges scream in agony. If she could deal with the Beastmen herself, the power they seek could be hers instead...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen are arrayed in their usual fashion - a random collection of hooves and grunts that bear no discernible sense of order - dangerous, yet chaotic. And there is something different about them this time - they hum with an unnatural radiance, shining with an entirely disconcerting power. Yet despite this, Isabella will not allow them to best her. She will drive them back, destroy them, and from their broken bones and bloodied horns discover their secrets!

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen are arrayed in their usual fashion - a random collection of hooves and grunts that bear no discernible sense of order - dangerous, yet chaotic. And there is something different about them this time - they hum with an unnatural radiance, shining with an entirely disconcerting power. Yet despite this, Isabella will not allow them to best her. She will drive them back, destroy them, and from their broken bones and bloodied horns discover their secrets!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen have been destroyed. Isabella and her forces begin picking through the desiccated remains, eventually discovering a horn, thick with foul and pestilent blood, yet glowing with an alluring and altogether otherworldly aura. Though she cannot be sure, the sense of great darkness and dread leads Isabella to believe that this horn is one of the fabled Ruinous Gifts, bestowed upon the Beastmen by the Chaos Gods themselves. Although fascinated by it, Isabella knows that consuming this God-blighted cruor would tear her apart. She must consult those who know of these things - the dark and twisted Necromancers - to reveal more.

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen have been destroyed. Isabella and her forces begin picking through the desiccated remains, eventually discovering a horn, thick with foul and pestilent blood, yet glowing with an alluring and altogether otherworldly aura. Though she cannot be sure, the sense of great darkness and dread leads Isabella to believe that this horn is one of the fabled Ruinous Gifts, bestowed upon the Beastmen by the Chaos Gods themselves. Although fascinated by it, Isabella knows that consuming this God-blighted cruor would tear her apart. She must consult those who know of these things - the dark and twisted Necromancers - to reveal more.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beneath a newly-risen blood moon, the Necromancers toil at their studies. Then, by the grim red light, they report their findings, revealing that the blood of Chaos can be purged and harnessed through completion of an ancient ritual, after which Isabella may safely consume it. The ritual requires, as these things so often do, a massive, living sacrifice, something on a scale that even Isabella finds shocking. The souls and blood would must then be stored inside a precious von Carstein heirloom. Isabella, already excited by the scale of the slaughter to come, fetches an ancient, exquisite chalice that was given to her by her great-grandmother, Countess Bathori, and readies herself to fill it.

missions.localised_description: Beneath a newly-risen blood moon, the Necromancers toil at their studies. Then, by the grim red light, they report their findings, revealing that the blood of Chaos can be purged and harnessed through completion of an ancient ritual, after which Isabella may safely consume it. The ritual requires, as these things so often do, a massive, living sacrifice, something on a scale that even Isabella finds shocking. The souls and blood would must then be stored inside a precious von Carstein heirloom. Isabella, already excited by the scale of the slaughter to come, fetches an ancient, exquisite chalice that was given to her by her great-grandmother, Countess Bathori, and readies herself to fill it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the slaughter over at last, the crimson moon seems pale now by comparison to the sanguine-soaked, beet-red settlements laid waste by Isabella. Through the Necromancers' spells the chalice hums with heathen energy, having consumed countless souls. Isabella knows that her time has almost come. According to her dark magicians only one stage remains: she must defile the resting place of a great and mighty soul. She knows of no greater soul than Marbad, First of the Elector Counts, and interred nearby. Soon, Isabella muses, she will sup on the blood of the Chaos Gods themselves! Gathering her forces beneath the cowering moon, she sets out for his tomb with unmatched thirst.

missions.localised_description: With the slaughter over at last, the crimson moon seems pale now by comparison to the sanguine-soaked, beet-red settlements laid waste by Isabella. Through the Necromancers' spells the chalice hums with heathen energy, having consumed countless souls. Isabella knows that her time has almost come. According to her dark magicians only one stage remains: she must defile the resting place of a great and mighty soul. She knows of no greater soul than Marbad, First of the Elector Counts, and interred nearby. Soon, Isabella muses, she will sup on the blood of the Chaos Gods themselves! Gathering her forces beneath the cowering moon, she sets out for his tomb with unmatched thirst.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As expected, the tomb is defended by a retinue of zealous, ignorant Empire troops. Standing between Isabella and her prize, the living fools are lined up before the tomb. Having travelled so far and achieved so much in the name of greatness, she will brook no resistance - smashing these fools apart to claim what she is rightfully owed - a power beyond any in history!
